text: Can 33 cl. Pours a hazt golden with a small, white head. Massively - and somewhat offputting - dank aroma. Lightish body, very fruity, quite some fresh aroma hops leading up to a dry and bitter finish. I never was a fan of that rough Stone aroma.... 190617

330ml can. Pours a hazy orange with a small white head. Nose is mango, pineapple, blood orange, grapefruit, sweet malts, grainy malt hops and some pine. Light mouth feel. Taste is like a tropical fruit bowl with a nice sweet caramel malt back bone. Big bitterness kicks in. Nice resinous feel on the palate. Long lasting dry bitter finish. Bloody fantastic !
0,33l can at Sorry Mom Liquor store ,athens.Pours hazy golden.Small one finger lasting foam.Aromas of citrus,tropical fruits.Bitter with bitter lasting aftertaste.Overall a great IPA.

Nagy, tartós hab, borostyán szín. Fűszeres, citrusos, déligyümölcsös illat. Komplex ízvilág, gyakorlatilag nem lehet külön érezni a különböző aromákat, gyümölcsös és fűszeres alkotók viszik a prímet. Könnyű, erősen szénsavas és keserű, leheletnyi gyantával. Finom, jól csúszó sör, bár egész estés italhoz egy kissé keserűbb a kelleténél.

Can from Beer52. Hazy pale amber-red with about the right amount of fizz. Big tropical fruit aroma continues into the flavour - papaya, mango and peach. Grapefruit pith and light pine come in by the end. Lightly bitter in the dry finish. Mega-tasty, very refreshing and more-should, this is bang on!

33 cl. can @ Home. Brewed in Berlin.
Aroma: quite intense and very good aromas of passion fruit, grapefruit, tropical fruits, mango. A quite high amount of malts aromas begin to show up in the background as the beer is swirled and warmed.
Appearance: light to medium golden color with slightly off-white head. Medium head thickness. Creamy head made of medium to big sized bubbles. Hazy beer. Medium retention. No Brussels lacing. 
Taste: low sweetness, high bitterness, very low sourness. Flavors of grapefruit, passion fruit, tropical fruits. Hints of citrus, pine, resin. Balance is toward the hops. Massive amount of hops.
Palate: low to medium body, watery to oily texture, high carbonation, very long and dry finish of grapefruit, tropical fruits, passion fruit with some citrus, resin and pine.
Overall: very good appearance, aromas and flavors. Quite bitter but thirst quenching and refreshing. The bitterness is a little bit harsh, but its a good IPA. A lot of flavor with quite low alcohol level. Well brewed!. I think it would be better with a bit of malt sweetness counterpart.

can. Poured hazy straw coloured with a rocky white head. Sweet citrus fruit, hopped up aroma. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, a bit astringent finishing. Flavour of bready malt up front followed by pithy grapefruit peel with a touch of peppery spice.

Can from Fakta, Tilst. (Canned in Berlin). Pours golden orange with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, citrus, tropical fruits, lemon, grapefruit, hops. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Bitter hoppy finish.
Lata. golden. hoppy citrus fresh aroma. Flavour: hoppy citrus, fruitish , dry, good bitterness, sweet. yummmm

Pale amber. Citrus, grape and pine. Dryish taste, followed by a full hoppy flavour. Finishes quite bitter. Medium body, and a watery mouthfeel. Overall, a good session IPA. More hoppy and bitter than others I have tried. The lack of malty flavours makes it a bit one-dimensional, but it is very refreshing.

Can. 4.7%. Best before 29.12.17. Brewed in Berlin. Pours a slightly hazy, pale, straw yellow, with an off-white head. Decent, spotty lacing. Sweetish, fruity, mango hop aroma. Citrusy, zesty hints as it warms. Same flavour, with fledgling, spicy hints. Bitter hop finish, the bitterness feels a tad liquorice-y. More mango. Overall good. 11.06.17.
Golden coloured beer with an huge frothy white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and a some floral notes. Flavor is citrus, biting pine and lots of grape fruit.. Medium to heavy palate. Smooth finish
An american, amber, foggy IPA with white head. Aroma is malt, hops, citrus. Taste bitter sweet.

Pours a hazy golden colour. Smells piney and just super hoppy. This is a light beer and really easy to drink. The flavour and aroma from the hops is, I don't know, just awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can at home. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma medium malty (bread) and hoppy (citrus, piney). Flavor medium sweet and bitter, light spicy, long lasting. Medium body.

Can. Pours gorgeous pale amber with a fat white foam residing. Scent is lovely sweet properties of hops. Taste is consistent and quite mild with properties of herbs. A bit plain for a beer from 2000 miles away. Dry. Very good.

2 month old can from Stone Berlin (4,7%). Hazy golden with a small white head. Slightly sweaty hops, pine, peach stone, malty aroma. Hoppy, pine, grassy, slight caramel, slight citrus peel flavour. Moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Dry bitter finish. Not bad.
Hazy golden appearance with a short white head. Grape, pine grass and citrus aroma. Taste of grape, hoppy freshness and som floral notes.
God og spændende amerikansk IPA. Fin smag af humle. Særdeles frisk smag. Kan anbefales. Købt i Fakta

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Hazy/turbid yellow/golden beer with a slight off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Super fresh fruity hops and a decent malt flavour as well. Great appearance, but a decent palate.
Klares Orangegold mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, fruchtig, Orangen, Zitrus, etwas Honigmelone, trocken, leicht herb.
Decent. Quite fizzy, lively. Solidt amount of bittering hops, but little body, as perhaps to be expected.
golden, hazy, minimal head, citrus, floral, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, medium sweetness, very bitter,

German brewed version from tap at Naiv, Frankfurt. Pours slightly hazy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of hop, mint leaves, citrus and tropical fruit. Moderate sweetness, medium bitterness. Light to medium body, slight oily texture, sligthly above average carbonation. Decent brew.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2017 Can. A very good IPA. A typical American style IPA. Very light color like its supposed to be. Nice and hoppy. Maybe not very complex but absolutely recommended.

Cloudy pale gold under a small quick fading white head. Nose is bright citrus and tropical fruit with some pine and honey notes. Flavour follows with a light sweet start leading to a medium bitter middle and finish. Mouth is a bit thin as expected from a session with average carbonation and a lingering bitter finish.

8/4/7/3/15
Can. Pours hazy peach colored. Cream colored head. Aroma is pine and passion fruit. Bitter, fruity, citrus. Quite nice.
Cloudy lemon with minimal white head. Minimal aroma, crisp and clean. Flavor of grapefruit and grass, very hoppy and astringent. Harsh finish, which rather ruins it a bit.
33cl can at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle fruity sweetness. Citrus, tangerine, pine and subtle caramel. Tasty!

A: cloudy straw with a big white head
N: Pine, citrus, jelly babies
T: Bitter, dank, citrus, pine 
P: Medium
O: Certainly a go-to. All the flavours of an APA on offer
16oz can light golden pour with frothy white head very carbonated aroma was tropical fruit taste is grapefruit and hops i enjoyed this

Canned, 0.33 l.
Somewhat opal golden colour, bigger sized broad pored white head.
Nose brings tropical fruits, bread...
Taste of mango, pine and grapefruit, aroma has bread, citrusses, herbs and flowers, mouthfeel is slick.
Bittersweet, earthy-resiny finish, which leaves a lingering grapefruity aftertaste behind...
Can from Tesco Extra, Longton. Pours golden with an off white head. Big juicy hops, some resin. Very fruity.

Belle couleur blonde, bonne amertume, légèrement herbacée, bien houblonnée, la bulle est bien fine, le goût est pas mal porté sur les fruits exotiques et une bonne longueur en bouche malgré le taux dalcool à moins de 5 degrés. Une bonne bière dété, et un bon souvenir de la californie...

Aroma; rubber, tropical herbs, fruits, pale juicy malts with gum resin notes.
Look; off white head, tropical golden clear body. 
Taste; tropical fruit, juicy resin, pale malt, juicy tail.
Feel; very good mouthfeel, fullbodied, smooth and all.
Overall; quality.

Orange spritzy look with a decent frothy head. Tart citrus and loads of sweet hops. A different but very nice beer.

Aroma: onions, herbs, wet socks, pine.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: medium stalky bitterness, wet socks, spring onions, watery and dry.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, stalky finish.
Overall: really poor session IPA, spring onions and wet socks, what the hell ...

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Puszka 330ml. Metnawy zloty kolor. Piana biala,srednia,pozostaje w szkle. Wyrazne nuty owocow tropikalnych w aromacie podparte cytrusowym albedo i calkiem porzadna dawka chmieli. Brzoskwinia  morela marakuja mango ananas trawa i karmelowe tony W smaku oprocz wspomnianych owocow daje sie wyczuc bardziej zaakcentowana cytrusowa goryczka. Grejpfrut daje cierpki posmak na finiszu.
Schön viel Hopfen, aber für mich sogar schon etwas zu wenig Malz. Nicht sonderlich viel Körper und dafür zu bitter
Világos sárga szín, ritkás fehér hab. Ananászos illat. Gyümölcsös, ananászos, keserű íz. Hasonló ízében is. Könnyed, jól kiegyensúlyozott sör.

Pours pale amber with a small white head. 
Lemon and grapefruit on the nose. 
Crisp citrus flavours dominate. 
Finishes with some bitterness. 
Thoroughly decent SIPA.

(From the keg) Hazy light-orange beer, with vigorous fine carbonation, and a creamy white head. Hoppy aroma of grapefruit, apricot kernel, pineapple, orange peel, pine needle, and some underlying funkiness. Nicely balanced with a caramel malt, and hints of biscuit and bread. A clean finish.

Compared to the other beers in Stones IPA range, Go To is fairly light in both aroma and palate. However, for a low-ABV, session IPA, this is a true gem.

07.05.2017, 0,33l can @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry and fresh grassy, leafs, moss, hay, flowers, hops, light malts, citrus peel, minerals, lawn, pine needles, hints of worth. Taste is slightly dry grassy, hay, leafs, lawn, flowers, minerals, light malts, hops, hints of pine needles, citrus peel and worth. Medium bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Nice.

Draught at Kungstorgets Brygghus on May 6, 2017.Hazy yellow color, small white head. Fruity, mango, hoppy taste. Hoppy, mineral aftertaste. Fizzy mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Hoppy, green, citrus scent.
Can @ benzai. Shared by benzai.. Small white head.. Clear yellow to light amber colour... Smell hops some yeast bit of herbs citrus.. Taste a nice bitter hops bread citrus. A nice beer overal.

Can @ benzai. Hazy yellow colour with a large and dense white head. Smells hoppy, fruity, very fresh, quite lovely. Tastes bitter, hops, fruity, fresh, citrussy, floral, strawberry. Thin to medium body, crisp.
0,3l on Tap in der Brauerei in Berlin. Dunkeloranges Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Intensiver Geruch nach Citrusaroma, Mandarine etc. Wird im Geschmack bestätigt gepaart mit einer dezenten Malznote.

Aroma is really hoppy with mango,passion fruit and pineapple. Taste has lots of hops, citrus peel,dank and tropical fruits, pleasant medium bitterness on the finish. Light body, crisp carbonation. Really good session IPA with lots of hops.
Can. Yellow slightly hazy body with white lasting head. Aroma is fruity with pines The taste is nearly the same but more pines than fruits. Aftertaste is nice balenced. Very nice session IPA.

Bottled. Straw coloured with a slight haze and a decent off-white head. A clean aroma of pine and some fruit. Loads of fruit in the mouth; sweet until near the end. Soft and well rounded. The bitterness isnt extreme; very easy to drink.

Pours slightly hazy golden with good white head. Aromas of lemon, pine and some bread. Decent carbonation and reasonable mouth feel. Taste is lemon, sherbet, gooseberry, and some grassy hops. Huge flavour for the ABV. Nice dry, bitter big finish
Can, thanks Toto! Golden body. Pine, resin and onion aroma, heavy. the same continues into the taste, light carbonation, creamy and grainy. A bit on the dry side. A nice session IPA.

Aromat dosyć intensywny, chmielowy, niestety pojawia się spocona skarpeta, która psuje efekt, świeże powinno dużo lepiej pachnieć. Barwa złota, idealnie klarowne, piana niewielka, utrzymująca się. W smaku jest lekkie, wytrawne, orzeźwiające. Goryczka cytrusowa, na średnim poziomie, przyjemnie zalegająca.Wysycenie średnie. Problemem tego piwa jest stary chmiel, tłumaczy to dlaczego amerykański Stone przywiózł tylko jedno IPA na CornerSTONE.

Stone Berlin, Germany. Pours hazy yellow, with a lot of yeast pieces and big head, but quickly disappearing. Whats interesting, there is also no carbonation visible in the glass, like a dead beer, but in taste there is strong fizziness, like in some popular soft drink. Aroma is metallic, citrus, juicy and... something that smells like old coat, or not washed trousers. Taste is refreshing, citrus, lemon or orange zest, apple, grapefruit... and also something that taste like iron, artificial like aromas, weird. I wish to try original American brew to check the differences between German version, but it was indeed not impress me, taste like some cheap imitation of Session IPA, but at least its refreshing.

Kolor jasnozloty, przejrzysty. Piana drobna, długo utrzymujacy się. Aromat wyrazisty, nie do końca przyjemny, nic specjalnego. W smaku mocna gorycz, chmielowa, owocowa. Po niej zostaje posmak owocowy, długo utrzymujący sie. Generalnie nic wielkiego, ale wypić można.

Aroma - Really nice hop aroma, tropical, citrus, pineapple, reminds me of a tropical fruit punch. 
Appearance - Pours golden with a slight haze, nice solid white head.
Taste - Mainly hop flavours with orange, lemon a hint of pineapple and a pine bitter aftertaste that balances out the initial citrus hit. 
Palate - Light body with a dry finish that goes down easy. 
Overall - A good session IPA (abv:4.8%) with tons of hop flavour and aroma that doesnt overwhelm you with bitterness

Big hop flavor and nothing else, which seems to have become my Go To complaint for Session IPAs in general. Bitter, piney and resinous with a mild citric undertone, yet no malt to give it depth, no yeasty esters of boozy warmth, nothing but hops. Dont understand the style; you can drink a lot of shitty IPA, or a smaller amount of really good IPA. Seems like a no-brainer.

355ml bottle. Pours a pale straw gold with a frothy white head. Aroma: citrus, grapefruit aromas coupled with mild tropical notes. Taste: Citrus flavours dominate, coupled with mild pine and malt flavours. Mildly resinous in texture. Moderate carbonation. Bitterness lingers on the palate and dominates the aftertaste. Quite tasty but not overly complex in flavour.
Some citrus and tropical fruits in the aroma. Clear yellow color with a white head. Medium to light bodied with a very dry and bitter finish. A good but not exeptional session IPA.
Kivääritehtaankadulla 1/2017. Very tasty and fresh session IPA. Easy to drink, still very enjoyable.

Can at home in garden, 23rd April 17. Pours straw coloured. Aroma is grapefruit, bitter and floral hops. Taste is bitter, floral, citrus, light pine, rereshing and delicious stuff, especially for the remarkable and extreme low ABV.
Can from Geers; Hazy yellow colour, nose of tropical fruit, flowers, bitter hops. Citrussy, lots of pine and sweetness. Bitter finish.
Berlin-brewed version. Aroma: very nice citrus with a pine note to it. Taste: citrusy, pretty light, but with a hoppy palate. Nice session ipa. Intense flavor given the low gravity.

I had it from the can. Its really flavorful for a session beer. Its very hoppy. The piny hops and citrus are big here. Its crisp and bitter. Stone is definitely a master of the IPA. This is another excellent one.

17/IV/17 - 33cl can from Geers (Oostakker), shared with Akke @ home - BB: 5/XII/17, canned: 10/III/17 (2017-451) 
Clear deep blond beer, creamy irregular bit yellowish head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, citrus, mango, passion fruit, some pineapple. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots and lots of tropical fruits, citrus, pretty bitter, grapefruit, bit chemical, malty notes. Aftertaste: more grapefruit, some citrus, very fruity, lovely stuff! Finally brewed and available in Europe! :D

Suaves aromas citricos y pino
Buena aspecto, fina capa de espuma poco persistente
En boca ligeramente amarga y citrica
Cant understand how this beer is that revered...pretty average IPA. Floral, citrus, pineapple on the nose. On the palate is quite anonymous. Dissapointing.
Can. Lovely perfumed hop aroma on a somewhat opaque orangey beer with a generous head. Zesty hop bitterness. Fairly easy drinking but top hop heavy for my tastes.

Looks like a full on IPA, possibly a bit brighter and lighter but looks pretty great. Aroma of pineapple, pine, hop, toffee citrus - pretty excellent. Taste is quite good but not perfect. You still get a bright citrusy hop profile and a touch of malt but I cant shake the club-soda feeling - too watery in the finish and too bubbly on the palate. Perhaps on the weaker end of Stones pale ale offerings, but still well above average.

Can Brewed in Germany. Lovely fruity aroma with citrus and hoppy flavours. Amazing amount of body for its relatively low strength.definitely flavour packed.
A must try.

16-APR-2016, can @Kregme Boxen, from Boxbeers.
Hazy golden with a lasting, White head.
Aroma is grape fruit, pine and sweet malt. Taste the ssame. Not really a low ABV but perhaps it can still pass as a session IPA. Quite bitter. Very nice in the sun.
To be honest this was a lot lighter than I expected from stone. Not nearly as hoppy and while I get that its a session ale we had a few better session ales tonight from uk and Australia.

Can, brewed at Stone Berlin, bought at Interspar Murpark Graz. Pours a nice amber, with a big, off-white head. Aroma of pine, lime, grapefruit, slightly herbal, slightly tropical. Taste ist very lightly sweet, with a lasting medium bitter finish - good balance! Very smooth, medium body, with lively soft carbonation. 
Very good. Nice balance.

Session can 33cl from Geers. From the can so no appearance rating. Smell is piney and slight cheesy hops. Aroma is fresh hops of different kinds, no hars aromas, very silky palate and good strong bitter taste with a long finish, certainly for a session IPA. A perfect style example.

Bottle 12fl.oz. [ As Stone Go To IPA ].ABV: 4.5%. Clear medium yellow orange colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, tropical fruit, peach, funky notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, tropical fruit, orange - peach. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150802]
 7-3-7-3-15
Couleur dorée; mousse blanche; arômes et goût maltés et fruités (citrons); finale moyennement amère
Can. Hazy golden colour with small head off. Aroma of citrus fruits, mango. Taste of grapefruits, lemons, grassy, moderate carbonation. Bitter finish. Nice

330ml can from Tesco.
Small white head, good lacing. Slightly hazy golden amber body. Great piney nose, citrus fruit, sweet treacle. Flavour is pithy citrus, pine, grass, good lasting grassy bitterness. Light carbonation, really good body for the abv. Cracking session IPA.
01-04-17 // sampled at CRAFT Frankfurt 2017. Minimal hazy golden beer, small white head. Nice hoppy nose. Taste is light bodied, but still a great lemon pine hop aroma.

On can from Siste Sang beer shop, Oslo. Hazy golden color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity; good hop intensity, citrus, tropical fruits and general fruitiness. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tirador al BBF17. Cervesa daurada i cristalina amb força escuma blanca duradora. Aromes frescos de llúpol amb tocs de llimona, herba i resina. Final sec i amarg. Molt bona!

UPDATED: APR 18, 2017 Color amarillo estilo zumo de limón, ligeramente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatacion media. Textura acuosa. Aroma increíblemente tropical y citrico, a mango, mucha fruta de la pasión, pomelo, limón, lima... Sabor muy frutal, con todo lo previamente citado, increíblemente sabrosa y fácil de tragar. Amargor mínimo pero persistente (algo seca). Una verdadera delicia. IPA, APA o Session IPA... me da lo mismo. Cervezón. No veo porqué he de comprar otras IPAs o DIPAs de Stone pudiendo beber varias de estas (más sabor, menos alcohol) a menor precio.

330ml cans of ice cold suds . Drunk with the opening round of the Masters golf tournament on sky tv  . I complacently  expected a hop punch ..to compensate for this being low boost. And instead of a hop orgy ,theres some nice ,but subdued  resin , maramalade , sap and juicy sappy bitterness texture. A very mild in character USA low-boost-golde   .

330ml can, filtered, from Tesco. Session IPA? At 4.8%? Either Americans have strong constitutions, or their sessions are rather shorter than British ones. Anyway, this is a rather thin malt for 4.8%, and feels more like a lager than an ale. The hops are crisp and citrussy. What is the significant difference between an APA and a a Session IPA? On this example it seems the malt is downplayed, and the hops are perhaps a tad more prominent, but essentially they seem the same. This is drinkable, but I prefer Sierra Nevada APA.

[2nd entry in a "why have I never reviewed this" series]
Can - 330 ml. Pours slightly hazy light amber/straw yellow with a finger or so of frothy, fairly dense white head with some patchy lacing and a small amount of visible carb, large bubbles. Nose is pungent and juicy with strong hints of mango, passion fruit, grapefruit, blood orange and resin. Some cut grass and a slight petroleum edge. Sweet honey malt buried under all of this. Very juicy and slightly dank on the nose overall. Taste is bright, fresh, clean lightly sweet initially and quite strongly bitter for the rest of the time. Lots of bitter grapefruit with a bit more grass, giving way to chalky, mineral-y bitterness that coats the mouth but doesnt overstay its welcome. Body is light but not thin and watery, texture is smooth and silky, carbonation moderately sharp, which I appreciate in a session IPA, and the finish is of medium length and not too dry. Really good stuff, easygoing without being lacking in the flavour department like session IPAs can be sometimes.

Can, from Tesco (Stone Berlin version). Hazy lemon gold, fluffy white but quickly disappearing head and gentle condition. Solid pine resin, petroleum and citrus hop notes mingled with a yeasty sweetness in the nose, dry and yeast bitter in the mouth with a little citrus and a touch of grainy sweetness. Finish is mostly dry and bitter with a mix of yeast and hop resin.

(tap 0,3l @ JBM (Brno))
Aroma: Citrusy, lemon grass.
Appearance: Cloudy yellow color. Minimal, white head.
Taste: Light sweet, very bitter, citrusy, grapefruity, lemon grass.
Palate: Medium body. Bitter finish.
Overall: Interesting, unusual.

On tap at Stone Brewing Berlin. Comes with a hazy, dark golden color and a nice white head. Wonderful nose: Passionfruit, Mango, some citrus, some grapefruit. Taste is less fruity than expected. More orange-zest, grapefruit-peels, nice hops and a nice bitter finish. Good one!

0,33l can (Stone Berllin) from Craft Beer Gallery, Bratislava, BBD: 14.Oct.2017 Pours light cloudy pale golden liquid, small creamy white head, Aroma: lemon and orange zest, grapefruit, litchi, extremely citrusy and hopy, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sour, citrusy, zesty, grapefruit, orange, litchi, hopy, Palate: light body, soft to average carbonation, slcik mouthfeel, long bitter zesty aftertaste, Overall: very good, bit too hopy, would add more maltiness.

0,33 l can from Biervana 
Tropical fruits, citrus, some spruce. golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,
Blond with soapy head. Aroma and flavour have light tropical fruit and quite a lot of resinous, very bitter hop. A bit too bitter.
backlog. Can, numerous times. Yellow with tiny haze. Aroma has loads of tropical fruits, some grassy and piney notes. Very hop forward session IPA. Very nice
I feel fantastic hops flavor with plenty of peach, citrus and melon. It is a very drinkable, and feel good for daytime IPA.
A quality full flavored IPA with plenty of west coast character. Big grapefruit and pine notes in both aroma and flavor. Mild nutty malt backbone.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2017 From meny; unclear bright golden straw with big white head; aroma is fruity and piney hoppy, orange zest; taste is fruity hops, grapefruit, orange, pine and resins, medium bitter dry finish; light texture with medium carbonation
Good IPA - more restrained than some of their beers, which I find a bit much. Good fresh, pine and grapefruit intensity. Nice stuff.

It pours straw yellow with rusty tinges; the head is off-white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: mango, pineapple, pine needles, and grapefruit zest. The tastes is medium bitter. The palate is medium-light bodied; has light carbonation; it has a long finish. Overall, very juicy..

330 ml can. Almost clear golden body with a big, foamy white head. Aroma is super refreshing with grapefruit, citric fruit and a bit floral. Flavor is nice and crisp mild, pale malt, lots of grapefruit, some citric fruit and rather good bitterness. Medium body and quite long lasting aftertaste. Straight forward indeed, but so refreshing and well-made that I just got to be impressed. Anytime!

0.33l can. Hopy aroma, citruses, passion fruit, resin, biscuits. Light hazy yellow color, white head. Hopy taste, graperuit, tangerine, resin, light sweet notes, medium bitter. Light to medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation and long bitter finish. Very good and easy drinking, enjoyed.

Puszka 330 ml, z Berlina. Piana średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, biała, szybko zanika. Barwa jasnozłota. Bardzo intensywny aromat tuż po nalaniu, głownie cytrusy, ale też melon, ananas, żywica i ogólnie leśne nuty. Wyczuć można też odrobinę alkoholu oraz kociego moczu, możliwe, że z powodu Citry i Amarillo lub po prostu utlenienia, lecz nie jest to mocno uciążliwe. W smaku o wiele mniej ciekawie, głownie czuć chmiel i średnio mocną goryczkę, na końcu przebija się odrobina alkoholu, tak samo jak w aromacie. Bardzo pijalne. Generalnie dobre piwo, jednak po session IPA spodziewałbym się trochę lżejszej goryczki i bardziej intensywnego smaku.

33 cl. can as "Stone (Berlin) Go To IPA". Canned in October 2016, so not that fresh. Hazy, golden colour with a medium sized white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, spruce, tropical impressions, Taste is bitter. Medium bodied with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Good for the abv. Finishes dry and lasting bitter with pines and citrus fruits. Excellent lighter IPA - extra credits for the lower abv.

0.33l can. Clear light golden with medium white head. Aroma: grapefruit, tangerine, resins, spicy. Taste: resins, mango, citrus, juicy, black pepper, biscuits. Light body, moderate arbonation. Light but long lasting fruity bitterness. Balnced and highly drinkable.

Boks på Café Sånn. Aroma dårlig do, sitrus, humle. Utseende uklar gylden med hvitt skum. Smak sitrus, humle, grape. En øl som lukter tragisk, men smaker godt. Det er moderat bitterhet. 

---

An extremely well made and typically "American" IPA. A nice opague orange with a strong aroma and flavour of fruity hops that bely the relatively low abv. A good mouth feel and a flavour that lingered. Theres nothing to dislike, but it was just a bit "clinical."
Pours clear orange with small white head. Hops, pine, grass, pineapple, nice bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation.
Vycap craft galery. Zlata farba, biela pena. Vona chmelova, tropicke ovocie, mango. Chut Chmelova, horka, tropicke ovocie, susienky, trosku korenia. Vyborna dlha dochut.
Can from appellation wines comely bank. Pours cloudy gold. Nose of mango, orange, peel, peach. Taste is moss, pine needles, spices.

Can from beer52 beer club. Probably the best session ipa Ive had. A little hazy with a thin head but bursting with hoppy flavours, and tones of grapefruit vanilla and biscuits. Very enjoyable, I wish I had more than one!

In a mystery case from beer hawk. Brewed in Berlin at 4.7% not 4.8%. Pours with a good head that disappears into a thin film after 5 mins. Golden very well hopped IPA with a bitter finish. Nice crisp ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Well hopped, quite earthy with hints of pine, some dark fruits, lovely bitter finish. Wouldnt imagine it was under five per cent, really full of character. This is excellent.

Got to love this much taste and all under 5% ABV.
Can from the LCBO, did not realize this was an import until I got home, all good if those non Trump States decide to come our way.
Just a great tasting IPA in a lighter form, citrus, pine tons of hops, looks a bit too clear. 
I will be back for more of this one

Can from LCBO. Canned 09.11.2016; BB 09.11.2017. Pours hazy paleish orange with consistent off-white head. Resiny bitter fruit aroma with a musky undertone; flavour of bitter fruitiness and resin, sweetness rather subdued. Finishes very dry. Carbonation just enough to make if feel refreshing, Outstanding, considering the ABV, I really loved this.

Guess I havent quit rating yet. Huh. Can - LCBO. Looks the part - gold, head, yadda yadda. Smells okay - more cereal than most WC IPAs - taste also pretty grainy - but solid stuff - nowhere near as sweet, or boozy, as regular Stone IPA. Chewy, solid body, disappointingly quick finish, but a nice slightly earthy aftertaste. Will have on tap if I see it.

Pure white frothy head stayed well on a hazy, golden body.
Sweet citrus & tropical fruits aroma.
Medium to thin body. Sharp, clean & plenty of carbonation.
Bitter citrus, grapefruit, pith & pine.
What a perfect Session IPA
Can. Golden clear color, medium white head. Aroma is piney, citrusy, orange and lemon peel, floral notes. Taste is light yeasty piney, zesty, nice citrusy, easy drinkable with nice hoppy kick

Cette bière a une couleur jaune soleil, extrêmement mousseuse dès sa sortie de la canette. Les notes olfactives sont fruitées, plein dagrumes et de mangues. Une bouche intense et juteuse suit, fruits et acidité et amertume tous sur un pied dégalité. Des ananas, du citron, des tonnes de mangues et une touche de raisin vert. Pour le genre, cest sublime, et ça se boit un peu trop facilement.
On tap. Slightly hazy pale golden with a thin white head. Grapefruit, pine and tropical fruits. Light body. Bitter finish. Very good.

Pours a clear golden colour, with a thin creamy head. Aroma has notes of citrus, pine, vanilla, and biscuits. Tasting notes include citrus, pine, resins, cereals, and a hint of honey. Excellent beer, but there is a lack of carbonation probably due to canning.
330ml can at 4.7%. Pours hazy light gold with a large head. Aroma is bready mango and papaya. Taste has bready malt to start and strong bitter mango finish.

Can from Beer Gonzo, Earlsdon, Coventry consumed at home Sunday 29th January 2017 whilst cooking Beef and Mushroom Carbonnade.   Pours clear gold with a head (white) that swiftly departed. Some mushy tropical fruits, soft in the mouth, lacks a little body, but pretty decent for an easy drinking session IPA, amazed that Id not rwted it as Id had it plenty.  A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13 3.3

From 330ml can, pours hazy pale orange with medium thick white frothy head which settles quick but leaves lacing on glass throughout. Very fresh and inviting aroma of grapefruit, pine, lemon/orange zest and a touch of biscuity malt. Taste is medium bitter offset by a touch of sweet malt. Lightly carbonated in the mouth and slightly oily, long dry lingering finish. Definitely one of the best session IPAs I have had and what a lovely way to end my dry January (slightly early but fuck it)

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 From a 12floz stubbie. Clear gold with decent head with lacing. Strong sweet citris, pineapple, passionfruit, papaya and honey nose. Grapefruit, orange, fruity taste with reasonable bitter hop finish. Sweetness aplenty along with hop bitterness balance. Subtle background malts. Lasting hop palate and very sessionable at 4.8%. Nice skunky bit in bottom of glass when warm. Nice beer.

Can. Hazy yellow body, huge white head with good retention and plenty of lacing. Aroma of pineapple, yeast, oranges, spruce and honey. Taste of pine, grapefruit zest, honey, orange candies and yeast. Almost flat.

Can, from Pivný raj. Clear golden colour with unstable white head. Aroma is Very fresh hops, tropical, juicy, mango, passionfruit. Taste is hops, tropical, a bit garlicy, somewhat bisquity. Hops oriented, Very Light body - perfect example of session IPA. Very Good.

Draft at the flying Scotsman 
Yellow clear, white head.
aroma of mango, citrus. Fresh
Taste bitter mango. Snuf, bitter

Out of the can (LCBO), poured a hazy gold, with an unusually thick persistent white head. I didnt perceive as much tropical fruit as other reviewers - but I did get a good mix of apricot, pink grapefruit, pine, pepper, ginger and dank notes. Very pleasant aromas. The palate was assertively hoppy for a session IPA with grassy/piny notes shining through against a moderate malt backbone. I enjoyed this one. Packed surprising punch for 4.8% ABV.

tallboy from lcbo - late september canning. pours hazy very light golden with an abnormal white ehad offering good retention and lacing. celery salt, peppery pineapples, chalky and bitter citrus peel, some other tropical juice, crisp almost peppery wheat-like cereals, faint pale melon fruitiness, pepper. foamy carbonation, light body - watery; drying if not assertive tropical-citrusy finish. obviously a canning issue with its high carbed body and carbonic acid residual. had nice tropical flavours though - not necessarily in C hop zone, as in a comfort zone for stone.

Pours yellow gold. Aroma is a complex fruit salad. First taste is slightly watery malt but quickly folowed by Citra like Peach, Mango and Gooseberry hop fruit salad. A session IPA is what it is, but this is a good example

Poured from a can (which frothed everywhere) into a Splieglau IPA glass. Hazy, golden colour with 5cm of head in the glass. Citrusy nose and a big piney flavour. The light/medium body would make it very quaffable on a hot day. Lingering bitter aftertaste.

Gold body with small thin white head. Aroma is full of citrus and some pine. The taste is lemon, grapefruit, resin, and just a bit of the pale malts. Body is good for a session IPA and bitterness is quite high as well. Great session IPA

473 ml can purchase at the LCBO at Rideau and King Edward (Ottawa) on January 3, 2017. Hazy gold, big head. Dry faint hoppy aroma, not much else. The state is about the same, with some citrus notes, ok bitterness. Not my go to beer!

CAN 33 CL Berlin. Hazy golden, white head. Mellow and inoffensive aroma - sweet citrus, pale malts, hints if honey, just a little pithy. Subtle sweetness, subtle pale malts, soft resiny/piney hops. Light body, but not watery. A well made easy drinking session ale.
Berlin. Ljusgul med skum. Luktar citrus. Smakar citrus i början. Lite apelsinskal. Eftersmaken inte helt balanserad. Sådär, men ganska lättdrucken.
Can shared with JMD at HNB 13.01.17. Slightly hazy straw colour. Persistent white head and lacing. Aroma of lime, lemon, lychee, mint, blackcurrants and CP. Similar taste.

0,33 boks fra Gulating Stavanger, delt med Ovesen etter endt tapping av vår EKG Single Hop: lett uklar korngul med flott skum som varer. Nydelig aroma av tropiske frukter og granskudd, og smaken likeså - bare enda bedre. Rund og behagelig munnfølelse med saftig maltkropp og en lekker bitterhet i ettersmaken. Et prakteksempel av en ipa i butikkstyrke. 4,7%, brygget i Berlin. En sixpack av denne anytime som helst!

33cl can (Stone Berlin brewed). Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aroma: very hoppy, pine, tropical fruit, citrus. Taste: not as punchy as the aroma, but nice tropical fruits, quite bitter throughout, strong piney/resin flavour. Light-medium body, light-moderate carbonation. This is your go-to IPA if you love piney IPAs.

Can from LCBO. Faithful readers of my reviews (all none of them) will know nothing makes me scowl more than another session ipa. But hold the sourpuss face on this one Freakytiki cuz this is pretty much a gold standard of low abv hop goodness. Beautiful in the glass with a one finger rocky cap. Aromas are light on the citrus & heavy on the pine forest. Sparkling mouthfeel makes this a nice one to pound. Deep notes of pine & wet ganga. Despite the watery requirements of the style this never comes across as thin & fluffy. Oh I will be grabbing some more. Recommended.

Keg Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2015, Parsons Green, London in July 2015 - Hazy Yellowy Gold in colour. Medium head. Very good lacing. Fruity; grapefruit citrus. Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Malty; toasty malts, caramel. Moderately bitter hoppy fruity throughout. Very drinkable. (2015-07-02)

The aroma is all citrus. More bright citrus - grapefruit and a bit of lemon tartness - on the tongue, along with a touch of resiny pine. Which is a pretty good trick for a 4.5 per cent beer. Really tasty - one of the best session beers out there.

(Flasche) Es hat eine zitronengelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Aroma ist sehr fruchtig ,sehr spicy und süßlich. Der Geschmack ist flach, nur bitter, die breit und grün ist und bleibt auf der Zunge hängen.
Pours hazy yellow with a big white head that laces the glass. Aroma is grapefruit, tropical fruits and hops. Grapefruit and pine flavours with a good bitterness. Very well done.

From can (BB: 23Sept17) in IPA glass. Pours golden with explosive billowing head that would take out a less experienced beer hunter. Grapefruit aroma that carries through to the taste and tart bitterness on the palate. Zesty and refreshing.
Can. It poured a hazy golden color with a nice white head. The citrusy aroma had notes of lemon, orange and grapefruit with some pine dankness in the taste as well. Medium bodied, but very drinkable.
33cl can. Peach and tangerine fruit and sour candy hop aroma. Flavor is classic grapefruit and piney dry hop goodness. Fairly light-bodied but very tasty and drinkable.

Clear yellow IPA with a huge white foam. Lovely citrussy and fruity aroma. Very good flavor for the ABV. Medium bitterness and has the IPA fruitiness in it which usually is lacking in this kind of session IPAs. Some floral notes as well. Very light and fresh so its easy to drink. Probably the best session IPA yet.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 From 160z can: Will have to revisit this one soon. Remember it being pretty nice and smooth compared to a different IPA just previously had. not too bitter not too sweet. Juicy flavor too. im sure it will get a higher rating once i get to this when i have a fresh palate.
.
.
12/27/16_

Glass: Big grass, mild bitter up front. west coast hops and citrus as it warms up. pretty nice mouth feel for a session. could use a bit more flavor kick, but hey, what do you expect?

Pours a slight hazy golden colour with a frothy warm cap, huge, very long lasting with beautiful foamy lacing. Big aromas of citrus, like squeezing the hell out of grapefruit, orange peel and mixing a little of their juices. Same great taste, a slight milder, but with real bite in the end with the dryness. Wow! This is quite the session IPA. One of the best Ive tried. Wish we could get these year round at the LCBO.
Goude kleur, aroma is perzik en wat tropisch fruit. Smaak is ook perzik en licht bitter. Beste Session IPA die ik op heb.
Tap at Beerlovers bar. Pours clear gold, small white head. Smell is intense, grassy, bit bitter, full Taste is full, intense bitter, Nice malty finish. Very Nice !
From a can. A cracking easy drinking beer that Id gladly smash a heap of, the name really says it all.

Copenhagen 22/12 2016. 33 cl can from Meny. Beer drinking Devil on the can looking kind of aggressive. Pours hazy golden yellow with white head. Settles as 0,5 cm thick layer of foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Strong aroma with exotic fruit and citrus fruit intermingling. The sour citrus is dominating the odeur. Soft carbonation and oily palate. Flavor has light sweetness, quickly overpowered by strong bitterness. Distinct bitter aftertaste and dry finish. What it lacks in ABV, it has in spades in the bitterness department. Not bad.

Clear pale golden, quite carbonated, sudsy and clingy white head. Quite strong hoppy and piny aroma. At first pine is too much, but on second sip it tastes a lot better and bit toned down. Tropical fruit, sweet malt, prickly herbs. Unusual palate, coating, herbal, nettles, pine resin and oily bitterness. Body is thin l and has a long bitter finish.

Can Form Beerlovers: Aroma with intensive notes of tangerine zest and maracuja. Pale golden color, white head. Flavor is also full of tropical fruits, orange peel, maracuja, pine. Ends herbal bitter with citrus peel bitterness. Very tasty brew.

Berlin canned version. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is really dank with chives and pineapple. Taste follows with lots of hops, dank and fruity, medium bitterness on the finish. Light body, crisp carbonation. Really good session IPA with lots of hops.

Can from the LCBO. Slightly hazy golden with a nice and creamy white head. Aroma and flavour are all about the citrus-driven hops, with enough honey-cracker malt to support. Mouthfeel is good, not as thin as many other session IPAs. Lovely!

Can from Oddbins Rosemount. Pours hazy golden yellow with quickly dissipating thick white head. Aromas of orange zest and lime juice. Clean and grassy too. Taste is fresh with zingy hops, a clean citrus middle and bitter finish. Palate was lightly carbonated with a slight oily finish. An immensely clean and fresh beer with enough bittering hops to confidently remind you youre drinking alcohol. Fine stuff.
141216. Can at home. Pours slight hazy yellow with a nice head. Aroma citrus, floral notes. Nice hoppy bitter palate. Very well balanced. Awesome stuff. Not Bad.
Flaske 4,7% på Cafe Sånn 7 Okt 16. Lett uklar. Filmskum. Utmerket appelsinaroma. Smaken fersken & appelsin. Lett syrlig etter hvert. Veldig bra 4,7-øl.
Can from the lcbo. This really delivers. Huge orange oil Aroma and flavour, light bitterness, super session ipa. Loads of juicy citrus, but still light on the palette.

I expect good things from Stone and this doesnt disappoint. Nice aroma bursting with citrus and pine. The flavors are not as pronounced as the aroma but delicious nonetheless. Rather full-bodied for a Session IPA and it looks great with a frothy white head. Excellent
How: bottle Appearance: clear golden with large to medium white head. Aroma: tropical fruits, lemon peel, black pepper, grass and some pine. Palate: light body, high carbonation.
473ml can. Clear golden yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are cereals, pine and grass with spicy and woodsy notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, slick texture.
Looks amazing in a glass. Aroma of tropical fruits. Proper pine hit, but also taste of citrus, mainly grapefruit. Also some hints of passion fruit. Nice peppery mouth-feel. It is a beautiful beer.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden orange with large, lasting, rocky white head. Aroma is big on pine with some nice citric notes as well as a bit of pepperiness. Flavour has big pine, grapefruit, mango, lemon and some pepper. Quite dry in the finish. Impressive.

473ml can. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a HUGE head of Belgian Tripel-like bubbles. Smells AWESOME. Grapefruit, lemon candy, light wet concrete notes, faint black pepper. SMELLS so much like a Belgian with North American hops. Taste wise, metallic bitterness with tropical fruit, a faint soapy note, more Belgian yeast and lemon rind that heads into soapy, lemon notes with mineral bitterness in yeasty finish. This is AMAZINGLY flavourful for 4.8%, and not at all what I was expecting. Solid stuff.

De couleur jaune pale transparente, elle nous montre une mousse solide avec une mince effervescence. Un nez houblonné, la mandarine et la résine de conifère en premier plan, mais le fruit lemporte.

En bouche, une force raisonnable de résine est mise à lépreuve au départ. Louverture ensuite par les fruits tropicaux nous amène aussi son léger coté malté de caramel sucré. Une finale amère sèche qui tant vers le citron, les fruits tropicaux et le malt. 

Excellent produit
Draught at All in Beer Fest 2016 session 3, 2016-11-05 Göteborg AR: ripe tropical fruity AP: .., no head F: peppery, wee watery, citrus zest, dried grapes 3,2

(On tap @ Bootleggers) Poured at fridge temperature into branded Bootlegger shaker reveals a hazy golden body with two fingers of persistent, creany white head that leaves beautiful lace. Aroma is hopforward with west coast notes of citrus fruit and grapefruit. Watery texture, mediun carbonation, light body and a lingering, crisp finish. Fkavour holds a modest bitterness and little to no sweetness. Decent; well executed and drinkable but it seems a bit old school now compared to those NE style fruit juice pale ales exploding onto the scene. Also at 9 euro per pint its overpriced even by Copenhagen standards.
Golden yellow color with minimal white head. Strong grapefruit, pine and hops aroma. Loads of grapefruits in taste,light mouthfeel. Citrus finish. Overall lots of taste and easy to drink. Very nice

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2016 The aroma can be a bit musty, but the ultra-hoppy flavour is sensational. Very pale in colour its soft and tingly on the palate, big hoppy finish and a very pleasant after taste. Love it.
Typical west coast ipa clone, session version of their ipa which I dont like.
God IPA-smag, en fin smag af de humlog en hel masse blomster ogsper der er i den

0,1l from tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien shared with a friend. orange hazy color, small white head. smells of pines, spices, some exotic fruits, mango, nice smell. light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of pines, spices, some exotic fruits, lychee, lemon grass, bit leathery. finishes light to medium bitter with notes of pines, lemon grass and some lychee. decent but enjoyed the smell quite a bit better than the taste, beer was also served quite cold (which could have had an impact), overall still decent.
Can, courtesy of Smartly. A nice session IPA. Very hoppy, quite full and chewy. Citrus, tropical, passionfruit.
Berlin can at Burger Anarchy, Odense. Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Fruity and juicy hop aroma. Dry, malty and citrus hoppy flavour with a light bitter finish.

Some malts. Medium, soapy aftertaste with artificial fruits and some hops. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall, light years away from Stone IPA, but still quite good in its class.

33cl can. Berlin. 
Poured golden color with a thin white head. 
Pine, floral notes, cat pee in aroma. Fresh stuff. 
Hop juice, grapefruity, piny hoppy flavors. Tasty session IPA.
Can from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden yellow pour with a bubbly white head, aroma has pine and some light citrus, taste has pineapple, sweet malts, tangerine, hint of onion, moderate IBUs.

Very hazy once poured; and when poured aggressively a finger of head appeared. A very hoppy bear, with a strong aroma of grapefruit, and a dash of mango. The taste is overwhelmingly of hops and grapefruit - a very good session-able beer.
Fat på All In Beer Fest, Göteborg. Blekgul. Fräsch humledoft och i smaken lite torr beska. Sessionable absolut, men inte jättespännande.

330ml can, 4.7 % abv. Pours hazy golden with an white head, lacing. Rich fresh citrus nose, lemonish hops. Fresh and ripe citrus taste. Dry, hoppy bitter finish. Refreshing and unexpected, still very good!

Cloudy yellow beer with nice head on top which leaves some lacing to the sides of the glass. Aroma has lots of grapefruit hops, pines and lemon. Taste has bitter pines and grapefruit, some sweetness from fruity flavours. Light to medium body with high carbonation. Drinkability is great here, one of the best session brews out there.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Nose is green with citrus tones and some herbal notes. Head small and colour golden straw. Taste is hoppy with herbal notes as well as some bitterness from the hops. Palate is tremendous longlasting for a beer of 4,7 abv. Lots of hops to accompany it.
Can shared with sarky northner. Hazy gold slight head. Aroma is citrus grassy taste same good hoppy long bitter finish. Nice session beer.
Can from wine seller, Compton Wolverhampton. Golden beer with small head. Aroma of tropical fruit and peach. Taste is tropical fruit, pineapple and citrus. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 0,33l can. 4,7% abv brewed in Berlin. Pours hazy orange without head. Really strong citrus and pine. Really good body for the abv with lively carbonation. One of the best sessions IPAs I have tasted.

Can @ Kihoskh. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, slight peppery, grassy, quite tropical, old school nose. Taste is heavy pine, heavy bitter, subtle malts, citrusy. Decent
Can. Hazy orange with medium white head. Grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruits in aroma. Taste is malty with quite long bitter and fairly dry aftertaste. Flavors of grapefruit, malt, pine and resin.

Can from Finnish milk store so 4,7% ABV. Hazy orange with strong pure white head. Grapefruit, citrus, some licorice. Herbal, licorice-ish with some citrus and pale malts. A very nice balance. Bitter and not too sweet. Medium body, creamy texture and soft carbonation with a nice, bitter finish.

330ml can, 4.7 % abv, shared with Finn at Cafe Sånn. Bubbly white head resting over a hazy, warm golden body. Spotty lacing. Rich fresh citrus nose, lemony hops to the fore. Fresh and ripe citrus taste. Dry, hop bitter tail. Quite refreshing and moreish (Tromsø 07.10.2016).

Draught at Fermentoren.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, resin and pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and pine needles with notes of resin.
Hoppy finish.

Can (Berlin 4,7%). Light golden, hazy, average and mostly lasting head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light - some tropical fruitiness, piney - some citrus hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and dryish flavor, light tropical fruitiness and piney hoppyness - some citrus hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dryish, light tropical fruitiness, piney hoppyness - light citrus hoppyness. Really well hopped sIPA - not too sweet. Decent body for 4,7%.
Can. 4,7 brewed in Berlin. Hazy pale with medium head. Piny, yellow fruits. Crispy bitterness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Can. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy biter nice citrus flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Oily palate. Nice.

16 oz can with a BB date of 11-22-16. 
Slightly hazy golden-amber body with a durable white head and sticky patterned lacing. 
Popping the top immediately releases a somewhat pungent, fruity hop aroma. Pine notes are obvious after the pour. 
Flavor: less piney than the aroma with more dominance of citrus notes. Moderate, at most, bitterness. 
Feel: light bodied with lively but soft carbonation. 

Overall: an aromatic and flavorful session IPA thats probably as good as any Ive tried.
Bottle shared at home after BAF 2016. Semi-hazy golden pour with a thin white head. Notes of unripe tropical fruit, citrus hops and honey. Light and easy to drink.
Vom Fass im Brauhaus in Berlin. Goldenes Bier mit hellem Schaum. Kräuteriges Aroma. Fruchtig im Antrunk. Grapefruit, Kräuter etwas Aprikose.

(Can, 0.33 l - brewed in Berlin - canned 04 Aug 2016, from CM Ruoholahti, 20161007) The beer poured golden and lightly hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness and tangerine. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, pineapple, tangerine, grass, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. A tasty hoppy pale ale with low ABV.

Can from Hops & Crafts Exeter,( Stone Berlin canned date 23/8/16 an tasted fresh) pours slightly hazy pale gold with a white head. Aroma Hop juicy ,grapefruit ,mango,orange zest,pinapple,pine & some bread. Taste is more grapfruit ,mango,pine with an assertive bitterness. Light bodied & thin but very drinkable the finish is bitter,dry with lasting hop flavours . A classic & classy session IPA !
One of the best Session IPA Ive ever drank. A little too watery but the rest fits perfect to what I consider a role model IPA.

Can, bought @BOXBEERS. Pours clear yellow golden with a large, lovely, staying, creamy, White head. Aroma is lovely, lots of fresh hops, peach, citrus, grapefruit. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has elegant, high bitterness, grapefruit, citrus, peach. Does get a little flat when it sits, otherwise lovely.
Big frothy head, three fingers, too much head. Thin texture and watery, piney on the tongue, bitter as youd expect but the malts doesnt balance it out. Not an IPA I will go to again.
Can enjoyed at home. Smell of pine cones, wood, floral hops. Moderate sweet, thin mouthfeel, watery, pine. Medium bitter, alt of biting resins and pine. Good stuff

Can at home. Pours golden with foamy medium sized white head. Aroma is bitter hops with citrus and pine. Taste is citrus hops with subtle malts to finish. Quite a lot of bitter but not too much to my taste. Bit watery but considering the ABV not bad. Refreshing.
Pretty good sessionable beer. Clear with big bubbles. Light, floral. Draft at brewery.
12 oz. bottle. Pours golden/yellow, foamy white head. Aroma of pine, cat piss, grapefruit, hops. Taste was bitter, grapefruit rind, bitter finish.

Can sourced from Toft Vin, Copenhagen (canned 1 month ago in Berlin) - pours a golden orange colour with thin white head. Fruity and malty aroma and taste, with a pleasing medley of citrus and tropical fruit, fresh juicy grapefruit, lemon, nice pale malty base, lovely stuff, goes down a treat.

Draught at Banksia. Medium high fluffy white lasting head. Hazy yellow body. Powerful hops bitterness combined with lemon grass grapefruit and pine both in aroma and flavor. Low carbonation. Long dry bitter finish. Impressive for a beer with an alcohol level like this.

Draft. A golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of lemons, straw, hops, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, malt, citrus fruits, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Keg at Brewdog Manchester. A hazy golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of grape, green apple, mango, some peach, slight lime, a little straw and subtle pine. Taste of grape, apple, pear, peach, some mango, slight lime, maybe lemon, a little straw and subtle pine. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. Packs a hoppy punch for 4.5% lots of appealing apple, grape and peach. Nice a dry with a crisp bitterness in the finish. Well made and overall a good session IPA.

Tapped at epic Stone second location in San Diego California. Clear golden color. Thick soapy head vanishes quickly. Watery epic citrus aroma. Watery refreshing taste of citrus hops, pears, grapes, green apples. Malty bitter hops finish. Excellent session ipa.

Lukt: Citrus og honning.
Utseende: Gulbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum.
Smak: Citrus og honning.

A very full taste with plenty of hops. A medium kind of bitterness and a taste that lingers, with notes of hay and wood and fruit. Just excellent.

0.33 can.   A clear, gold color and a large, thin, white head. Aroma of pines, citruses, a lot of tropical fruits, some strawberries, and a ton of hop pellets. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, floral, a tad malty - not as good as expected. A medium body, a thin texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is long and skillfully combines hay with exotic fruits. Overall the beer is just alright, nothing particularly great about it - the biggest advantage is that it does not offend in any respect.

All round one of my favourite session IPAs. Lovely west coast / pacific Hop blend nose coming through with topical notes and a pallet thats solid and filled with the perfect amount of bitterness for an IPA fix. Pours golden and good head, medium length. well balanced
sessionable and extremely easy to drink, with a lovely stone fruit nose and pallet. good bitterness and short length, so you get the IPA hit, but then can come back for more

Started the wrong way around., Went Ruination first.. Go To is fantastic, love the solid hop character on the pallet, and fruity nose. It drinks really easily with a good bitterness that allows this to be easily sessionable.
Personal favourite for Session IPAs and shows Stone is the master when it comes to the IPA style. Love their work.
Can. It pours mostly clear yellow with a medium white head. Passion fruit, burned rubber, peach and pine in the aroma and flavor. Citrus notes. Long bitter finish. Lovely.
Hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is pineapple, mango and lime. Taste is pineapple, hops and citrus.
Can.Hazy golden with medium white head.Aroma is fruity of pineappels,lemon and mangos,nice refreshing taste with good hops nots and good medium body,nice bitterness and good by style beer.

one of things i really enjoy about a good IPA is that they have a good strong aroma, the go to IPA does not let the side down with a very strong citrus aroma like ive stuck my nose right into an orange. the beer itself pours into a great golden body with an expansive white head.the flavour of the beer is a hoppy citrus. its a great experience, when it comes to beer.

Can from Boxbeers, Stone Berlin. Yellow gold with white head. Citrus, mango, pinapple, pine, tropical fruits, tangerine, lychee. Sweet taste, a bit metallic feelin in the mouth. The hop bitterness is still there in the finish. Highly sessionable beer.

800th US rating. Pours an amber from the tap, nice biscuity flavor, citrusy hops and a bit of bitterness on the finish. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can @ Boxbeers. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Straw, bread, citrus and pine. Fresh and quaffable. Dry and bitter finish!

Picked up single 12-oz bottle from Heritage Liquors in Maplewood, MN. Pours a clear golden straw colored brew with an average sized off-white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma of grapefruit zest, a hint of pine, and some golden grain malt. Taste is light bodied with flavors of a typical regular grapefruity and mild grassy IPA. Finish is semi-dry at first with a lingering bitterness that slowly disappears. Tongue shock recovery time, about 2 minutes. A solid session IPA.

Draught. Pours slightly hazy amber with airy white head. Clear aroma of hops and citrus, with malty and estery notes. Bitter, hoppy flavour with notes of citrus and touches of yeast and malt and hints of fruit. Lingering, hoppy and grassy aftertaste with estery notes. High carbonation and rich body. Good.
Sample at DØE 2016. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit bitterness, grapefruit and citrus.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 From tap. Pours cloudy yellow, white head. Mild citrusy and crisp hoppy aroma. Sweet impression, but crisp hoppy and citrusy dry. Bitter and light fruity finish.

From tap in Berline and German IPA Madness, dryhopped with Callista and Hüll Melon. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is herbal, hrassy, straw. Bitter, slight herbal. Dry and solid hoppy. Bitter and dry far finish.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017 Draught. Mild citric aroma. Cloudy orange colour. Big stable creamy white head. The flavour has a little vegetable to begin with. Turns more into slightly papery malts with a decent bitterness. OK flavourful for the ABV, but I must admit I expected a bit more from this one. 

Can, 4.7% from Berlin. Great and refreshing mango and grapefruit aroma. Almost clear golden colour. Small stable white head. The flavour is quite bitter with a mild fruity hoppiness. Mango like the aroma, but less so. More of the grapefruit note of the aroma. A little watery flavour also, actually, but OK for the ABV as mentioned in my previous rating. 7 3 6 3 14

Can. Cloudy golden yellow with a nice white head and ok lacing. Aroma is sweet up front. Mango, papaya, passion fruit, and tangerine. Bits of grapefruit, pine, and bread linger as well. Taste is full of citrus right away. Grapefruit, and oranges as well as some mild tropical fruit salad. Pine resin comes in to round it out and there are hints of grains as well in the finish. Light bodied, a little creamy and semi dry. Super crushable,

From a can, pours near clear golden yellow with a small off-white head. The smell is big citrus, some toasted grain. The taste is citrus, a bit of resin, toasted grain ending dry and slightly bitter. Light+ in body with somewhat active carbonation. Pretty solid out of their Berlin brewery.

(draught at BKL 2016) Hazy, golden colour with a blond mid-sized foamy head. Aroma is quite intense with loads of fruity and resiny hops, including notes of grapefruit, peaches, tangerines, as well as lighter grassy notes. Quite bitter flavour, light bodied with a well-carbonated mouthfeel. Initially delicately bready malty with an extremely present hops profile with loads of citrus, grapefruit, tangerines and lighter exotic notes; light but very tasty and hoppy finish. Truly nice. 26.II.16

On tap @ Craft & Draft. Old note. The aroma has citrus, hint of pine. Clear, copper coloured beer with a thin, white head. The taste is light-moderate bitter, has some sweet malt notes, citrus. Light bodied, more dry finish.

a hop bomb of a session IPA. The big hop presence that Stone brings to their IPAs shine through within a beer that stylistically has a lighter body. The absence of a more malty backbone allows the hops to shine through in glorious excess. Dry pine and dank citrus hoppiness drive through a very easy drinking sessionable.
Tap @ Konttori. Pours pale golden, small white head. Citrus, fruity, floral hops in the aroma. Fruity, hoppy, grass, some grain in the flavor.
Can from mchughs. Pours clear gold with white wispy head. Aroma is dank citrus, pine, lemon. Flavor is a biscuit sweetness with a juicy fruit finish with mild bitter finish. Fruit aftertaste. Nice.

341 ml bottle poured at home. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a pillowy white head. Smell is citrus fruit and pine cone. Taste is soft with a slightly bitter finish. Low carbonation. Great summer beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank with Marijn, Bram and Lennart in the Stone brewery bar (awesome place!) in Berlin. Bitter beer. Body is good.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aromas of resin, pine, citrus, mandarin, tangerine, hops. Taste is citrussy, hoppy, resin, pine, orange, light pineapple.

Taster pour at Craft Beer Race New Haven. Appearance is yellow with small head and lacing. Aroma is dank resin, citrus. Taste is as aroma. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with frothy texture, soft carbonation and bitter resin finish. Overall, strong aroma and flavor for a session IPA but West Coast Style is more bitter than Id prefer.
Bottle. Pours a dark orange colour with a slight fluffy white head, aroma is light and with plenty of citrus fruit, the taste is medium bitterness and smooth with some fruit with a dry bitter finish.

Hoppy, bit of depth to the taste. Drank it quickly. Would happily drink again

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this offering from Stone before in a bottle, but had it in a 16oz can at dinner. It had a nice floral hop nose with a surprisingly good hop taste for a mere 4.8% ABV. Tasted extra cold and satisfying in a can. Thought it was a better session than Easy Jack or All Day, which are quality sessions in their own rights. Cheers!

Newly-arrived 16oz cans. Pours a luminous gold with voluminous head and flawless retention. Nose of simply fresh hops. Literally smells of that fresh hop resin when you rub it in your hands. Underneath a lemon, melon, Apple, naval orange, ethereal grapefruit and husky, earthy pine. Flavor is gently lemony, honeydew making a firm cameo, sweet flowers and breezy pine. Superbly dry. Drinks amazingly, and even better out of the can! This is now my favorite IPA right now. Hits all the sweet spots for me.

Gras in der Nase, IPA Fruchtaromen ebenso. Schön schlank im Mund, die Hopfenbittere kommt fett zur Geltung. Großartig. Nur der Nachhall ist etwas kurz. Probierschluck von Enti in der STONE BREWING BERLIN.

A light yellow beer, a head is medium and blond. Aroma has grapefruits, some tropical fruitness and mandarin. Taste has grapefruits, tropical notes, the bitterness is nicely strong and long lasting. Medium bodied. Good beer, not a notes of low alcohol %.
On tap at Blackbird Public House. Hazy straw with a huge white head. Aroma is very citrusy with candied orange and mandarine notes. Piney and citrusy bitterness aftertaste. Very good.

Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

HBF 2016.
Very unclear notes written in the A4 sized beer guide. So just numers and some comments: Pretty light, citrus, resiny. Your normal IPA = go to!

On tap at brewpub. Ale is golden with a short lived white head Aroma is grapefruit, mandarin, orange, tangerine and lemon. Flavor is grapefruit, lemon, orange and tangerine. Finish is light fruity bitterness, aromatic, some honey melon and cantaloupe. Light to medium body, strong carbonation. Solid!

16 oz. can. Bright light golden color with a taller, slightly diminishing white head. Strong hops aromas, with citrus, resin and light pine. Some hints of dough and lightly toasted white bread. Feel is thicker than Ive expected, but the flavors come off a bit thinner. Akin to what I refer to top tea. Decent hop flavors, but lacking in the malt depth to back it up.

Tap 0.4 l, Mood4Food, Wrocław, Pland.
Jasnozłote piwo z gęstą i puszystą ale niezbyt obfitą pianą oraz cytrusowym, chmielowym aromatem. W smaku lekkie i orzeźwiające, cytrusowe z nutami owoców egzotycznych oraz przyjemną, chmielową goryczką na finiszu.

355ml bottle into shaker. Mild citric hop nose. Hazy yellow beer with thin white clingy head. Laces well. Light body, nothing seems to be happening then....a long earthy bitter lemon finish kicks in. Theres late grain and pepper too. Really easy drinking (Ive finished it already) yet complex as well. A bit too light in body to be great but really good.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with big head. Floral hoppy hoppy aroma with loads of citrus and hoppy taste.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Its really good, but I still have a bit of a problem with the notion of a session IPA. Aroma is dominated by resin. Flavors likewise with some spice, fairly dry, some tang. Body seems perhaps a tad thin.
UPDATE: this one is better than the previous with more balanced flavor and better body.

Bottle from Brewdog. Pours a clear amber with clean white head, light to medium carbonation and good lacing.

Aroma is lovely for the ABV. Pineapple, grapefruit, pine, bready malts and lime. Taste has initial sweetness and then a decent bitter finish. Good body for its ABV.

All in all an impressive session IPA that packs a lot in for its strength.
Gold. Piney grapefruit nose. Herbal. Flavor is more pine and grapefruit with grainy malt. Lingering grapefruit.

Bottled, 355ml from Beer Hawk of Harrogate, N.Yorks, many thanks to Derek & Kelsey. Beautiful gold with white head. There is a tangy nose to this, grapefruit bitterness from the off, sharp and fresh. Oily grapefruit skin with a grassy character. Refreshing throughout. Consumed whilst watching England vs Slovakia. Very decent.

BB 16.11.16 Clear pale golden, quite carbonated, sudsy and clingy white head. Quite strong hopy and piney aroma. Tropical fruit, sweet malt, prickly herbs, nettles and onions??. Unusual palate, coating, herbal, nettles, pine resin and oily bitterness. Body is thin l and has a long bitter finish.
Glass at stone brewery. Pours a clear Amber with no head. Hops are citrusy, lime rind, and not overpowering. Very good.
Aroma: JaSMININI AR GREIFRUU. GARSA: GANA RUUGTENS UN AR DZILJU GAAZIITI.PLUS VEL SKUJAS PIE AROMA. LABS
Nice and quite strong. Hoppy but not tiring and not so bitter but with a lot of character in there.

12fl oz bottle poured into a shaker. Clear gold with a few bubbles and a small white cap. Aroma is a surprisingly sweet, yet strong hops presence. Strong bitter initial bite with a sweet follow-up in the finish. Very interesting character, this brew.
One of the best of the sessions. Dry, caramel malt, a mixture of citrus and resinous hops. Light and refreshing without the common pitfall of being watery and weak. Good.
One of the best session IPAs out there. Big tropical fruit aroma and flavor. Light and refreshing without feeling thin.
Golden tan with a haze and Nice white head. Floral smell. no taste of anything other than hops and overly bitter finish

Reviewed March 23, 2014.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a mildly hazy gold color. The head is a finger high, and eggshell in shade. Retention is mediocre, while only a small film of lacing is left behind.

S: Lots of hop action going on here. Onions, mango, papaya, cat pee, grapefruit, pine, and even some herbaceous tones here and there. Even some damn garlic - and you know what? I dont mind. Malts...well, they dont get in the way, lets leave it at that. This is stanky in all the ways I like an IPA to be.

T: It starts off with a lot of onion-y flavor, with just a light amount of fruitiness. Theres a surprising amount of sugar cookie in the middle. Im kind of sad that this isnt loaded with awesome tropical fruit flavors, just some onion and piny bitterness. However, this isnt so overly bitter as to kill this beer - the malt bill is quite prevalent here. Id even suggest its the least bitter of Stones IPAs. Not very complex, though.

M: This is substantial for a 4.5% IPA, and thats good. However, its just not as drinkable as Id like from the aforementioned style. Its nicely carbonated, but not very dry finishing.

O: If the idea of this beer was to create a small IPA that drank like a bigger one, then mission friggen accomplished. While this is a solid beer, Id rather pick up Stones regular IPA - its more interesting flavor-wise and priced the same. Worth trying anyways.
0,15l on tap @ Stone Berlin (brewed in Escondido). Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is malts and tropical fruits. Flavor is malts, fruits and hops. Good stuff.

duft: citrus lime frugtig frisk appelsin 
smag: citrus lime frisk appelsin

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruitpeel. Flavor is rather bitter, light malt, grass, fruit, citrus, lemonpeel, grapefruit. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 250516
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, grass and malt. Nice fruity finish.
Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, grapefruit and pine. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grapefruit, pine, little sweet and medium bitter.

Shared bottle. Clear pale golden with a large offwhite too. Aroma of tropical fruits with some pine, resin, grass and caramel. Taste is grassy hops, modeate bitter. Some pine and resin too. Well balanced. Lingering bitter finish. Dry. Quite drinkable but very bitter.

Bottle. Nose is pine, citrus, lemon, herbal, light pine. Taste is lemon, citrus, grapefruit and hint of lime, light citrus and pine bitterness, with a pleasing medicinal bitterness. Nice balanced malt in the body. 

A lovely session IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2017 From XXXII. In Teku glass. After dinner. A good dose of bitterness and citrusy in a good body for such a low ABV. Avg 4.48

18 Jun 2017. From Zombier. Can. In Teku glass. At lunch, with golden bacalao + russian salad. Perfect for these hot summer days, very refreshing and full of tasty and well adjusted citrusy and piney hops. Great body for a session ipa, not watery at all.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light golden with a one finger blonde head and massive lacing. Aroma is standard Stone IPA scent of heavy hops, citrus, and pine. The light color and scents show through fully in the taste with a real nice hop flavor and absolute bare minimal malt. Better than average for a session but not a great IPA.

Pours an almost clear golden color with medium off-white head. Nice citrusy aroma, grapefruit, pine, flowers and a bready backbone. Taste follows the aroma, really intense to be "sessionable", citrusy, grapefruity, piney and floral, with a balanced malty background and a moderate bitter aftertaste.

Aroma: sweet fruits, pine, resin, candy
Taste: medium bitter, pine, resin, citrus, sweet fruits, alcohol

Draught Fermentoren. Golden coloured. Dense off white head. Aroma. Herbs, flowers, tropical fruits. Flavour. Herbs, flowers, tropical fruits, sweetness. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Glowing amber small medium dense head pine and orange dominate in aroma and taste good mouthfeel fir the abv, but some what one dimensionional taste wise.
Pours slightly hazy yellow, moderate off white head. Aroma is grapefruit, grass, pine needles. Taste is pine, grapefruit, some light malt. Light medium mouthfeel. Pretty good for a Session IPA.
Clear yellow, white lacing foam head. Strong hoppy aroma and strong bitter taste. Long aftertaste. Great beer. (Galveston 201605)
Flaska @ Bishops Arms (GAT), Malmö. Dimmigt gulorange med ett vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av apelsin, grapefrukt, tall och mineraler. Sträv munkänsla, medel mot hög beska.

On tap @ lambrate via Adelchi. giallo dorato, con riflessi ambrati limpida, schiuma bianca fine non molto persistente. aroma molto intenso, complesso e molto fine. agrumato e citrico, molto decise le note tropicali con mango e frutto della passione, maltato, miele e caramello. erbaceo e resinoso meno marcati ma presenti. gusto secco, amaro, acidulo. erbaceo e citrico, con leggera maltatura melliflua. poco calda, carbonatazione fine ma piacevole, per certi aspetti rotonda con qualche punta ostica e astringente. abbastanza equilibrata e decisamente armonica.
Pours a cloudy golden yellow. Aromas of citrus and a little of the tropics. Smooth easy drinking with flavors of citrus, grass, and yeast.

aroma is citrusy and hoppy. Also some mango, pineapple, but mainly citrus. Taste is fruity with a kind of deeper malty sensation than general session IPAs, it creates some depth. Sweet oranges, pineapple and grapefruit. Great stuff.

Bottle. Pale straw color with good thin foam. Aroma: juicy and fresh, floral, citrus and tropical fruits, passion fruit. Taste: very fruity, citrus, light and refreshing, pleasant mild bitterness. Good one.

Tap at HBF 2016, Helsinki. Colour is clear light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, minerals, hops and malts. Pretty clear but I think west coast hopped ales have problems.

Cirtrus, bread, pine. Pleasant aroma but not what Id call strong. Pale and a bit too clear for me, huge rocky head too. Taste is predominantly bitter but its well balanced. The texture is too thin in my opinion, and the bitter finish is maybe a bit too long. Its very drinkable though, but there isnt much to it. Being my first beer from Stone Brewing I was expecting something a bit more special. Not saying its a bad beer, just not outstanding. Being relatively expensive to get in Spain, for me its not worth it to repeat.

0,33lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
dafuq. Session IPA with HUGE power. Aroma, body, taste - everythings up hopped and it stays very drinkable. The best so far Ive had. And 6 months after bottling (bottled October, got it yesterday). All that hops with exotic fruits and grapefruit/grapes are there in aroma and taste. Maybe too much for a session IPA, but it worked for me

Pours as pale as a lager. The aroma is resinous. It smells as fresh a handful of hop pellets which is very impressive given how far this beer has travelled. Flavour is slightly unbalanced on the hoppy side but that's hardly surprising from a session IPA. Very fresh tasting beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 0,33l zakupiona na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa 2016. Złote, mętne, piana przeciętna. Aromat nafty i tytoniu z przebiciami owoców. Smak gotowanych warzyw, trochę cytrusów z goryczką grejpfrutów. Spodziewałem się czegoś ach,ach,ach a dostałem przeciętną IPA, nic szczególnego.
Tap @ Flandes. Hazy straw coloured with a white head. Nose is citrus, dish cloth. Flavour is grapefruits, citrus, bit of pine. Medium carbonation. Very decent.
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 Clear golden with a white head, looks like a macro in the glass but it?s not! Very fruity aroma, taste is all hops: mango, fruit, bitter in the end. Lovely session IPA.

Pours yellow with light head. Aroma is fresh, fresh grass, different fruits, sweet berries, floral notes. Taste is quite same, fresh - a lot of flowers, and fruits, some resin. Quite soft and easy. After reveals strong hops and lilac. Very nice beer!

Pours straw color with a light orange hue and fluffy white head. Aroma is orange zest with sappy pine. Flavor offers more tangerine sweetness with only mild bitter kick and a subtle tartness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to Dblock. Pours a hazy yellow gold with medium creamy off white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit and dank. Medium mouth, juicy, mango, light bitterness, good.
Bottle from a friend. Hazy golden color. High bitterness. Aroma is high resin, mango, herby.
The Stone Go To is a top end session IPA. Citrus, Rind and a touch of dankness combine in a very fresh hop profile. Lots of body and richness for a session IPA as well
Fresh feel / Light body / Golden orange color / Citrus hop / Good balance / Fine session ipa
Smell of fresh grass. Long lasting head on cloudy golden color. Medium Carbonation. Vibrant fruity smell of mango, peach, pineapple is really nice.

BOTTLE. See through lemon to gold pour with thin white head.. Big sweet hoppy nose, pineapple & passionfruit seems to be prominent..
