Sweet fruit hops throughout the taste, passionfruit ice cream vibe in the middle, finishes fruity still with a good acidic bitterness that lingers.. Sourced Cellarbrations @ Capel
Scent of fresh grass. Steady head on cloudy golden color. Has long-lasting bitterness.

April 26th, 2014 - Stones Go To IPA is an early foray into the trending style of Session IPAs, and a welcome one, too. Especially in April, I dont want a beer to tranquilize me for the whole of an evening, but I do want something fuller and bulkier than a simple lager. Stones Go To IPA fits the bill, packing a lot of flavor into an easy-to-digest brew. Its punchy with that characteristic stone dankness, alongside smells of pineapple and brussels. Orange makes an appearance with a little warmth, but not before. The touches of citrus are absent in the flavor profile, which is dominated by floral, hoppy and toasted bread notes. Cardamom seeds add an interesting spice, but overall this is a tasty and savory IPA - perfect for pairing with a pipe on a porch.
Bottle from Shaws. Pours a clear yellow with thin foam, lively carbonation. Crisp and light with a hop burst on the finish. Lingering pine notes. Really good session.

330ml bottle from Beer Cartel, Sydney. A clear golden amber with a small and somewhat lasting, somewhat lacing white head. Really fresh and vibrant aromas of mango, peach, pineapple and tangerine. Similar to taste but with more resinous, piney, grapefruity bitterness. Light to medium body but full flavoured for the weight and ABV. Medium carbonation prickles the tongue. Medium to full intensity and length bitterness to finish. Very good. Could drink plenty.

355ml bottle. Enjoy by 13 July 2016. Stemmed glass. 
Wow, after assaulting the nose, this beer grabs the tongue with two full hands of hops and then hangs on, long after the liquid has hit the gullet. Aroma clearly of tropical fruits and pine. Pineapple, mango, and piney. Golden to pale yellow. My beer was exceptionally frothy. Flavour was all upfront hops and then lingering bitterness. Then you realise it tastes just like grapefruit. Now dont let that put you off, as I dont like grapefruit, but his is amazing. It has all the tang and bitterness of a grapefruit, but somehow manages to still be nice. Its like there is a hint of another citrus fruit that just saves it from being too tart. So this beer is light on sweetness, big on bitterness with a finish on sour and a hint of salty at the end. 
Im a malt guy, but this is a Wow beer. Too big for larger lovers, but if you are after a hop hit - this is right up there. 
The beer is also 4.5% but comes across bigger and slightly alcohol hot.
Just way too expensive by the time it gets to Australia. $7 a bottle or $30 for a full six pack.

Draught at Braukunst Live 2016 - FR4, the all-draught Stone Berlin stand manned by staffers doubled up in a helix of deep Cali-Berlin relaxation. Looking forward to seeing that spirit canned on the continent. - Expressive nose of tangerine peel and juicier lime, quite inviting for otherwise austere Stone. Herbal and dry, melissa and nettle in flavour joining the restrained juiciness, making for a more inviting and actually sessionable drinking experience than many of their forbidding pine bombs. State of the art hop engineering for the people, not just the saturated geeks.

Poured bottle into Teku. Solid aroma, in your face resin, floral, your Stone hops. Appearance is slightly hazy golden yellow with a sustaining white head. The flavors disappoint compared to the aroma but thats true to the style with most session IPAs weak on flavors. Overall a very well made session.

(draught) slightly hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of green grapes and sticky hop resin, with some notes of lemonade, mild sauerkraut and cactus juice. flavour is mostly herbal hops, nettles and hay, rather simple, with a touch of lavender and a light-bitter medium-dry finish. light- to medium-bodied with average carbonation.

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a clear pale yellow color forming a medium light white head with lots of lingering soapy lacings left in the glass. Nose is very fruity with notes of passion fruit, grapefruit and watermelon. Orange and zest. Pale malts. Taste follows the nose: passion fruit, grapefruit and watermelon. Slightly sweet upfront becoming quickly dry and bitter. Pale malts. Light body. Good carbonation. Grassy bitter aftertaste. Strong notes of passion fruit. Great session IPA.

Simple, but quite nice aroma kick even thou it was late evening. Mostly grapefruit and grassy kick, some mango. Light sweetness with moderate to light bitterness. Nothing too fancy, but lovely refreshing.

Draught at BKL München 2016.
Golden, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, off-white head.
Aroma of juicy passion fruit, grapefruit, orange zest, moderate caramel.
Taste follows this, but a bit lighter.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes dry, bitter, zesty, a bit piney, fruity.

Tasty. Very easy, crisp and refreshing. The nose is very lovely, taste is a bit lighter. Pretty perfect Session IPA.
Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is shallots, grassy hops. Taste is buttery and grassy (but nice), very bitter, but traces of sweetness detectable. Crisp. Not a bad Session IPA!
Another Session IPA? Do I have to keep doing this? I think yes. Shared by a friend at a poker game. I have such good friends.
On tap at Hair Of The Dog, Bangkok. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine. Bitter finish. Nice.

Kran. Barwa złota klarowna. Pian biała, średniej wysokości utrzymująca się do samego końca. Aromat intensywny, owocowy z wyraźnymi nutami mandarynki, ananasa, po chwili na drugim planie nuty żywiczne, leśne. Bardzo fajnie wszystko ze sobą współgra. W smaku analogicznie. Goryczka średnia, w miarę ogrzewania piwa lekko zalegająca żywicznymi i grejpfruta nutami. Bardzo pijalne.
Bottles from willow park. Pours light orange with a small head. Aromas of citrus and malts. Medium bitterness and well carbonated. Very good session beer

IBU : 65  
Kolor: Złoty. Piwo jest w 100% klarowne. 
Piana: Drobno pęcherzykowata, śnieżnobiała.
Bardzo ładnie się buduje, długo utrzymuje się.
Krążkowanie i wąsy piwne bardzo trwałe i bogate. 
Zapach : Już na samym początku pojawia się przyjemna mandarynkowo-ananasowa woń. Po chwili przeradza się ona w sosnowy przyjemny zapach. 
Smak : W smaku pełnia owoców cytrusowych.
Dominują te kwaskowate : pomarańcze, grejpfruty, limonki oraz niedojrzałe ananasy.
Żywiczne, sosnowe nuty są wprost nie do opisania.
Goryczka ma charakter grejpfrutowo-mandarynkowy.
Jest ona długa o znacznej sile. 	
Na końcu jest lekkie uczucie ściągania na języku.
Piwo sesyjny i bardzo pijalne. 
Wysycenie: Niskie. 
Podsumowanie:

Jedna z najlepszych Session IPA jakie w życiu piłem.

Browar Stone Brewery z San Diego jest jednym z najlepszych browarów na świecie. W dużej mierze specjalizuje się w piwach w stylu : IPA, Double IPA i Triple IPA.
Od 1997 roku tworzy i popularyzuje styl West Coast IPA na świecie.

Go to IPA to wyjątkowe piwo, które zaskakuje swoją intensywnością aromatów i smaków.
Żywiczna nuta sosnowego lasu jest bardzo sugestywna i wyraźna. Owocowa baza pięknie współgra z konkretną mandarynkowo-grejpfrutową goryczką.
Golden clear with medium white head. Nice hoppy aroma. Good refershing bitterness rich of fruity/citrusy notes. Nice lasting aftertaste. As session IPA shall be - rich bitternes, but light body.

bottle: pours a yellow straw colour( slightly cloudy ) with a good head that dissipates quickly, very strong tropical fruit blast ranging from pineapple to mango and papaya, there is a mild malt background toa significant bitter finish, it has a light body and lively carbonation, overall a very good session ipa ..........
Bottle. Fizzy yellow gold body. Medium white head. Acres of tropical fruits. Bitter with a dry finish.
(On tap) Amarelada palha, turva, espuma branca cremosa de boa formação e persistência. Aroma bastante frutado, laranja, limão, cítrica. Paladar refrescante, corpo leve e média carbonatação.

On tap at the great beer bar shared with Jmgreenuk.
Medium creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lovely tropical fruit bitterness. Very nice

Bottle. Pours light cloudy golden with white, foamy and bubbly head. Aroma is packed with mellow hops, grass, resin, pine, peach, grapes. Tropical hops yea. Light biscuit. Taste is tropical fruits, resinous, harp, pine, quite bitter, grapefruit and orange zest. Body is oily, avg. carbonation and really dry finish. Long lasting.
Bottle split with friends, thanks Lukas! Light bronze pour with a frothy head. Notes of stone fruits, peaches, light resin, mangoes and apricots. Solid!
Bottle. Pours yellow, small head. Aroma of jackfruit, mango, grapefruit. Taste of grapefruit zest, jackfruit, guava.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2016 classic american ipa aromas, hoppy,flowers.the body is crystal clear and the color is golden.the taste is bitter and hoppy but with a nice balance due to the malty backbone .the alcohol is not present.very drinkable.

Bottle thanks to LukasMH. Pours an almost clear, light yellow/orange with a small, soapy white head. Aroma has lots of floral hops, mellow aromatic mosaic hops, dank, very light maltiness, slight bread. Taste is super dry, crisp, light but fruity, slight bready sweetness and a subtle hoppy bitterness. High carbonation and a crisp, light oily body. Doing very well for a 3.5 month old session ipa!

Light and hazy amber with a small white head. Sweet fruity aromas translate to tart fruit flavours with a strong hoppy bitter finish. Light malt flavours. Perhaps lacks a bit of sweet tropical fruit flavours for balance, but overall really enjoyable.

Pour is a clear golden with a large white head. Aroma is a pleasant hop. Grapefruit and sweet onion. Flavor is again a pleasing hop. A bit thin like most of these session IPAs but this is real clean and refreshing.
Golden colored IPA, citrusy and hoppy aromas but as soon as the aromas kicked in it becomes flat and bodyless

On tap at Pub Escondido, Rio de Janeiro. Pours hazy pale yellow with frothy white head. Amazing citric aroma, grapefruit, passionfruit, mango and some pine. Taste is juicy, fruity and quite bitter. Light body, soft carbonation. Another Stone excellent brew.
Tap at florent, san diego. Clear golden color, white head. Malts and fresh hops on nose. Fresh hoppy taste, malts, fruity.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear golden beer with a small white head that fades away quickly. Fruity aroma of guava, grapefruit, strawberries and hops. Taste bitter with a somewhat sweet fruity finish. Light bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Very drinkable with a light mint aftertaste. Definitely my go to IPA.

Bottle, 355ml. Clear golden with a large foamy offwhite head. Fruity hop aromas: guava, grapefruit, resin. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Lightly sweet with a subtle bitterness. Delicious fruit and malt character. I could drink an indefinite amount of these.

Growler pour at home from Andrew Hilton Wine & Spirits in Lethbridge. December 19/15
Keg was dated as brewed November 25/15. Definitely an optimal beer experience when drank very fresh. 
Appearance is a light goldy, pretty color. Light head with small lacing. 
Aroma is lots of citrus, pineapple, piney tropical scents. Very pretty. Taste is more citrusy fruit flavors and subtle pineyness with light floral bitterness. Very well balanced. Finishes with a nice, pleasant bitterness. Would drink again. 5 out of 5 buckets.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w jabeer. w najwiekszym skrocie: bardzo aromatyczna, cytrusowa (choc ciut slodow, zywic sosnowych czy inszych tropikow tez jest), lekka, rzeska ta ipa. intensywniejsza w aromacie niz swieza berlinska podstawowa Stone IPA. klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle consumed at common compound on the night of the Top 10 Songs from The National reveal. Beautiful orange with golden notes and an assertive frothy white head. Aroma is citrus rind and slightly floral. Taste follows suit with citrus (grapefruit) taking center stage. Bitterness but not overwhelming. Just right. This is how a session IPA should been done. Incredibly drinkable and approachable. Impressed to see Stone use such restraint. Ill be going to it again.

How: Bottle.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, pine, floral, bread, malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, floral, citrus, fruit, hops, pine.

Bottle. pours a pale gold with medium carbonation. 

Aroma. Nice Juicy citrus, with some complimenting tropical aromas.

Taste. Piney bitterness on entry, with stonefruit, tropical and citrus flavours supporing the piney bitterness which lingers throughout and is present on the aftertaste.

Overall. Full of flavour and complexity and at 4.5% it definitely punches above its weight, quite a spectacular beer and proof you dont need big abv for big flavour and complexity.
This is an interesting beer. Very hoppy such light abv and very citrusy with lots of grapefruit flavors. Strong on the pallet yet fairly thin bodied at the same time..
Bottle at SFO. Nicely tropical fruity hoppy, lightly resinous, nicely malted. Great flavours considering the low alcohol grade. Medium body lively carbonation.

DATE TASTED: December 6, 2015 ... GLASSWARE: Barley Creek pint... OCCASION: toasting a 2-10 Browns team--first overall pick, here we come... APPEARANCE: golden amber body that cascades bubbles erupting upward; the head is stuff of legend, a creamy, single-finger consistency, while its lacing arches upward in coral-like strength... AROMA: dank Columbus and pungent Amarillo begin the experience, with aromatic lilac putting the West Coast squarely in its profile... moderate tangerine, grapefruit and mango make for a promising, yet scaled-down IPA... PALATE: full-bodied, explosively vibrant and strong in its aftertaste... light in its weight, with little suggestion of malt... a sessions ale, as targeted...TASTE: the dank, earthy spruce is here--strong, lingering and saturating... the mango and tangerine proves fruitful, while light malt presence ensures the hops are glorified--bitter and singular in its dank hoppiness... OVERALL: a beer that doesnt seek balance--and Stone doesnt seem to apologize for this either--and rewards in its singularity... difficult to believe that this is 4.5% ABV, given the amount of flavor packed into each sip--a joy to imbibe mid-afternoon, with no alcohol drag and a bombast of pine and citrus... an out-and-out win...
Bottle. Hazy gold with medium white head. Fruity aroma, hops, pine. Sweet malt flavour, long and strong bitterness

Pours a slightly hazy, pale golden yellow color with a one finger frothy white head that slowly settles into a lasting ring. Decent retention with streaks of soapy lacing coating the glass on the way down.

Earthy pungent aroma with a strong summit/green onion presence along with earthy pine and dank resins. This is countered by sweet citrus and faint tropical fruit sweetness. Some pineapple and grapefruit along with a touch of mango/papaya. Nice balance of earthy and fruit notes but the onion-y summit presence is a bit overpowering and stronger than I prefer.

On the lighter end of medium body with a complex hop profile countered by a subtle malt backbone. Lots of earthy bitterness but not too dry with plenty of sweetness balancing things out. Dry and resinous with strong pine needle and spruce tip flavor. Grassy with some straw and spicy hops. Slightly vegetal with again a prominent summit/green onion presence. Not as strong as in nose but still one of the dominant flavors. Better balanced than the aroma with earthy bitterness, subtle light fruit sweetness and pale malt backbone. Some pineapple, grapefruit and tart lemon pith. Biscuit malt backbone with some bread, cracker and light fruit. Not overly complex or out of the ordinary but its a very enjoyable session beer that remains pretty drinkable. Could use a bit more sweetness and and the onion summit character could be a little less prominent, but overall this is a enjoyable, easy drinking beer.

Cloudy orange with moderate head and light carbonation. Light sweetness turns to grapefruit and then grassy dryness. Nothing overdone. A great low ABV IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great grapefruit aroma- very strong hoppy smell that is the best part of this beer. Taste is bitter citrus with very thin mouth feel due to low abv. Finish is a little dry but not bad. My first session ipa and I enjoyed it. Good when want an ipa "light". 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle. Hazy light orange with thick frothy head. Strong grapefruit floral nose. Pine and hop taste. Oily resin. A more drinkable version of their classic ipas. Very good.

12fl oz bottle at home from craft & draft, Amsterdam. Body is opalescent fizzy yellow golden, head is big, white, medium bubbles, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is lemon grass, flavor is grapefruit, tropical fruits, lots of hops. Medium sweet, medium hoppy bitter, light citric sour. Finish is long lasting hoppy medium bitter. Medium body, dry texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing, very tasty hoppy beer.
If anybody can create a perfect Session IPA it would be Stone Brewing. West Coast citrus and pine hops, light bodied and tailgate worthy.

Rated on 7-03-2015. This bottled beers appearance is a small smooth white head that mostly diminishes, hazy pale yellow body, fizzy carbonation, and a fair amount of lacing. The aroma is citrus and pine hops, grassy, floral, and earthy. The flavor is very bitter, citrus and pine hops, and earthy. This beer is medium bodied. A quaffable beer that with a good hop flavor. It is worth trying and it is a beer that I would drink again.

Rating #1300-21.10.2014 On tap at Stone Launch @craftbeeryeg. Yellowish amber pour with a bubbly, lasting white foam. Aroma is sweet citrusy, tangerine notes, mild grassiness.Taste is light citrus and pine sweetness, tempered by a tame hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied, mild alcohol warmth, and very well balanced. Crushable at 4.5%

Tap / Tirador.
@ XXXII, Sevilla, España.
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, fruity / Lupulo, citrico, afrutado.

This is the best of the so-called session IPAs that are on the mass market in Northern California. Some of the others are too one-dimensional = this one is nearly as nice as their regular IPA. A nice trend trying to get the alcohol down but preserving complex flavor, etc. why? cause i love drinking beer but dont like getting drunk!

Caña en Cimmeria 13..11..2015. Color rubio velado con bastante espuma blanca persistente. Aromas intensos lupulos verdes y bastante cítricos. Sabores también intensos herbaceos frescos y verdes bastante lupulados con buenos toques también cítricos. Cuerpo ligero a medio, algo espumoso y denso, fácil de beber en general pero con un gran sabor y aroma en todo momento para sus 4.5 vol. Amargo final seco y herbaceo, verde y más verde, bastante prolongado e intenso. Grandísima sesión Ipa. Para repetir sin duda.

On Tap . @Cimmeria, Oviedo 11/11/2015
Color amarillo, aromas y sabores citricos, cuerpo ligero.

Keg @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 11-11-2015.
In short: tasty citrusy pale ale.
Pours clear bright gold with frothy rocky white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Citrusy, peachy, earhty, pine nose. Light to medium body, average to high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is quite citrusy, refreshing, some zesty and earhty, pine. moderate bitterness, ends dry. Very enjoyable and quaffable.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours almost clear golden with a huge frothy white head. Aroma is rather subdued, with peach and piney hops. Taste is very weak bitter, more fruity sweetness here, with notes of peach, dry clean mouthfeel, grows on me for every mouthfull, high carbonated, piney dry lingering finish.
First stone IPA I actually really got excited about though most love them. Fantastic, juicy and actually a good body.
Bottle @home tasting General Election 2015 (rating backlog) Pours golden, white head. Nose is floral, minerals, lemon and grass. Taste of grapefruit and zesty lemon. Big bitter finish, nice.

Bottle. Cloudy dandelion-gold with a soapy white cap. The nose on this is absolutely outrageous -- just piles and piles of tangerine, lemon marmalade, funky grass and shortbread. I find it hard to drink anything because I want to keep sniffing all night. Some of the same hop notes -- sugared lemon, grass -- appear in the front of the flavor, while the back has a smack of honey-kissed crackers and citrus pith. The bitterness is fairly low, however, and the finish is much cleaner and subtler than expected. A fantastic easy drinker.

Bottled sample at Drink in Boston. Intense hops. Very bitter. Bubbly. Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Beergeeks Stone event. A great opportunity to check in with some great West Coast IPAs. Pours slightly hazy Gold with a White head. Aroma is bursting with grapefruit and has a background of pine. Taste has a lot more of that resinous pine. Grapefruit bitter. Delicious. Id drink it all day long
Light tan. Mellow hop nose, thin body, bit tinny, and a slight bitter hop note.

Clear golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, tropical fruits, grapefruit, apricot. Bitter hoppy flavour, grapefruit, very fruity. Bitter finish, hops and resin. Nice!(from 355mL bottle @ ZZT XII, Getting Joesd to this, Oirschot. Thanks for sharing, joes!)

(Draught at Beer Temple, Amsterdam, 28 Aug 2015) Golden amber colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with citrus, lemon peel, grainy malt and tropical fruit. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of citrus, grapefruit, lemon, biscuits and a generous citric bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty with a generous hop character. Highly drinkable. Nice one.

Thanks! to Joes. 355 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT XIII. Bottled on 28/08/2015. Hazy golden, small white head. Nose is huge fruity hops, onion, pine, nice balance with solid mocha & touch candy malts. Taste is juicy onion, grass, big fruit & onion, good caramel malts & sweet orange blanance. Candy & orange malts. Nice balance. Very nice.

Bottle in LA. Pour hazy straw with white head. Big sharp tropical fruity and passionfruit aroma, flavour is strong citrus hops - grapefruit. Bitter from start to finish. Medium carbonation, body thin. Bitterness is a bit harsh/sharp and malt doesnt back it up. I guess Id rather a summer ale style for a session hoppy beer - Id prefer less bitterness. Decent, but certainly not my favourite Stone.

Golden yellow color, between straw and pineapple. 

The aroma is that very pungent citrus aroma, that overbearing citrus hop that is native to all Session IPAs. Its severely unbalanced in the hop direction. Tangerine and pineapple, but somehow somewhat artificial. 

The taste is uber-citrus: tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit. Bitter and sweet at the same time. Almost no malt balance. When I was a youth I would have absolutely loved this, but today I think its too unbalanced. Very "bright" flavors.

The feel is prickly, almost fizzy. Due to its low ABV, its very drinkable, but its all yin and no yang.
On tap. Hazy golden, white head. Spicy hoppy aroma with some citrus, similar taste with rustic and earthy notes. Good dry final bitterness.

Cervesa amb fort aroma a cítrics, en boca segueixen, és lleugera i fàcil de beure.
Cerveza con fuerte aroma a cítricos, en boca siguen, es ligera y fácil de beber.

Where: A gift enjoyed at a tasting event, thanks Maxbier and dlovell2. 
Appearance: Pours clear, dark, and golden yellow. 
Aroma: Grapefruit, pine needles, apricot, and floral hops. 
Taste: Zesty grapefruit and piney orange rind with a strong, medium bitterness. 
Palate: Medium feel with moderate carbonation. 
Overall: Very good and delicious IPA.
A session IPA from Stone. Ok a bit cloudy in appearance, (it was a barrel change). At 4.5% fairly weak for Stone but ok, I wouldnt go out of my way to drink it if other Stone IPAs were on.

Bottle. Explosive! The aromas -- and many of them -- hits you right away! A floral explosion that gives way to a taste that is complex, multilayered and tight at the same time. Aftertaste that will go on for days and with only 4.5 that is amazing.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy, golden color with a thin, bubbly head. Light, citrus aroma with some hops in the background. Grassy notes as well. Dry, hoppy flavor with a light grapefruit/tart finish. Decent balance and very light. Nice brew.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 From bottle. Poured a light shade with loads of good hop aroma. Drank with plenty of hop flavor and very easy. Finished all too soon. A great session IPA

355ml bottle. Golden with a foamy white head. Nose and tongue of pine needles with a grapefruity citrus notes and a cereal malt baseline. Finishes with decent resinous dry hop bitterness. Does what it says on the box.

- Nose: punches well above its ABV in terms of tropical, floral hop: citrus-y (satsuma + grapefruit; a little pineapple too); a little pine. Also has that dusty cereal smell a beer might have if it contained wheat (which it might, judging also by big-time froth upon pouring/bubble count!).
- Body: thin; orange pith.
- Finish: short finish; OK bitter fade which treads a fine line between tropical fruit and soap.
- Delightfully light; tropical floral hops punch well above its ABV. Satsuma juice with nice amount of attitude (+ a wheat-y tinge) #StoneMe2

A 12 fl oz bottle with a bottled date of 20th July 2015 and an enjoy by date of 18th October 2015. Poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. It poured a clear golden orange colour with a one finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly but left a lot of spotty lacing. There was a very nice blend of tropical fruit, citrus and pine aromas. Strong mango, peach and apricot along with some light grapefruit and orange zest and hints of pine. Only a very light breadiness in the background. Like the aroma, taste is tropical and citrus fruits. Mango and apricot to begin with followed by some orange and finishing with grapefruit bitterness which is lasting. Medium bodied with mid to high carbonation. Overall a very nice IPA from Stone. The aromas are stunning and it is very easy to drink.
Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy aroma. Fruity malty piney hoppy grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy finish.

Half pint draught at Roundhouse before the dog park. Smells very nice, lots of bright orange and citrus, pith bitterness. Taste is resinous hop, pith, more one-note than the aroma but bitter and drinkable. Very enjoyable.
Dotado lechoso y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas intensos de resinas y pino. Cuerpo medio-bajo con sabor intenso de pino y menta y final de amargor resinoso intenso.

On tap at Brewdog Södermalm. 

A bit hazy golden with a white head. Fresh and hoppy with fruit, grapefruit and some hay. Soft and easy to drink with a medium bitter finish.

on tap at the stone tap takeover at kater murr in nuremberg. pale golden, quite clear with a thin but lasting head; aroma of grapefruit zest and pine; quick, plenty of zesty bitterness; nothing showy about it but does the job
Decent session. I agree with a previous reviewer, it is pretty one dimensional.
@ Brew Dog Södermalm 15-9-12: stor humledoft. Smaken har en bra balans, tydlig fruktighet. Gott

Bottle 355ml. Thick, fluffy head and hazy gold color. Pine with a little fruit in the aroma. Taste is a bit on the dry side, but a bit one-dimensional. Dont like the palate, the mouthfeel is frothy and foamy.
Bottle. The look is clear, small off white head, and golden in color. The smell is fruity, hops, nice fruit smells, little pine, pretty good. The taste is thin, pine, resin, fruit, dry, bitter.

Bottle. Hanging at the condo. This beer light golden yellow in color with a fairly frothy head. Aroma is blasting with all kinds of citrus and tropical hop. Medium to medium high bitterness. Nice mouthfeel. A great session beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lemon-gold with a fluffy, meringue head and a floral, hoppy nose. Lots of lacing. Lightly-carbonated with a medium-full mouthfeel and finishing with hops, grapefruit, lemon, and mild honey.

Nice session. I love the hop flavor for this "small beer." I am surprised about how this tastes and the low alcohol. The hops kill it here.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a clear orangey amber colour with a few millimeters of off-white foam that diminished quickly to a collar that laced OK. Carbonation low and medium to coarse. Aroma of pine, resin and citrus/grapefruit. Taste of grapefruit, pine and sweet malt with a nice moderate bitterness. Light body. Crisp, fresh, a touch dry and with a slightly oily mouthfeel finished off with a nice long lingering moderate bitterness.

Bottle. I was surprised I have not rated this. Initial pour of bright orange, and it almost seems to glow. Good aroma of fresh hops, lawn clippings, and grapefruit. Flavor is moderately bitter, citrus here as well as some pine. The hops are up front but there is some malt for balance. Very good session IPA.

From a 355ml bottle on 30/8/2015. Pours a clear light golden with a medium white head. The nose is very fragrant with lots of passionfruit, lychee and lemon. The flavour is also dominated by fruit - particularly lemon and passionfruit against a modest bready malt background. The bitterness is quite firm and refreshing, with some grapefruit. Light bodied with average carbonation. All up, a very nice little IPA.
Great session IPA, great hop smell. Mostly citrus and pine, fizzy despite anti fizzy nomenclature. Clear orange. A little watery but it is session. Go to for sure.

Light haze, straw colored yellow. Big, lacy, off white head. Very floral, estery on the nose, pine. Though I was expecting a bit more of a follow through, it was well made. Hopped throughout with a slightly bitter, malty medium bodied finish, some citrus.

Bottle. Slightly hazy polished brass body with a dense off white head. Nose of strong citrus and pine. There is also bread crust, wood and something sweet like peach cobbler. Tastes of bread crust and almonds are present. The finish has plenty of pine resin and bits of grapefruit rind. A overall well made balanced hop bomb that is pleasant to drink.
smells of pears and peaches, very fruity, pale gold bdy with a white frothy head, tastes of very sweet peaches, wheres my bitterness? watery too.
This is most tasty low abv pale ale I can remember - the dominant peachy hops really float my boat - the bitterness is exquisite - totally brilliant.

Bottle from Cork 57. Inviting gold body with medium head. Nose of hops and citrus. Taste also hops, citrus and nice carbonation. More subdued obviously on the alcohol side but still quite nice and fluid. Buttery finish.
Loads of pacific northwest hops. Grapefruit. Light body and really easy drinking. Thx seider.
Bottle in Seattle. Clean, very fresh juicy hop. Fresh aroma. A bit of grass, drier finish. Good session body, lovely hop character.

Draught @ Stone Brewing Taproom, San Diego, CA. Pours a clear bright golden colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of strong juicy citrus, some mild sweetness and freshly cut grass. Flavour of juicy dry citrusy bitterness, orange pith, dank hoppiness and mild graininess. Light bodied. Excellent stuff with high drinkability. I want more. A lot. This is what session IPAs are all about.

Tap @ Stone Brewing Tap Room, San Diego.
Pours clear golden color with a very small head. Very juicy aroma, orange and citrus notes, some floral hops and faint piney notes. Very juicy flavor too, quite dank hops, lemon and grapefruits with some faint grassy notes on the finish. Sessionable indeed, tasty.
4515
on tap oro carico velata schiuma media buona perisistenza sentore luppolata pellet buon asecchezza discreto maro buon abeva corpo medio

Full on aromatic refreshing amazing summer beer. Tropical fruits smack you in the face with a clean yeast character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat: wspaniały zestaw owoców z ananasem, mango, agrestem, melonem, gruszka czy liczi, wsparty nutami kwiatowymi. Jest także wyraźny akcent słodowy i słodki zbożowo- herbatnikowy. Dawno nie dałem maxa w tej sferze, ale ten aromat jest obłędny.


Wygląd: barwa złota, zmętniona. Piana biała, drobno pęcherzykowa, umiarkowanej wielkości i niezbyt trwała.


Smak: lekka słodowość, jedynie nieco słodyczy, z wyraźną chmielową kontra i owocowo- ziołowymi posmakami. Goryczka świeża, owocowa, aczkolwiek dość wysoka, niezbalansowana słodem. Z pewnością powyżej średniej, drażniąca i nieco zalegająca. Niska pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i typowo chmielowa końcówka z lekką nutą kwaskową. 


Niezłe piwo, ze świetnym aromatem, jednak goryczka moim zdaniem zbyt wysoka w stosunku do podstawy słodowej.

12 oz bottle to cervoise. Pours clear gold, small white soapy head. Aroma of pine, and pizza sauce (weird I know...but this is what a pizza kitchen smells like), onion and herbal dank.Taste of acidic grapefruit, resinous pine, blood orange and light pale malts. Obviously missing the malt backbone to get the session-low abv. Finishes with slight bubblegum and bitter blood orange. Decent for a session.

Bottle. Clear golden with a white head. The aroma is lovely with resinous hops, citrus, a hint of malt. The flavour has citrus (grapefruit) and a nice hop fruitiness. A decent bitter finish, and dry, Lean and clean. I would probably go-to this more often than not. A better name than Delicious IPA, anyway.

Tap @ Man in the Moon, Stockholm. Hazy golden, white creamy head. Hoppy citrus nose, orange peel, blood orange. Taste is fruity and bitter, grapefruit, blood orange, orange, caramel and pine. Bitter crisp finish.

From a 12 ounce bottle. Pours a golden straw with nice carbonation. Very fragrant; can smell from several feet away. Piney, citrus nose. Taste is a bitter vanilla orange, in a good way. Finishes relatively clean. Good beer.

Chilled and into a chalice. Hit and miss appearance - could mistake it for a BMC with chill haze. Misty and dull, yellow gold with a loose, sudsy white top. Nose is dominated by bitter orange peel and hints of mango, blood orange, grapefruit and camphor with a little candied rhubarb and marmalade. From a plump and characterful aroma to, well, not much at all on the palate. Bitter and watery thin. Camphorous finish reminiscent of sucking in flyspray, is just a little harsh. Palest malt adds a dustiness to it and it is on the dry side. Where did the fruit go? Couldnt get into it!(12fl.Oz, enjoy by 01/09/15, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Bottle. Pours clear golden orange with a lasting off white foamy head. Aroma of pine, grass, melon, apple, citrus. Taste is of citrus, pine, grapefruit, melon, mango. Lots of fruit flavours. Oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation. Solid easy drinking ipa.
Poured with a very thick cream-colored head. Cloudy, dark amber. Typical IPA with grapefruit and intense hop flavor. Also, something like peppers (reminds me of other Stone beers).
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Golden colour with white head. Herbal, vegetable aroma. Bitter, herbal, citric, caramel, sweet taste. Medium body.

Butelka; barwa jasnego złota, opalizująca. Piana drobna, ładnie zdobi szkło. Intensywny aromat cytrusowy, pomarańczy, cytryn, limonek, mandarynek, świeżego chmielu, granulatu, zielony od chmielu. Smak cytrusowy, skórki cytrusowej, zielony od chmielu. Goryczka wysoka. Orzeźwiające.

From my backlogg: 

Sample at Steampunk Bar, Gothenburg. Clear golden beer with an white head. Hoppy citrus tropical fruits caramell grassy aroma. Hoppy tropical fruits citrus grassy flavour. Really a refreshing lovely beer :-)

Pale golden color, very clear. Not much of a head after the pour, and barely a pencil thin ring of foam after a minute. Looks a bit lacking on carbonation, but the smell is definitely enticing. It has a big citrus hop nose as advertised, with fruity taffy notes and a floral tinge. 

The taste has the same citrus hop burst, and it really doesnt have much malt balance. It is clean, a bit watery, and where you expect that malt flavor to be, it is like it disappeared. The finish is nicely bitter, but still feels like it lacks something. The carbonation is actually fine on this beer, despite the initial appearance. Clean, light bodied. 

Stone definitely succeeded in what they set out to do here: a low ABV yet west coast hop intensified beer. I love the idea of a session IPA, though its hard to say if I love the finished product. Its very good, dont get me wrong, but just like some IPAs can get too strong on malt, this one borders on being too light. That being said, I am still going to drink more of this, and hopefully it grows on me more.

Bottle
Aroma-lemon, orange
Appearance-golden, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good
Bottle from 99 bottles. Pours light golden color. Thick white head. Scent is citrus, hops. Taste is grapefruit, hops. Lots of flavor. Tasty.

Served on tap. Orange color with a white head. Citrus hop aroma. Clean medium body. Hops, malt, and citrus are what are involved in this beer. Balanced but nothing special.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Pours golden with a big white head. Smells citrus, canned fruit, dry bitter, citrus with a similar finish.

Tap at Brewdog Birmingham. Poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is resin nettle hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a crisp, yeast, grapefruit citrus hop bitter, light spice palate. Light bodied with average carbonation.

Golden with a white head - Grapefruit and citrus hop aroma - Some malt in the body, but the most dominant flavour is the grapefruit - Finish is all grapefruit that goes on for a long time and is very dry - This was nice

Light, not too malty, and fairly refreshing. Jumping on the session IPA bandwagon with many other brewers. Personally I like the trend - dont need to be knocked over to taste a good beer. Some pine and citrus from the hops - nothing too distinctive - with a lingering bitterness. Good for summer.

Pours golden orange with one finger white head. Smell is strong. Floral. Pine. Taste begins small with malt but is filled with hops. Pine. Grapefruit. Very good. Strong IPA. Light to medium light body. Reg carbonation. Good enough for a second. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled, nice golden brown. Light crisp fruit hops with a piney after taste. Dont taste much malt, but a nice session IPA.

Not sure this one is a daily drinker for me. I like it, but I'm not sure how to describe it. I guess if I had to I'd say a light IPA, while light, still big on flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Teku glass. Golden, clear with medium, semi-densed, white head. Poor head retention and medicore lasting. Nice aroma of tropical fruits (lychee, mango), also floral and piney notes. Some fresh, ripped fruits. Taste is medium to high bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, fisnish is dry and bitter.

Pours orange with a large head.
Nose shows melon, floral notes, spicy hops and lychee. Very clean.
Similar flavours, very clean. Melon, spicy and floral hops.
Tap. Medium yellow with a foamy lasting head and significant lacing. Piney, grapefruit, slight ammonia, and sourdough. Grapefruit bitterness and a light sweetness. Body is medium with a foamy feel.
chyba nie do końca rozumiem idee session ipa, którego to to jest wzorcem klasy zero. Rzeczywiście piwo jest dobre, ale ... wole treściwsze piwa, a nie wytrawny ekstrakt z chmielu.

Clear, golden colour with quite nice white head. Hoppy aroma, grapefruit, pine, grass and gentle, malty background. Semi-dry taste, herbs, citrus fruits, grass. High, but short bitterness. Very drinkable.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, opalizujące. Piana średniej wysokości, drobna, trwała. Oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Uderzenie amerykańskich chmieli! Cytrusy (grejpfrut, limonka), owoce tropikalne, żywiczność. W tle nuty trawiaste i łodygowe.
SMAK: Słodowe. Cytrusy w smaku - konkret! Goryczka wysoka, zalegająca. Posmak ziołowo-herbaciany.
OGÓLNIE: Mocno nachmielone na smak i na aromat. Mega pijalne. Po prostu bardzo dobre piwo.

Lovely aroma bursting of tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, grapefruit, passionfruit, light slightly bready maltbase.
Golden colour, big white head, lots of lacing.
Big bite, lightly sweet, insanely aromatic, but a bit weak.
Considering ABV a very good mouthfeel, average carbonation, bitter finish.
World class in its style.

Nice take on the style. Strong citrus aroma with grapefruit. Light golden color with a lot of effervescence. Light palate and highly carbonated. Flavor matches the aroma profile with a lasting bitterness.

Poured into a shaker glass. Golden color with a white head. Aroma is all hops - floral and piney notes mostly with some citrus in there as well. Flavor has some biscuity malt and grapefruit and pine hop notes. Medium/light body with nice astringency. Solid session IPA.
Golden light color, citrus peach and passion fruit on taste with and dry and bitter finish

Kolor: Jasnozłoty. Piwo jest idealnie klarowne.
Piana: Obfita. Drobno i średniopęcherzykowa. Średnio trwała. Pozostawia przyzwoity lacing.
Aromat: Chmielowy. Grapefruitowy. Dość intensywny.
Smak: Piwo jest półwytrawne. Średnio pełne. Goryczka jest wysoka. Przyjemnie odkłada się na podniebieniu. Piwo jest mocno chmielowe w smaku - głównie grapefruitowe. Bardzo pijalne.
Wysycenie: Średnie do wysokiego. Za wysokie.
Opakowanie: Piękna malowana butelka na plus. Brak składu i mała ilość informacji na temat piwa na minus.
Uwagi: Jest to w istocie rzeczy APA, choć opisane jest jako session IPA. Bardzo pijalne, ze świetną goryczką i niezłym aromatem. Piwo jest bardziej chmielowe w smaku niż w aromacie. Piłem kilka lepszych APA, ale to na pewno jest w ścisłej czołówce. Szczerze polecam (nie jest też zbyt drogie - kupiłem je za 14 zł).

Light gold color clear bear, big over 2 fingers of white head but with medium and big bobbles. 
Aroma: 1st punch of citrus, tropical fruits, than unfortunately some skunk.
Taste: light sweet, medium to high a little bit lingering bitterness. Flavours of citrus, grassy bitterness on finish.
palate: light body, medium to high saturation, dry.
Overall: I like the body of this beer. Altough skunk and lingering bitternes kinda kills this beer. And it still has a few weeks till it will be out of date.

Very fresh, clean, refreshing, citrusy aroma. Its golden color, perfectly clear, with nice head and lacing. In taste its completely dry. There is no sweetness in it at all. Its highly drinkable, very refreshing. It has nice bitter line, with some fruity notes in the end. Its definitely great example of session IPA.

Pours a light copper with little to no head. Aroma is peach and fried onions, which isnt exactly off-putting but isnt enticing either. Theres actually a hint of crispy onions in the flavour too, which is bizarre, and a lot of malt as Ive come to expect from Stone beers. Probably wouldnt try this again if Im being honest.

Bottle. Clear pale yellow, almost like a lager and stable, big, white head. Aroma of peach, pineapple, pine, very low onion (probably Mosaic), only hops. In taste low sweet, very dry and packed with hoppy flavours of pine, citrus, grapefruit. Strong and short bitterness, fizzy carbonation. Fantastic.

"I had avoided this one for awhile because, well session ipas just really dosent sound right. I found a single so i tried it and.. Pours a perfectly clear light golden color with a one finger creamy white head. Big hops aroma with pineapple, honey, grapefruit, citrus peel, grass. Flavor is light malts stuck behind bright grassy hops with notes of citrus peel and pineapple throughout. Medium bitter. Light bodied with plenty of carbonation, finishing slightly dry. Probably the best of the session IPAs.

Golden color with a fine thick white head. Lovely lacing. Smooth nice grapefruit hoppy and tropical aroma. Medium body and an ok carbonation. Nice balance. Fresh tasty grapefruit hoppy, pine and tropical flavor. Lovely refreshing and tasty ale.[On tap Steampunk Bar in Gothenburg, Sweden]

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 4 week old 16oz. can into an IPA.
A: Pours a 1" frothy head retaining well, leaving a bubbly collar and leggy lace. Very clear brassy color with big lazy bubbles rising.
S: Soft, citrus and pine scent with  a bit of cracker malt. 
T: Bitter and mostly piney with big citrus pith. Sourdough malt note is almost overwhelmed.
M: Crisp and light bodied with medium carb level and a clean dry finish.
O: One of the better of the more widely available SIPAs and the new pintcan sixpack is a great value.

Bottle @ Bishops Arms, Gustav Adolfs Torg. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110715
UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 On tap @ Steam Punk Bar. Pale golden with a small white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, hops and bitterness. Medium to light body with a nice dry finish.

Bottle. Moderate light bread and roasted for the malt, moderate to heavy pine for the hops, light soap for the yeast, with faint dried fruit. Head is small, frothy, white with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is hazy light yellow amber. Flavor starts lightly to moderately acidic, then the long finish is moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation. Nicer smelling and better balanced in flavor than most Session IPAs.

Pint at Globe. Pours light gold with a white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit aroma with some pine tar. Flavor is overly bitter, but not crazy. Some citrus and pine notes, nothing crazy. Thin almost fleeting mouthfeel on this one. Bitterness is up front harsh but doesnt linger.

Aroma is citrus onion aroma hopping.Appearance is dark yellow hazy with small off white head. Taste is all hops, citrus oniony pine aroma hopping and firm crisp bitterness. Little to no malt noticeable. Palate is light and crisp. A little watery. Overall not bad but a little to small. Just comes across as a water pale ale. Still very drinkable.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of foamy fine to medium sized white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a very softly carbonated slightly hazy light yellow orange colored body and a good lacing. The nice aroma was citrus and hoppy. The crisp mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. The good flavor contained notes of citrus and hops. A decent one that I would consider buying again.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 Stones ISA, with creamy, snow white, stable and sticky head over a deep warm golden blonde robe with quiet sparkling. Lovely hoppy aroma of chamomille, dried apricot, hay, lemon peel, unripe pear, dried orange peel, cedar needles. Very delicate flavour: a clean, crisp fruitiness to begin with (pear, gooseberry, unripe pineapple), soft minerally accents and even a slight saltiness, citrus peel fraîcheur over a dry pale maltiness, only very subduedly sweetish and announcing a long, dry, mouth-lining hoppiness, bearing lemon peel and pine resin flavours and leaving no residual maltiness. Extremely thirst quenching and utterly refined at the same time: this is the best session IPA I had so far. Thanks to Ster of the BeerTemple for keeping this aside for me!
12oz bottle. Bright gold color with minimal head. Aroma is fresh hops and light malt. Tasty flavors of nice hops. Easy to drink certainly, but not exciting.

23rd June 2015Lightly hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light, semi dry and crisp. Light and mildly sweet malts. Hops are grassy pine with mild herb. Orange pith and modest hop spice. Light finish. Goes down very easy.

Sampled on 6/26/2015. This session IPA pours a medium yellow gold color from a 12oz bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is fruity and sweet, citrusy and piney. A medium bodied session IPA. The malts are fruity and sweet. The hops are citrusy and piney. Lively carbonation. A medium bitter IPA, lots of flavor and very drinkable. A nice session IPA, its not as over the top in bitter as one would expect with Stone. Although the bitterness does linger a long time. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
Citrus & some grapefruit bitterness dominates the lack of malt profile. Great brewery but session IPAs just arent my thing.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Aromas of orange, peach, a little lemon sherbert, some pine. Taste is tropical fruit, orange, citrus, with a decent medium bitter finish. Very nice.

Keg, BrewDog Leicester. Diaphanous straw skimmed with white. Aroma of throat sweet peach and honey; humid ganja leafiness, dry pine and cedar, vomited OJ, curry leaf. Robust pine, peach, flowers and curry leaf on the palate backed with a thoroughly decent stewed tea and dunked biscuit English base. Lingers with nut husk and grapefruit. Bittersweet and punchy. Cheeky little English-style lunch time refresher.

Bottle pour at Blue Line Pizza in San Carlos, CA.Got danker over the session but ultimately didnt have a lot of personality or character Id expect from Stone. To be expected for a Session IPA I guess.
Fast klare goldene Farbe mit einer schönen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch sehr grasig hopfig, trocken, frisch. Geschmack sehr hopfig bitter, grasig trocken, erfrischend, gut.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours golden with a frothy off white head. Nice pinepple aroma. The taste is quite spicy at first with resinous pine flavour. Nice lingering finish. Quite light in body with high carbonation. Nice easy drinking, but lacking a little in body and malt bill.

12 ounce bottle poured into a pint glass. Aroma is grassy hops. Taste is mild hops falling into a rather bitter finish.Solid beer but as this is the 5th one in a row Ive drunk its starting to get a bit too much for me. Would drink again but not for a bit
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Deep sun yellow with a frothy white head and excellent lacings. A burst of grapefruit, pine, dank grass and resin with a hint of caramel-biscuit develops on the nose. Softly carbonated, a bit slick with a medium body. A brisk biscuit sweetness up front is surpassed fast by a more and more intense grapefruit like hop bitterness, bordering at astringency. Lasting drying out yet juicy finish. Quaffable!

12FL OZ ($20 12pack) this is a quality IPA. I got fairly drunk on this and will approve mass consumption. hang over no present so I think it processed well lol. but it pours nicely and has a great look but thats less important that drinking it. its quality, it is a got to.

Pours a hazy golden colour with a thin white head and a little lace. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits, and nice light pine followed by grainy maltiness. Flavour is citrus, pine, tropical fruits, mild-medium bitterness, and grainy malt with a dry finish. Solid easy drinking session ale.
PunkAGM2015 rate catchup from notes. 6/6/15. Hazy gold. Hoppy and fruity. Soft fizz, sweet citrus and tropical fruit. Solid session IPA.

Bottle. Almost clear golden liquid with medium off-white head head. Aroma of citrus, pine, light graham cracker, mango and light honey. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of citrus, pine and grain. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice, drinkable. Could have a more modern hop profile.
Smell of mango, straw. Golden colour, white head. Aroma of mango, spruce, grass. Lively carbon. Mostly bitter.
Solid session IPA. Medium malt, toast, bread and a bitter finish with citrus/pine. Softer carbonation.
As with all Stone IPAs, full of flavour, great aroma. Enjoyed the stronger citrus notes.

My Bottom Line:
This refined Pale Ale showcases grapefruit and flowers in a bright and engaging profile which doesnt forget about sharing cracking cereals to support it all.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the shiny golden.
-The mouthfeel is silky and conducive to huge gulps.
-The hop character doesnt get overwhelming at any time.
-This is as well done as their bigger IPAs.... so I dont see myself drinking the 7%+ stuff when I can have it all at 4%.

On tap at Stone Liberty Station.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy golden with a thin head. Aromas are sudsy, floral pine with clean grapefruit. Some pineapple with grassiness. Flavours are sweet mango and pineapple with grapefruit bitterness and resinous pine. Mineral body with juicy oranges and lemons. Pithy to finish. Good.

Kind of nice. Bottle to pint glass.
On the soft side for stone, but thats a good thing. 
Aroma is a bit weak and the only thing I really get is some yeast. 
Taste is almost buttery. Lemon. Some grass and veggie, but slight. Would be nice with some steamed oysters or clams. Mmmmmm.

Pleasant.

355ml bottle, pours clear bright gold with a one inch white head. Aroma is light malty, very hoppy with piney notes, citrus, orange and lime, peppery spiciness, malts are light caramel. Body is light, texture is creamy and oily. Carbonation is soft. Finish is balanced well and ends moderate bitter.

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Slightly Hazy orange with small white head. Aroma is grassy and fruity with grapefruit. Taste is a bit too bitter for the depth of flavour, needs more sweetness to offset. Body is good, medium with a slight prickle. I prefer a good session ipa, to a session ipa trying to be a dipa, but this is good in some respects.
bottled, golden color, piney aroma, flavor has a touch too much bitterness and lemon, i didnt like this one as much as their other new offerings.

(12oz bottle) Pours a clear golden body with a medium white head. Aroma of pine, florals, orange, grapefruit, and grass. Flavor of orange, pineapple, florals, caramel, pine, earth, and florals with a moderately bitter finish.

The hop aromas just explode out of this bottle as soon as the cap is
popped. Rich, bright citrus and grassy notes. Lots of tropical fruit,
lemon, pine and a bit of orange and lime. Theres an incredibly bright
fruitiness in this beer. Bitterness is firm but balanced. Awesome
brew. Juicy and fresh.

Bottle 355ml @ La Quinta Inn & Suites, Portland, ME
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine and lots of hop pellets. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy bitter with a long slightly dry, fresh, bitter and citrus fruity and piney finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle at ölkiosken. 
Pours Amber with a white head. 
Drinkable, hoppy with lots of grapefruit and apricot .

Pours golden, almost clear, very small white head. Body is similar to lager. The aroma is pleasant, fresh and fruity (mostly orange), some sweet flavours and little bit of hops in the background. Taste is as expected, like a lightweight IPA. Moderate amount of hoppy bitterness, slightly dry finish. Smooth on palate, easy on the carbonation. Overall, very nice for the style.

Not quite clear golden with a light white head, visible carbonation. Absolutely huge mango nose with a slight bit of pine resin and dankness. Fairly bitter with a decent bit of honey malt sweetness. Medium finish that is quite dry and bitter. Lots of effervescence. Really nice.

Pours pale orange with a white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: floral/herbal hops, citrus , pineapple, grapefruit, malt, slight peppercorns, pinebitterness and lemon zest. TASTE: hop bitterness, citrus, tropical fruit, peppercorns, pineapple, caramel, malt, spices, slight stone fruit and pine. AFTER TASTE: peppercorns, hop bitterness, malt, citrus and pine with an oily and slightly dry finish. Great flavors and aromas without it being over powering or high on its ABV. Definitely a great "lawnmower brew" or summer brew.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 4.5%ABV.   IPA.

Tapped out a rich cloudy gold.  6ºSRM.

Nose has bright citrus aromas with grapefruit being most prominent.  Yellow grapefruit.  Some nice pine freshness in the nose as well.

Mouthfeel is sudsy.  There are full-bodied pale malt and crystal malt flavors of taffy sweetness, water biscuits, soda crackers and pale raw peanuts.  

Finish is short-medium with a pleasant hoppy finish with pine and grapefruit peel predominating.

Good solid IPA...a go to IPA.

Goes on Favorites List!

Clear golden body, slow effervescence, half inch of bone white head. Lovely aroma. Huge hop nose. Wonderfully fresh flavor. Light in body without being watery. A solid beer. This will certainly be a "go to" for me in the future.
Overall: Grapefruit, orange juice, soap, pine, bitter peel.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2015-06-01.

12 fl. oz. Bottle. 
Pours clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma pine, citrus, tropical, grapefruit, caramel. 
Taste little caramel sweet, nice fresh citrus bitters. 
Mouthfeel thin, dry. 
Great beer.

Appearance is golden and completely clear at first, but then a bit cloudy once all the bottle is poured out. A bubbly white head, a few bubbles rising. Aroma- tons of fresh hops, grapefruit, pineapple, pine, malts, hint of toffee. Smells great. Taste- lots of hop bitterness, orange peel, pineapple juice, fresh fruit, and more tropical fruit comes through as it warms a bit. Lots of pine, a long and very bitter finish. Really good.

Bottle from Craft Wine 260515. Vibrant golden colour with a low layer of white foam. Strong vibrant aromas of pineapple and passion fruit fill the nose. Great flavour, lots of fruit. Big in the mouth with a long finish. One of the best easy drinking IPAs I have had in a long time.
Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is fruit, citrus, pine and some hops. Taste is medium sweet leading to a hop finish. Not bad.
Bottle poured into tulip. Aroma of morning pine, slightly damp and tastes also of pine and citrus. Smoothes aftertaste. Maybe slightly overcarbonated. A satisfying beer.

Pours pale yellow with thin white head that laces nicely. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, little piney notes. Has more body than I was expecting, not much malt flavor as expected, covered by fresh hops from start to finish. Very light, very drinkable. A little more malt flavor and a little less hops would make this really nice.
May 22, 2015. 12 oz. bottle. How does a brewer pack so much body, flavor & hop-flora -- fully reminiscent of heavyweight IPAs -- into a 4.5 ABV brew? This "session IPA" is a masterpiece.
Bottle in post from brewdog. A lot of flavour, Pineapply, sweet and sour. Perhaps too intense for a session. Very good .
Keg @ Bundobust, Leeds. Pale amber with not much of a head. Tropical fruit hopped in both aroma and taste with a slight sour bitterness to it.

Draft at Braufest Berlin 2015. Pours hazy orange golden with a white head. Aroma of dank fruity hops, light sweaty hops, citrus and peach. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light to light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Draft sample @ Berlin Braufest 2015. 
Dorée, col blanc.
Arôme est houblonné à souhait dans la lignée côte ouest américaine, note prenante de pin de forêt et pas mal dagrumes.
Palais agrumes, fort centré sur le pin résineux, sec au fini sur de belles notes de melon. Malt prend un peu la place de passager et assure une base de grains qui laisse ample place aux houblons.
Slightly hazy orange pour, with little foam. Has got much of the classic stone hop flavour, and a fantastically bitter finish for a session ipa. Great stuff.

Bottle - pours gold with a slight haze and a voluminous white head. Aroma is citrusy but this becomes really piney after a swirl of the glass, this also bring out a slight Carmel malt hint. The taste is hoppy bitter and dry. The aftertaste reminds me a bit on a lemon lozenge in that its dry but also citrusy. Palate is light but lingering.

Pours a hazy, pale amber colour with a thick, bubbly white head. The aroma is of resin and the flavour of malt with a moderate bitterness that is long-lasting on the palate which may be due to an apparent complex hop profile. A good quality beer, but realistically too dear.

Draft @ Monterey Bar in Berlin


Appearance: Dark golden body, light white head

Aroma: Pine, citrus, fruit

Taste: Pine resin, grapfeuit, lemon, light bread malts 

Palate: Bitter but well balanced, great ISA
Bottle at tasting. Golden pour. Aroma of citrus and passion fruit. Taste is very hoppy, with citrus and passion fruit, dry finish. Session IPA thats still tasty and not watered down like too often.

On tap at Craft&Draft. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, light pine, some grapefruit, light floral. Flavour is light to medium sweet, light malty, hint of caramel, citrus, pine and grapefruit, bitter finish. Light bodied. Nice.
Floral, citrus aroma that isnt too strong. Pours golden, with a fast dissipating white head. Tastes of lemony citrus and hops. Dry with a medium long lasting bitterness.

Aroma: Heavy citrus hops aroma.
Appearance: Dark gold with rich white head.
Taste: Light sweetness with medium sourness.
Palate: Light body, thin texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: A solid, quaffable beer with enough depth and flavor to sustain it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This good for what it is. Ive been drinking red racer ISA a ton lately and this destroys it. Really IPA taste no brain spinning after one. Crisp clean tons of flavor, peachy gum, kind of a corn after taste. Finishes so very dry. Hot day chug chug chug away!!!!! Malts could be thicker but what should I expect from a light beer. A piney character starts to show up when warm. Needs to be cheaper.
A great beer. It has some really lemony notes that I like. The citrus is very nice as well. I could definitely drink this beer all night.

Bottled from Craft & Draft, BB 05/27/15, large sample. Clear golden color, medium frothy off-white head. Aroma of fresh grapefruity hops, bit pine, citrus, some malts. Soft to medium bitter in taste, bit citrussy, some caramel malt. Bit dry in the finish. Had it from tap as well two days ago, but bottled seems better actually. Enjoyable session IPA.
Poured medium amber with an off white head. Aroma of moderately heavy citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is lightly sweet, heavily bitter. Fairly crap.
On tap at BeerTemple. Golden amber with a white head. Floral hoppy aroma, malts. Taste is hoppy bitter, floral, malts, bready, dry, resiny ending. Nice.

Draft @ Beer Temple. Pours a hazy golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, a bit yeasty fruitiness in there as well. Flavor is bitter with a nice grapefruit influence and a very light body. Aftertaste is light and bitter, soft carbonation. Very nice stuff.

From 355 ml bottle. Pours a clear gold-amber with a thin but lasting white head. Aromas of lime, mango, guava, lemon, cut grass and a bit of pepper. Taste is soft fruit and sweet fruit up front before a pine resin and grapefruit bitterness sweeps in. Lingering citrus and pepper in the finish. Nice piney aftertaste. Like it a lot.
330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours clear amber with decent white head. Soft toffee & fruity hop aroma. Taste is sweet malts with a good bitter hop front. Easy-drinking IPA.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Poured into an English tulip pint. Clear pale straw color with a big foamy white head that hands around throughout. Big cat piss aroma on the nose with some white grapefruit pith and pine aromas present too. Light body with a strong bitterness on the palate. Nice bitter, dry and crisp finish. Gets a bit like hops and water as it warms up though. Still a solid session IPA.

Good head deep gold pour medium carbonation aromas pine citrus rich malt floral grassy note the flavours grass pine citrus medium bitter stone fruit nice hoppy mix the finish like this IPA good hop mix sweet malt bitter pine finish good
Well, its not the best ipa that Stone has delivered. Very refreshing! Grassy, fruity, intensive smell of pines, very light taste.
I never thought Id see the day, but here it isa Stone IPA that I dont care for. I guess they cant all be winners. I thought this was quite uncharacteristic for Stone. Thanks but no thanks.

355mL bottle from Slowbeer. BB 05/28/15
Pours a slightly hazy orange-gold body, small firm white head.
Pleasant hoppy aroma; mango, cut grass, pine needle, woody spice, with a touch of biscuity malt underneath.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation.
Packs a plenty of hops into the body; grass, green herbs, pine sap, woody spice & tropical fruits. Modest measure of biscuity pale malts, finish somewhat abrupt with a brash bitterness.
Plenty of hops, but lacking that bit of malt to provide balance.
Yellow colour, white head. Aroma of hops, mandarins, mango, peach. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter. Light body, thin slick texture, average carbonation. Very hoppy and wonderful.
Fantastic Light Blond Session IPA. Very fruity. Clean mouth in the end. Really dry. Late Check-in @London

Bottle. Clear gold with an inch of white head. Bright aroma of melon, grapefruit, a little hay and caramel, pine. Strange touch of capsicum. Lightish bodied, easily avoids the emptiness of some of these SIPAs - but then, it is 4.5%. Grapefruit is more prominent in the taste, which is fairly dry and quite bitter. Lesser tropical fruit and piney notes, malt is not doing much but is firm and pleasantly clean. Pretty good.

Grass, valencia orange, little resin. Early citrus in taste before hop flavour hits. But it is lingering bitterness at the end that makes drinker forget it is only 4.5%. 330ml, 1.26std drks. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma floral, citrus, 
Appearance golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, 
Taste medium bitterness, 
Palate medium body, lively, bitter, long finish, 
Overall a great session ipa that I would suggest to a friend

12 oz bottle at Agave. Amber color with white head. Aroma with tropical fruit, mango, peach, citrus, lemon and faint malty notes. Taste is dry and hop driven, light caramel, grapefruit, mango, tropical fruit, resin and floral notes.
Great overall hoppy beer to have on a regular basis. Has a wonderful citrus nose and wonderful finish.

Hrm. Nose is zingy with piney hops, with notes that are also tropical fruit, citrus, body odor, possibly dank but Im not sure. Malts are very very dry and thinned out, this beer is bordering on hop water, with a lingering spice and herb bitterness at the finish. Its alright. Pale golden color.

12 fl oz bottle from Brewdog online store. Orange golden colour, white foam head and aroma of tropical fruit mango, peach, citrus, hoppy. Taste is malt caramel with fruity, floral, hop resin notes, tropical fruit, grapefuit citrus and lingering earthy bitterness. Light bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry fruity tangy bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.
Golden with fluffy white head. Skunk and piss in nose and taste, bitter hops.
Tap @Brewdog Shepherds Bush. Clear light amber, frothy, fluffy white head. Aroma has strong orange, grapefruit, resin. Bittersweet grapefruit flavour. Short, bitter finish.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours hazy golden, nice two finger off white head. Some lacing and retention. Aroma of lemon and mango. Taste is nicely bitter, very little sweetness, just enough to balance. Light bodied, lively small bubble carbonation, resinous mouth feel. Finishes dry and bitter. Tasting notes of mango, pink grapefruit, pine and orange peel. An excellent session IPA!

Keg at brewdog Edinburgh... Deep copper... Big off white head... Soft sweet toffee fruit... Soft toffee.. Light cheesy fruits.. Soft fruits.. Big berries.. Big alcohol.. Juicy fruits.. Soft toffee fruit (previous is old guardian 15)

Keg at brewdog Edinburgh... Golden amber.. Big white head... Soft sweet floral fruit nose... Soft fruits.. Light sweet herbal fruits.. Soft toffee fruit... 3.4
Thanks to iNBe. Fan of the style, a hoppy beer that isnt so strong. Manages to lower the strength and maltyness but not loose balance with intense hops. Serving: Bottle
Nice dank, citrus, pine aromas, pours a golden color with a slight haze and a dense bubble white head. Pretty dry, has a thin spot, crisp with a decent bitterness pretty tasty session.

Oh wow, finally i got a chance to put my hands on a Stone beer, and also a quite rare style in EU, lets see whats up. Golden color, big and ultra persistent white head. Nose is amazing, an explosion of orange hops. Aroma is pure hops, and A LOT of it, loads of citrusy aromas with bitter orange peel and pine. Theres also a fruity shade of apricot and peach. Taste is obviously bitter, strong bitterness in the finish. Light body, average carbonation. Finish itself its ultra-dry, almost dehydrating
I dont find this to be very sessionable, the bitter trail is very hard to put away, however has it fashion. Cool in all senses.
Bottle at home. Citrusy piney bitter hoppy aroma. Lots of citrus, grapefruit and piney flavours. Dry and well balanced bitter.

12 ounce bottle. Honey gold color with a foamy white head. Grapefruit and pine nose. Spicy tropical fruit malt and hops upfront. Light bodied with complex citrus hops. Slightly bready with notes of vanilla and white peppercorns.
Look up sesh IPA in the dictionary, this should be it. Tons of aroma and flavor of a much higher abv (and expensive) beer. very well done!

Pour on tap at Mayor of Old Town, clear golden-orange pour with white head, aroma brought onion, garlic, pine, some resinous notes into a bit of lemon peel, touch of slight biscuit. Taste was a mix of biscuit, bread, some yeast into quite a bit of resin, pine, some oniony notes with a hint of orange, finishing bitter. Pretty nice, not my favorite hop profile however.

Light gold, hazy, tall head. 
Medium body, strong flavor, lean texture, long palate, steely finish. 
Very bitter, dry, good acidity. 
Intensely hoppy, herby. 
Not very filling, but very flavorful, true to the description of a session IPA. 
A bit too stern for my taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden honey ochre, hazy, one finger dense creamy head, good lacing. Tropical fruit, mango, bit tangerine, caramel malt, sweet and inviting. Fizzy, light to medium body, malty, sweet and bitter, dry finish with grapefruit. Nice balance and aroma, enjoyed!
Really nice aroma with pine, citrus, and grassy hops. Bitter, fruity flavor, with a spicy finish. Really good light IPA.
7.3.2015. Very pale. Aroma is fruity hoppy, grapefruit, pine. Taste has hops, fruits, pine. Very good for the abv.

Hazy gold with a white head. Thin body. Super bitter hoppy. Good citrus and pine notes. Way too much thin bitterness, though a session IPA is expected to be as such. A bunch of flavor but too bitter for the body.

Pours a simple yellow color that was slightly grainy. Aroma of light grapefruit, easy floral aroma. Taste is the same, with minor citrus flavors mixed with a flowery flavor on the palate. A very easy drinking beer, light and refreshing beer.

Une bouteille achetée à Portland. Un beau liquide doré translucide avec une mousse blanche épaisse. Un nez dagrume et de malt blond. La bouche est particulièrement amère avec des saveurs de vieux pamplemousse. Je ne suis pas convaincu par cette finale amère à la limite de lastringence.

Bottle from BrewDog Online. It pours clear gold with a decent white head. The nose is fresh, juicy, grapefruit, lemon parfait, grassy, dank and pissy action. The taste is crisp, refreshingly bitter, clean, grapefruit, lemon rind, light soap, fresh pine, floral, dank hops and just a touch of malty sweetness with a lingering, dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation. Crisp, clean and crushable. The bottle pretty much drank itself. Top notch session IPA.
Piney green aroma come from this cloudy yellow ipa. Citrusy bitter with low malt to balance. Light bodied and crisp with almost a buttery aftertaste. Bold hop flavor.

Beautiful cloudy golden pour and a big fresh citrus hop aroma. Flavor is all hop, bitterness isnt overwhelming but builds very nicely over time. Very light bodied but somehow not unbalanced. I couldnt imagine any less from Stone!

Bottle from Brewdog online, gold with slim white head. Aroma of citrus hops, pine and tropical fruit. Similar in the taste, lots of grapefruit, long and big bitter finish. Medium to light body. Very nice.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy pale straw coloured with a sharp orange marmalade flavour, malt and toffee notes followed by smooth pine on the finish. Excellent!
Cloudy golden beer with a bright white head. Strong aromas of pineapple & citrus. Taste of citrus, grapefruit... very bitter finish. Nice beer, and avoids being watery like many session beers are.

Average ipa in the session variety. Decent balance for a session ipa. Thin in the mouth. Nothing to distinguish it from the masses of session ipa recently released.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of lemon grass and citrus hops, taste is similar, good full mouth feel, dry, nice

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Bottled and canned.  Pours clear deep golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, peach, caramel and tropical fruit notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Sweet flavor that ends up dry an bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice SIPA.

Very good, drinkable IPA. Not too bitter. Citrusy, piney, hoppy without the excessive alcohol content. You can easily pound a 6-pack and not feel too bad about it. Stone rarely disappoints. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very good session ipa. Aroma is top notch. Hoppy, smells like B.O. Wonderful. Appearance is clear with a big white head. Great lacing. Taste is hoppy, great for a "light" ipa. Tastes more like a big boy. Palate is full bodied, maybe the best from a session Ive had. Overall, a session ipa that drinks like a regular ipa. Stone proves they know what they are doing.
Wow, what a dank iPa. Notes of super ripe tropical fruit, and weed. Taste actually matches and has and nice bitter finish. What a great way of making a session seem like as full blown IPA
I am really at odds with this style. Yes it is a good beer and yes it is low alcohol but why? Just drink the regular stuff.

Bottle. Hazy yellow golden beer with a small white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of citrus, grapefruit, pine needles and cooked vegetables. Flavor is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus, grapefruit, pine needles and mangos. Slightly unbalanced.
Bottle. I like how the blurb for this beer almost apologises for it before youve even had a sip. A decent enough beer but lacking a defining characteristic.

12 fl. oz. bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a small white head that laces. Citrusy aroma with pine. Sweet, hoppy, grapefruit flavour with pine, leading to a dry, bitter finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation.
Bottle. Awesome juicy fruity hop aroma. Dry bitter and citrusy taste. Very good. Long lingering bitter finish.

Tasted from a 12oz brown bottle into Spieglau IPA glass. It poured a clear straw colour with great big long-lasting white foam and lace. Fairly standard husky grainbill with faint malty sweetness hints of honey, but flavour and aroma undeniably dominated by a whos-who list of hop-bursted New World varieties: Mosaic, Citra, Ahtanum, Cascade, Crystal, 06300, El Dorado, Magnum, Sterling. Very fruity, musky, resiny as youd expect. Strong black currant and pine sap essence. Light body, strong carbonation to splash it all around, nice modest abv, lingering hoppy finish. Tasty and refreshing. I could drink a lot of this, which is obviously the point.

Keg @ Freshcraft.
Medium straw, white head.
Hoppy, citrusy aroma, spruce, grapefruit.
Dry, light to medium body, mid to high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Hoppy taste, orange peel, spruce, citrus, caramel.
Very drinkable. (2014-04-05)

Bottle from Appellation Wines Comely Bank. 
Appearance - golden with a generous fluffy head. 
Nose - citrus and tropical fruit. The citrus dominates. 
Taste - confirmed as per the nose. The grapefruit overcomes the mango. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - classic American ipa by numbers. Good stuff. Loads going on for the ABV.

12 ounce single bottle from the local Harris Teeter, as part of a create your own six-pack. Pours a golden color with a white head. Hoppy aroma, hoppy taste and a bitter after taste. I love IPA beer, but this one was overwhelmingly hoppy and it just didnt do anything for me. Too much hops and not enough pop.
Passion fruit, pineapple, green citrus, rosehip, big hop explosion on the palate, dry bitter finish. A classic Stone hop bomb with a reasonable abv.

Hazy yellow gold with a fluffy white head. The aroma is huge on pine, citrus, stone fruit, melon, pear, and floral. The flavor is more subdued, with pine, herbal notes. Strong, abrasive bitterness and medium body. Decent, but smells better than it tastes.

From bottle. I understand the need for a session IPA, but Ive yet to find one with as much flavor as I get from the bigger beers. Stone is one of the best, and Ive enjoyed many of their offerings. This one, from a bottle, has a nice citrus pine aroma and a flavor to match. All the hops are there. Color is a hazy yellow with a little bit of a white head on top and sticky lacing on the glass. Taste is more bitter than sweet. Nice enough, but Ill take an Enjoy By or one of the Bastards any day.
Draught @ BA Gamla Stan. A very hop dominated and sessionable IPA with notes of lime and apricots. Medium bitterness. Nice balance.
Tropical fruit on the nose with more apricot. Lovely described to fill the mouth for a long while. I really enjoy this beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 330ml bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Pale yellow gold, with white head. Aroma citrus, grapefruit, and tropical fruit. Great beer. 

Also tried the Stone Berlin version, which feels similar to the above.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */s. Orange hazy. Grapefruit pines, caramels on nose, berries, real classic caramel malty hoppy us ipa nose. Med light bodied, orang marmelady sweets, pines, citrus. Real nice bodied, for the abv, flavourful, chewy, great. Some hollowness in the finish, but couldnt tell its a lighter one. Great beer, probably the first session ipa that truly amazes me.-- bb

Draught. Hazy darker golden, small white head. Citrus and bit of tart garden berries in aroma. Well hopped brew. Grapefruity bitterness mostly in taste with some additional notes of slightly raw tropical fruits. Nice
and tasty considering the abv. Long-lasting bitter grapefruity finish.
