12oz bottle split 2 ways at fridge temp. very pale orange appearance. Aroma is citrus and orange juice forward. Very light taste, clove, apple, resinous / dank finish. mild overall. a bit thin but not bad.

Bottle from Henri @ San Francisco, CA - Color: clear blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: nice fruity nose with mango and pineapple domination. Taste: nice hoppy taste with fruity taste as mango and pineapple. Aftertaste: wet bitterness. Good IPA really drinkable but not exceptional for Stone.

Clear yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is fruity, citrus hops. Taste is a nice hop finish(fruity). Nice drinking experience, nice hop-malt balance. Flavorful hop finish. Lacing indicated each sip taken.

Tasting brings on a light bitterness, reminiscent of grapefruit rind, then the middle of the taste explodes with all sorts of hop delight. Pine, melon, light tropical fruits, peaches, very fresh and clean. But things get a little muddy without a malt backbone  the hops fall apart some, and garlic/onion begin to take over the flavor profile. The bitterness, while only 65 IBU, is intense, especially with the lack of any sweetness and the bone dry finish. As it warms, the finish became more pleasant with dank notes of pine. Go To IPA is light-bodied, with a thin, drying mouthfeel. The bitterness, while heavy, isnt too much, but it borders upon it.

Draught @ Gastropub Stones, Helsinki. Aroma has tropical fruits and strong citrus notes. Foamy palate. Flavour has strong citrus notes, some minerals, tropical fruits and some juicy tones. A citrus overdose with very aggressive hops. Becomes a bit stuffy at the middle of the glass with all the hops. I guess Ill be burping hops the rest of the evening.
Draught at 7 Days Brew. Deep gold, little lacing. Aroma is all citrus. Nice bitter hop flavour with a wee grapefruit kick at the end. Fairly dry finish. Entirely too quaffable...
On tap at the Meadhall, Boston. Pours hazy golden with white head. Piny and fruity hop aroma. Citrus and fruity flavor with strong hoppy bitterness and lasting finish. Very good.

On tap at Tilt, Oslo. Slightly hazy golden to orange with a white head. Hoppy aroma with citrus, tropical fruits and some mild malty and herbal notes. Moderate sweet with nice fruity and hoppy flavours and a bitter and citrusy finish. Tasty and sessionable, a bit thin, but nice and refreshing. Wouldnt mind having this in the stores here.

Honestly pretty good despite the low ABV, but definitely missing something. Strong pine taste, light and cloudy yellow color. Hops just arent quite right, which is something I feel like I often decide personally with Stone IPAs. Maybe too strong up front without a satisfying body in the finish. I like that its so session-able, though, and if Im looking to cut back on the alcohol content, this may be a strong "go to.".
One of my favorate session ipas. Lots of citus and some light resin. Malts are light cracker and not much else which is perfect. Hoppy mineral water done right.

Fruity hop aroma, lots of passion fruit some pine and hint of mango. Light malty taste with slight bitterness makes it a very nice session beer. The bitterness is there and well backed up buy the malt but it is not overpowering so you can have a lot of theese.

12oz bottle from Wegmans, Buffalo, NY. A hazy amber pour with a tight white head; beautiful aroma of pineapple and tropical fruits; immiediate tropical fruit taste, but then with a dry piney hop bitterness developing; giving a lingering finish. The body is slightly thin, but I guess thats to be expected, and otherwise theres nothing disappointing about this IPA.

.3l on tap @ Harrys 
Pours cloudy yellow with medium head. Aroma is exotic fruits, hops, malts, grape, pine and some birch. Flavor is crispy bitter. Mostly like aroma. Great ipa!
Served at a local bar. Amber body with a medium white head. Starts off fruity, but finishes more piney.
Keg at Man in the Moon.  Hazy deep golden, small head. Pear, pine and bread up front. Dry with light body and clean, fairly crisp mouthfeel. Pears and bread, notes of paper. Mid bitter finish.
Tropiskt fruktighet i aromen. Bra balans i smaken och bra fyllighet i kroppen till ABVn.
Hazy golden. Citrus and sweet, light and easy to destroy a few. Might have had a better rating the site didnt keep going down

Flaska systembolaget. Disig gul kulör med vitt skum. Väldigt humlefräsch doft av ananas, mango och barr. Smaken drar åt tropiska frukter med lite hö och örter. Fin maltbas i botten. Bra beska med fin torrhet.

Bottled at Steampunk Bar, Göteborg, Sweden. Shady golden, medium white head. Tropical fruit hop aroma upfront, with some piney notes and supporting grainy and bready malt. Light bodied, mmedium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

Bottle @ De Klomp. Pours pale golden with a small white head that slowly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is fruity and grassy with crackers, grapefruit, mango, lychee, star fruit, freshly cut grass, chives, pine needles, orange zest and lemon zest. Taste is bitter and grassy with crackers, grapefruit, unripe mango, moist grass, chives, pine needles, minerals, orange peal, lemon zest and hints of cardboard. Mouthfeel soft, astringent, tiny watery and light bodied. Finish is bitter with crackers, grapefruit, lychee, moist grass, pine needles, minerals, orange zest and lemon zest. Its a pity its a couple of months old when it reaches us in this part of the world. Its a solid session IPA which I hope to have fresh some day.

Draught at Brendan Behan. Cloudy gold with an inch of white head (rather light for an IPA). Aroma is huge lemon, lemon peel, some grapefruit and evergreen too, touch of sugar sweetness. Flavor is approximately the same (sorry, Im reviewing the day after.) Body is medium-light and slightly oily, moderate carbonation. Overall, a delicious session IPA with lots of hop flavor and a mellow bitterness.

Straw/gold, thick head one finger large. Big hop aroma - juicy tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, marijuana. Taste is crisp and strong with hoppy bitterness. Body is just enough to support all this hop action. Bittersweet with a dry finish. A nice alternative when you are not in the mood for huge syrupy hop-bomb IPAs.
Sharp alcohol hop aroma. Light hazy color with a small white head. Moderate bitter beginning and middle with a sweet finish.

330ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Almost clear golden color with white head. Hoppy citrusy aroma, pine, light floral, light malty. Light Sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

330ml bottle Rehills Newcastle. This is intense. Huge mango and lychee aromas, sharp almost acidic palate but balanced by some sweet malt. Packs a mighty punch for 4.5%, is rammed full of flavour but I dont think Id call it a Go To beer, theres just too much going on and is one for small doses
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, pine, and flowers - with a bitter finish.

A 12-oz bottle courtesy of my daughter-in-law Shannon in Idaho.. Poured a hazy straw yellow with a pillow white head. Good lacing. Nose of tropical fruit and citrus/pine. Medium body. Smooth in the mouth. Flavor is big one fruit with pineapple and the citrus and pine give it a dry bitter finish. Simply outstanding and shows once again a great beer does not have to be hight in alcohol.

I've been drinking quite a few imperial IPAs lately and almost passed on this beer due to the low ABV.  Stone's rep for making great IPAs changed my mind and I have it a shot.  I am glad I did.  It is sort of like hitting the reset button on your beer palate, and one mouthful reminds you why you love a good IPA.  It poured a fairly cloudy, yellow golden straw color with a sizable, coarse, pillowy head.  It smells of lemon grass and hops.  The citrus smell converts to a bitter grapefruit on the tongue.  The hops kick in and then a long complex and fairly bitter finish.  The name is appropriate, could be a Go To.

Bottle [from Secret Santa 2014] @ home. Slightly unclear yellow to golden color, medium sized white head. Aroma is moderately malty, very hoppy, fruity hops, grapefruit. Taste is moderately malty, very hoppy, a lot of fruity hops and grapefruit, medium to heavy bitter. Decent body and carbonation. Fruity hops, grapefruit and bitterness combined: I love it!

"Catty" aroma of citrus hops. Gold color with a thin white head. Semi sweet malt up front. Citrus notes right behind from hops. bitterness settles in next, more harsh than expected from a session ipa. Bitterness lingers in the finish...a bit too long. Watery mouth feel. Average.
Leave it to So-Cals Stobe Brewery to produce a mighty fine Session IPA. Like most sessions, its smooth with major notes of pine. Smooth and tasty.
Bottle at Draft House Tower Bridge. Gold lasting white head. Peach aroma. Thin on malts over carbonated. Hops and flavour are ok. Some toast. Ok. No world beater. Bitter on finish.
Stone frappe encore dans le mille avec cette session ipa goûteuse à souhait, bien houblonnée et si facile à boire. Parfaitement équilibré!
Yellow with medium carbonation, tons of aromas, piney and citrusy, orange, lemon. Medium light body, citrusy bitterness. An IPA to drink a lot.

Keg at Brewdog (18/12/14). Hazy orange, still, small white head doesnt endure. Aroma is very citrussy - orange and lemon with a touch of coconut. Very nice aroma. Body is medium, slightly foamy, medium carbonation. Taste is grapefruity soda water, lightly floral, soft bitterness. Easy going stuff. Pity the flavour doesnt match the aroma.

yellow misty off-white head. malty, hoppy, some fruits. taste: matls, very hoppy, bit pine. average carbo. small initial bitterness, followed by a malty bitter sweet body, strech in the finish. decent IPA, missing the fruitines though.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Mastikim. Thanks DSG. Pours yellow with a medium head, aroma of beet, cabbage, pine, flavor is slightly bitter with beet, cabbage and pine, medium bodied.
Bottle thx heather and frank A: citrusy, grapefruit app: hazy pale small white head t/p: thin body with moderate long bitter finish. Soft carbonation. O: good. Enjoy the hops and low abv.
Bottle gift for christmas. Lots of fresh hop in the aroma. Flavor is generally sweet, some citrus. Its a spritzy beer--a little too much. But impressive flavor for a lighter beer.

Draft. Pours a thin, poorly retained, minimal, white head, over a hazy, yellow (SRM 3) body....nose is slightly vegetal, with pine, resin, slight sulfur, balance to the hops.....taste is light cereal, slight sulfur, garlic hints, balance to the hops......mouth feel, medium body. The service of this beer may have been flawed. The vegetal, sulfur and garlic notes were quite unpleasant. Were the lines clean? Stone does not make this off a beer. BJCP 6/2/10/3/6

355ml bottle at home. Pours clear pale gold, white head, nice lacing. Big resinous hop aromas, skunky, some floral notes. Taste is big bitterness, skunky hops. No real malt until right at the end. Thin body, bitter finish. Good.

355ml Bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£2.60):
Ive no complaints about this beer at all, its definitely one of the better session IPAs Ive tried and is quite possibly the best given that it pretty much tastes like a good, traditional American IPA albeit with a lower alcohol content. It has plenty of bitterness and hops, a solid malt base and an excellent balance; whats not to like?
Keg at Brewdog Brum ages ago. This one definitely left a strong impression on me. Dat were on account of it so freshness. Well fresh. Freee-eeesh. Super crisp and juicy.
Bottle. Given that this is sold as a session IPA it is not too bad. Decent taste at a lower ABV.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow with thin white head. Big grapefruit flavor with a little bit of citrus, and a dry hop finish. Pretty enjoyable.

Keg at Brewdog Camden. Light golden orange coloured pour with a thin white head. Aroma is nice dank citrus, floral notes. Light chive, spring onion on the nose as well. Flavour is composed of crisp base grain, highish carbonation, earthy slightly dank citrus on the flavour as well. Palate is semi crisp with a dry finish. Uber drinkable. Very tasty for the abv. Suburb beer.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Steady carbonation. Nice lacing. Lovely aroma of mango, botanical hints, peanuts and pineapple jelly. Flavour of pine, mint and grapefruit. Thin body with an oily texture. Fizzy. A 4.5% ABV hop bomb. Reminds me of BrewDogs Dead Pony Club.

Lets see how the arrogant ones deliver a sesh IPA. Its got a nifty pour, a clear yellow body with a creamy head. The aroma is zest, pip, and grapefruit... mayhaps with a touch of the litter box. The malt appears in the flavor as watery grain. The hops come across as in the nose, a bit more catty, and the bitterness level is moderate, although it does linger for quite a while. Dry finish. Its okay.

[6536-20140718] Bottle. Super orange mango pine aroma. Hazy, light brown orange body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Bitter light buttery pine resin and hoppy orange pith flavour. Medium body is quite bitter. Delicious and sessionable. (9/4/9/4/17) 4.3

Bottle: Poured a bright yellowish color ale with a medium size white head with good retention and light lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and citrus notes is really enticing with nice floral undertones. Taste is also dominated by nice citrus and grapefruit notes with some floral undertones and limited bitterness. There is some small dose of residual sugar notes that are noticeable with some non-descript malt notes. Body is light with good carbonation. Nice to see that you can get this nice hops profile without having too much alcohol.

Poured from bottle into pint glass. Light piss color with low to moderate head. Just a beautiful aroma on this. Really psyched me up for the beer. Flavor was a bit of a letdown however. The hops are there, but since this is a much lighter beer, they don't really have anything else to interact with. A bit one note and thin, but certainly a decent beer and one of the better session IPAs I've had. I just wish it could have lived up to aroma.
Tap. Yellow with thin head. Smells fresh and box woody and a tad rubbery. Nice dry bitterness.
Cloudy yellow,stark white head.Huge cat pissy nose and palate with a big dry hop bitterness in finish.
Hazy yellow pour with a small white head. Hops, citrus, pineapple aroma. Bitter, malt, citrus taste. Good beer

Bottle from bodega near Brian's in Brooklyn. Translucent orange-golden pour. Stone-style hoppy aroma - slightly floral, mostly resin and pine. Taste is the same - like a dialed back Stone IPA. Pine and resin hops, bright, a bit empty though. Some lingering hoppy bitterness. Not bad for a session IPA but a bit light.

Bottle - Pours golden with a filmy off-white head. Nose is stinky dank onion hope, mango, and a minimal pale malt base. Taste is pine, mango, and a little onion hops. Pale, dry malt with a dry yeastiness. Thin and well-carbonated.

Tap at BD SB. Golden with white head. Aroma is a little floral with resinous pine and citrus. Similar taste
 Drinks easy, solid sipa
On tap at brewdog Cardiff nicevhave aroma with no head hoppy fruity in the aroma with a nice hope kick in the taste a bitter after taste leaves you wanting more

Pours a cloudy pale straw with a white head that gets flimsy. Pungent aromas: light caramel malt, huge resin and citrus hops, slight basement aromas, maybe even a little butterscotch, and some clove. Taste obviously leans towards bitter. Literally the first time I ever noticed umami. Palate starts clean and then gets bitter sticky. Its different. I like it.
Tap @ Sporting News: foggy gold look with white head. Apricot and citrusy aroma. Hoppy flavor with dry notes of juniper and grapefruit rind. Dry aftertaste. Tasty!

From a bottle. Pours a light, cloudy gold and makes a thick white head. Smells lightly of pine, hops, and yeast. As a session ipa, it's going to be a bit lightweight. I'm not a big fan, but it's ok. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 12oz. bottle from Ales Unlimited. Yellow color, lightly hazy. Grapefruit and yeast nose. Taste has lots of bitter grapefruit, citrus and pine. Almost chocolaty in richness. Roasted malt base gives way to a rich flavored, resiny grapefruit finish. Light bodied. Classic example of the style w/o the alcohol. Amazing flavor for the low ABV. Drinkable.
12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Not much of an aroma or head to it. Pours a light golden. Goes down smooth, but not much of a distinct flavor. Easy, sessionable IPA.

Topped with a thick, fluffy head this insanely hopped IPA (you'd expect nothing less from Stone) gives your mouth a bitter workout comprising of piney, woody, citrus green mega flowers. 

Rated by BrewTom

35.5cl draught at Nickeldime Drafthouse in Singapore. Hazy pale gold colour with a medium sized head. Aroma of citrus, pine, straw and hops. Soft carbonation. Bitterness on the palate, with hops and grapefruit. Dry and bitter aftertaste. Lower ABV than the regular Stone IPA noticeable.

12 oz bottle. Hazy pale gold, thin white head, spotty lace.
Aroma is citrus and pine and dank hops.  Flavor is pine and resin with some grapefruit on the finish.
Tap. Pour is murky gold, aroma is fruity, sweet, pine, citrus. Taste is strong bitter, light fruitiness and a long bitter finish, body is thin, carbonation is soft. Very good sessionable beer

Hazy straw color with a below average head.  Aggressive grapefruit hop notes, as one would expect from Stone. Cleasing mouthfeel with a consistent citrus hop flavor.  Beer brewed to be drunk fresh is a pleasure.  There is a livliness to it beyond the bracing hop taste to round out the experience.
Jaune pale avec un petit col blanc. Larôme et le goût sont dhoublon et pin. Il y a plein damertume pour un IPA session et cest bien équilibré, mais pas vraiment complexe.

Comes out of tap golden yellow with a nice creamy ivory head. Aroma is strongly hoppy and evergreen, like fresh-cut pine wood. Flavor is SERIOUSLY hoppy, like drinking a liquid pine tree, very evergreen but not too bitter, with fruity hints. Texture is fairly firm and fizzy, leaving a strong and lasting evergreen finish. A serious IPA for serious IPA fans!

Keg at BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a bright light golden color with a large soapy white head. Aroma is big bold hop profile with juicy fruity notes of mango, apricots, wet grass and dank. Taste is rich and medium sweet. Big hoppy fruity flavours with more mango, apricots, pine and dank. Medium body with good carbonation. Extremely refreshing and easy drinking. Very well balanced although finishes is a tad sweeter than Id want it to be. All in all, outstanding
Keg at Brewdog Camden, London. A golden/amber coloured pour with a thin white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, pine aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, grapefruit, citrus, pine. Decent.

Clear yellow pour from a bottle. Thick two finger head. Odd funky aroma, hop, citrus, floral. It may be over hopped. Flavor is big in bitterness. Sticky palate. Citrus, yeast and wheat notes. Not my favorite style but I like the idea. Lower ABV IS noticeable!

Tap. Brewdog, Leeds. Hazy orange. Thin, sticky, white head. Chewy toffee. Ripe orange. Light, resinous pine. Taste is piny bitter. Some dryness. Crisp palate. Finishes juicy bitter. Really good session beer. Loads of hops. Very tasty at this ABV.
Draught at brewdog camden. Clear amber with white head. Hoppy, a little pine, a little fruit in the nose. Good bitterness, a little dry and very hoppy. Medium body, slightly hoppy finish. Good!!!
Bottle @ SBWF 2014. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy aroma. Fruity malty piney hoppy grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy finish.
Poured from the tap. Hazy golden with white head. Lots of citrusy hops with a little pine and some biscuit malt. Nice balance between sweet citrus and slightly resinous finish. Medium body.

citrus, citrus, spruce, amber, orange, hazy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish
Big citrus rush at the pour with some spruce. Aromas dont last so be quick with sniff. Amber to orange and is slightly hazy with subtle white foam. Bitterness is slight - overall, like a carbonated grapefruit drink. Mouth feel is oily and aftertaste is dry with subtle bitterness. An interesting concept for a session beer, quite enjoyable. Not sure about calling it an "IPA" though.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with a medium sized white head. Sweet sticky citrus hops on the nose, soft malt. Medium bodied, nice big hoppy bitterness shows up right away. Long and sticky grapefruit and quinine on the finish. Completely sessionable, very tasty.
Pours a cloudy maize color with a creamy white head. Aroma of lemon, pine, and tropical fruit. Tropical fruit flavor with pine, mango and lemon. Nice beer.
Flaska från Ralphs, LA. Väldigt ljus med vitt skum. Doft av citrus, inte så blommig. Smaken är relativt besk med viss blommighet.

On draft. One of the more watery, one-dimensional session IPAs Ive had. Ends up with no discernable hop profile or flavor, just bitterness. Kind of like bitter water. So many wonderful takes on the style... but this isnt one of them.

Now available in Alberta, Canada. A huge sweet citrus burst that I love. Very heavy notes of tropical fruits. However - I must say I have had an almost identical version of this beer that is a little more refined and tastes better. Its called Little Something Extra by Lagunitas.

Pours a light straw color with a foamy head. Vibrant aromas of floral, citrus, light pine, and apricot. Flavors potent of apricot, light pine, citrus, grass, spruce. Big bouquet of flavors! Lightly sweet, high bitterness/dryness. Crisp, sharp hop flavors. Well done! I like the lower abv. Taste like it should be a strong ipa.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours pale amber, nose is sweet, fruity, pine, taste is dry, fruity, bitter.

Keg at brewdog Newcastle
Hazy pale amber, lacing white head. Punchy tropical um bongo hops nose, mango, melon, papaya. Fairly light in body with lively carbonation, the fruit quickly disappears to be replaced by tannic bitterness and flinty dryness. Id struggle to session this one and prefer regular ipa, the body here just doesnt support the bitterness.

Pours slightly hazy pale gold with a short white head diminishing rapidly to a thin skim, minimal lacing. (4/5) Nose is brightly hoppy, citrus and piney, tropical fruit, light malt. (9/10) Taste is mild sweet, moderate lingering bitter. (7/10) Light body tending to watery, moderate to low sustained carbonation, dry, mildly bitter finish. (4/5)


A pretty well done ISA. The nose is stupendous - lots of bright, beautiful hops and just a hint of a supporting malt backbone. But the taste, while fine, falls a little short of the braggadocio of the nose, coming across a little thin, with a sudden finish. Its probably fair to say Stone didnt have a lot of choice but to jump on the session IPA bandwagon. And, its also fair to say that they did a pretty fine job of it. But, it might also be fair to say theyve got better beers, and Id probably rather take the ABV hit on a single bomber of one of their hop bombs, instead of drinking three or four of these. Usually. Unless youre looking for a really well-done thirst quencher at a really good price - in which case, hells yeah this does the job! (16/20)
Sample at Syracuse Beer Fest. Cloudy golden with a fluffy white head. Citrus, tropical fruits, dank and resin, juicy and delicious. Much more dank, cat pee, not anything like the nose. Not for me.

12oz brown bottle. Yellow coloured, lightly hazy. Good looking white cap. Grapefruity nose. Taste has lots of bitter grapefruit and pine. Resiny and grapefruity finish. Good bitterness. Light bodied. Good example of the style, so drinkable.

Brilliant session IPA. Sparkling orange with a thick foamy head. The nose smells well hopped with light resin and pine notes along with a heap of grapefruit. similar flavour profile with a mild caramel malt. Bitter finish and moderate astringency

Bottle from Beverage Warehouse of Vermont (Winooski).
Aroma: citrus, peaches, pines. Just awesome. App: yellow-orange, hazy, minimal white head. Taste and Palate: light sweetness, medium bitterness. light-medium body, soft carbonation. Overall: Love the aroma and the taste. Only downside is maybe it?s a little flat and bitter finish is a little abrupt for an IPA... but still it?s a great IPA.

En fût. Verre de dégustation chez Jimmy the Greeks (Old Orchard Beach, ME) offert gratuitement par le propriétaire. Arôme: Légère odeur de pamplemousse et de pin. Apparence: La couleur est blonde pâle. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pamplemousse avec une pointe de pin et de fruité. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #5880)
12 oz. Bottle from craft 12 pack. Just a nice and smooth, all day, go to, session ipa. Quite delicious.
Bottle from radimd, many thanks. Golden color with medium white head. Strong citrus hoppy aroma with pines and resin. Solid malty base followed by nice resiny and piney hoppy kick. Good.

Aroma is fruity, floral, bready malts along with some resin and spruce with also a mild nutty character to it. Flavour is nutty, sweet malts, some floral and fruity notes along with some mild vegetably notes.
Gelblich hell im Glas, extrem fruchtig grassig in der Nase, Frisch im Antrunk mit schönen Fruchtaromen, angenehme bittere. Sehr schönes Session ipa

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks DSG. Hazy yellow-orange color. Aroma of stewed cabbage and stale fruity hops. Sweet, fruity, vegetal, light maltiness, quite weird. Light-medium bodied. Probably too old or infected, I hope it used to be a good beer.

Draught at BrewDog, Shepherds Bush on 2 Nov. Poured a hazy light golden colour, with a dense white head. Aroma of straw, pine and melon. Grassy flavour, with fresh hops and dry mineral. Quite a light, crisp palate. Finish was building resinous bitterness, mixed with mango sweetness and dry grain.

Bottle. Golden color with white head and some lacing. Grapefruit and pine aroma. Grapefruit flavors with resin finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at Mastikim, Raanana. Thanks DSG. Hazy golden-yellow with no head. Quite stale, hoppy, rotten fruits, mold. Moderate hoppy flavor, some cooked vegetables, stale, some maltiness, very dry. Flat, light-bodied. Probably its too old. I should try it fresh.
Average for the style. Probably not as good as other beers from Stone, but I only had a small taste so it was hard to tell. (Tried at a beer festival in SF.)

Bottle into IPA glass. Pours a pale gold colour. Aroma is of piney and citrusy hops. Taste is piney and citrusy hops. A little light in body but a great tasting beer for all day drinking.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

My favorite beer...terrific aroma leads to a phenomenal taste, with a preponderance of citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 For me this is my favorite beer. Big hoppy pineapple smell. Tastes good going down, refreshing then the back of your mouth it hits you and you need another sip. Nice to have such a great tasting beer thats session able. I like to have 5-6 without getting wasted out of my mind. Top notch. Its official, this is my favorite beer. 5+ 

Update/ Still a favorite but I likednthe 4.5% abv version slightly better so back down to a 4.9

Down again. The new version just isnt as good. Now its hard to find fresh too. Maybe Ill try again in the summer. 

Down again grrrr.....miss the old recipe

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2015 Re-rate 2/20/15: Draught at Stone Brewing World in Escondido. Clear golden. Aroma of green leafy hops with some fruitiness. Flavor of green hops, a bit fruity, with moderate bitteress. Thin mouthfeel. A bit too thin, but nice and refreshing. So much better than last time. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Bottle shared at a tasting at Mastikim. Hazy yellow. Weird "green" hoppy aroma with vegetables and some overripe fruits. Dry flavor with "green" hops, slightly fruity, with a vegetal touch and mild bitterness. Quite light-bodied. The vegetal character is strange. This beers probably not supposed to be like that. 5/3/6/3/11=2.8

Wow! Incredibly juicy brew! As soon as you pop this bottle open, you get a huge whiff of incredibly dank, fresh, exploding pine aroma and the flavor matches. Not bitter. Just rich, fresh, slick, and low alcohol so no boozy flavors to ruin the dankness. Great brew.

Appearance: Yellow golden, hazy. Slight off-white head.
Aroma: Mostly hops and citrus.
Taste: Fruits, citrus, quite a bit of hops. Not great.
Bought: Total Wine & More (Sterling), 355 ml, $2.29
Info: 27/10-2014

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 Sample, draught, 4 ounces, during the Bacon and Beer Fest in New York with Luc Bourbonnière, savoured on July 26 2014; eye: straw, nice khaki head; nose: tropical fruits, dryness, pine, fresh; mouth: tropical fruits, dryness, pine, fresh, dry finale with presence of pine, full body, good carbonation, quite bitter, harsh texture; overall: really good
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, en fût, 4 onces, durant le Bacon and Beer Fest à New York avec Luc Bourbonnière, savourée le 26 juillet 2014; il : paille, belle mousse kaki; nez : fruits tropicaux, sècheresse, pin, frais; bouche : fruits tropicaux, sécheresse, pin, frais, finale sèche en fruits tropicaux avec présence de pin, corsée, bonne carbonatation, pas mal amère, texture râpeuse; en résumé : très bon

Pours a clear golden orange with a nice white head that leaves lacing. Nice bit beautiful fruity aroma with grapefruit, citrus hops, pine & resin. Flavor then all of a sudden just falls flat...you can smell something so delicious and the body is like water tasting like the above but just amped down to water. I don;t believe this beer is 65 IBUs with this thin of a body it would stand out and be overly astringent. Again great aroma to this stone beer but just no body.

Bottle from Antenna America, Yokohama at home. Pours a clearish golden with a small white head. Bitter with hoppy aromas of citrus fruits with notes of pine. Also faint notes of pale ale malts. Medium to light bodied. Medium to high carbonation. Bitter finish.

355ml bottle pours a pale golden orange color with a finger and a half of white head that settles down to reveal some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is pine and citrus. Taste is a pine and citrus hop bitterness with a grainy malt sweetness. Light bodied with decent carbonation leaving a tickle on the palate. A great IPA that can be had all evening long and enjoyed.

Bottle from Bo Brooks Lighthouse Liquors, Baltimore. Golden, with a slick, white, head. Grapefruit, grassy hops and a sweet malt aroma. Flavour had plenty more fruit, and rich and sweet malts. Finish was dryish. Good.

Crisp thin dark yellow. Light head. Moderate hop scent with some malt sweetness. Strong hops with balanced malt. Citrus and pineapple. Mouth drying. A bit of Mellon. Would not miss a beat drinkin a few of these and saving some ABV and probably some calories.
Gold/orange pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is light malt and resiny hops. Flavor is hops and medium malt. Medium bodied and fizzy. A drinker especially at the abv. I like

12 oz bottle. BB 11/15/14. (World Market) Chattanooga, TN.
Slightly cloudy golden colour with a small white head. 
Super fruity aroma with tropical fruits, pineapple, peach and mild grapefruit. Some fruity sweetness and mild maltiness in the aroma. Great! 
The flavour is fruity, piney and resiny hoppy, mild bitterness and only a tad of maltiness. Very thin.

Draft to taster
Tons of spruce and a little citrus. Light yellow, ringed white head. This is wheat, citrus, barnyard yeast.

On tap. Pours a light clear gold with light head. Aromas of pineapple/tropical fruit, resin-y Pacific Northwest hops, and light toasted malts. Flavors carry the same but disappear quickly leaving a light watery middle. Lingering bitter finish. Good attempt for an ISA though expecting more.
On tap at craft. Slightly cloudy pale yellow. Bright citrus aroma, candied sugar, pine. Taste is bittersweet. Subtle, lasting dry finish.

Uff-da...all bitterness and no balance :( Bottle pour with thin white head and decent lacing, hazy yellow color. Pleasant hop aroma, but taste is pure bitterness with bitter finish. I enjoy a well-hopped ale, but this does nothing for me. Actually it's worse than that, it's so poorly balanced it's almost offensive. I've tasted (and enjoyed) higher-IBU beers, but the complete lack of malt back is a travesty.

---Rated whilst imbibing

Looks.. Vibrant mustard yellow, sml head.
Smells.. Pine, citrus, full hop scents, light caramel malts.
Tastes..grapefruit citrus, piney, resinous, caramel and healthy bitter finish. 
Probably the best low abv ipa Ive had, extra points.
The first impression is of pine and citrus hops, just like a real IPA, but soon this brew turns thin, watery and show off an appearance of artifical hopping. Not great.
Golden pour, small white head. Great aroma of citrus, caramel malts, notes of wild honey. Citrus, grass and floral hops, caramel malt flavor.

Drucken på ölmässan, Stockholm. Mycket trevlig i doft, kropp och smak men det är något speciellt i fruktigheten som gör att den inte går hela vägen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: resin, pine, some flowers. Appearance: clear gold. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, floral, grass, quite dry finish, lively carbonation. Overall: nice Session IPA, palate could be more consoled. Pint at Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens - Liberty Station, San Diego.

Golden with white head. Hop aroma of pine and citrus. Nice mouth-feel, light and watery in a good way. Just a bit of malt flavor, mostly grapefruit-mango-pine hops. More bitter than you may expect from a session beer but not so much to overpower the light malt feel. Really good session IPA.

Bottle from a build your own at Total Wine. Pours a hazy gold with a thin custard head. Taste and aroma of piney hops,grass, malt and citrus. Pretty big piney bitterness for a session IPA. Nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle from Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York. Hazy golden-orange in colour, thin white head, good lacing. The aroma is quite hoppy with lots of pine, oranges, grapefruit, light sweetness. The flavour is moderately hoppy, good amount of pine and citrus, some malt. Light body. Finishes long, good hop bitterness. Nicely done.

Transfer from BA review on 3-13-14-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a light golden color with a one finger head of a pure white foam. The head fades rather rapidly leaving a light level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma of the beer is quite potent in hop for a brew of only 4.5 % abv. The biggest hop smell is that of a grapefruit nature, but other hop aromas of a pine and a grassy smell are there as well. Along with the hop are some other aromas of a fruity nature with some tangerine, mango, and peach. A little bit of a doughy smell is there as well, creating a quite robust and nice smell for a modest abv. brew.

 Taste  The taste begins with a dry cracker base with some hints of a tropical fruit taste bringing just a hint of sweetness to the brew. Right from the start there is a nice hop flavor of a grapefruit and pine nature. As the taste advances the hop increases with the pine growing slightly stronger and with some flavors of an earthy nature coming to the tongue. While this occurs, the fruity flavors dwindle creating a rather dry taste overall. The grapefruit hop really starts to come on at the end of the taste, with it bringing lots of bitter flavor. In the end with all the hop, a lighter bready base, and very little sweetness one is left with a nice hop flavor, but one that is a little unbalanced and too bitter to be supported by the lighter body of the beer.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thinner side with a carbonation level that is on the higher side. While the lighter body and higher carbonation are great for the session style of the brew, they accentuate the hop too much in light of the very dry and low malt base, in some ways making it too bitter and unbalanced for a nice session IPA.

 Overall  Now this does give you a nice dose of hop flavor in a low abv. beer. For me however there was not enough base to balance the beer, making it a bit to hopped to be just overly hoppy in flavor without a real balance. It is nice if you want a session with lots of hop, but otherwise if looking for a truly enjoyable and smooth drinking session well.

12 oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy gold color with a 1-2" white head that settles to a film leaving some lacing. Aroma is heavy on the citrus hops - grapefruit mostly. Medium body, good balance of light malt and hops. The citrus stats on the finish, slightly bitter. Good one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Fresh pine and strawberry hops aroma in front of light base malt. Almost clear copper under a lasting white flannel blanket. Flavour is like drinking hop tea made in caramel mineral water. Assertive bitterness in need of body and sweetness, but the spicy pine and grapefruit pith flavour is nice. Light body, medium carbonation, crisp.
Grapefruit smell, quite hoppy, almost garlic smell with time...taste also becomes garlicy...(but Ive had a few)
Bottle at SBWF2014. Clear golden color, small white head. Gooseberry, sweetish fruity aroma. Light-bodied. Gooseberry, grass, citrus in the flavor. Watery session beer.

Pours straw yellow and results in a small head of foam. Great smells of pine and citrus with undertones of hops. Great session taste of citrus, hopes and a bit of resin. Good staying power on the finish.
Sample at SBWF 2014. Hoppy smell with citrus and fruits. Similar taste. Fresh and hoppy. Nice strong bitterness. Refreshing.

Pours a murky pale yellow color with a white head. Tons of hops leap from the glass and tantalize the olfactory. Ligh and crisp. Hops by the gallons, but NO malt backbone. To be expected with a session, I suppose. I just dont get this style at all. Hop water.

With Z, pours a straw colored yellow light gold color with a small head. Nose is hoppy with strong citrus. Taste is citrusy and hoppy as well, and very drinkable. Finishes on the light hoppy bitter citrus notes. Quaff Score 7 / 10

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with an off white head and sweet hoppy, citrusy aroma. Taste is light. bittersweet with hops, citrus, grapefruit, and caramel leading to a dry, bitter finish. Very drinkable and light IPA

Bottle. Citrusy hop aroma with notes of pine resin. Pours pale golden colored with a medium off-white head and some lacing. Very light bodied ipa that starts with citrus-hop flavors. Finishes dry with the pine resin flavors coming through strongly at the end. Another solid ipa from stone.

Pitcher at Zeitgeist. Pours a clear yellow with a firm white head. Nose is citrus, tropical fruits and orange. Very fruit driven nose. Taste is like a fruit juice - all those flavours coming together with a mild bitterness. Easy to slam down. Great beer for a session in a beer garden!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 355ml.
Pours hazy blond with low-medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits. Taste is of resin, citrus, tropical fruits, bitterness, slight herbs/dirt. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Good, hoppy. Just a tad dirty.

Big mango and pineapple aroma. Medium mouth. Big time hop bomb. Lots of typical Stone bitterness. Long dry finish with hints of fruit rind. Resin, grass and real easy drinking. One of the better session IPAs if you want to blow your palate out.

Bottle. Hazy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma of classic Stone hop, really dank, light onion, piney notes, grapefruit. Taste is bitter, nice honey maltiness, floral hop flavor. Palate is light but not watery, good body for a session pale. Good stuff.

Bottle: Pale golden in color, topped with a finger of creamy white head. Heavy sheet lacing. Pungent with citrus and floral hops, some tropical fruit. Hops rich taste is mild, for Stone, but flavorful. Citrus and pine, lightly floral. Sort of dusty and dry in the tail. Ok.
Bottle from Warehouse Package. Pours hazy gold with frothy white head. Aroma pine and citrus. Taste of bitter hops and a tiny bit of citrus. Light bodied and very refreshing. Good IPA
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow-gold with a thin off white head. Taste and aroma of piney resinous hops,grass, malt and citrus. Pretty big piney bitterness for a session IPA. Nice.
On draft at Isaac Newtons. Body was a bit thin for my taste, but the brew had some nice grassy and pine flavors. It was easy to drink. Not bad.

Single bottle from Julios. Pours out a "grassy" light golden color with a frothy white head. Nice citrus aromas and flavor. Very nice flavor and drinkablilty - yes a - "full flavor" IPA indeed. I would rate this higher if it was priced better. I think the idea of "session" brews is that they also need to be affordable. At $12 a six-pack, this is not the case. Stone needs to take a page out of Lagunitas book and start selling their beers at a better price.

2014/09/28 - Pours a slightly hazy yellow straw colour with a soapy white head that diminishes quickly. Aroma is citrus, floral hops, mild pine, sweet peaches and pineapple. Taste is grapefruit and citrus rind, saltiness, mild pine and mildly spicy hop notes. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with slightly biting carbonation and a long finish that is drying and moderately drying. Easy drinking with a great aroma. I just wish that the taste matched the nose a little more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

SBWF 2014. Pours pale yellow with a low white head. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, peach, grass. Taste is citrus, peach, grass, grapefruit, lime. Mouthfeel is sprightly with medium carbonation. Very good session IPA!
Pours clear orange gold with a small off white head, with minor lacing. Aroma of citrus cats and sweet malt. Flavour is harshly bitter with a little sweetness to balance. Finish is bitter as well.

Pours clear yellow low white head
Aromas fresh of citrus, grapefruits, apricots, pine
Taste has nice fresh hoppy citrusy fruits, hay. Nice fresh and highly enjoyable
Pours straw gold with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, floral and herb. Taste is moderate bitters. Light bodied with a crisp clean finish. Great session ipa, hits all the right notes.

Where and how:  bottle 355 ml 
Aroma wow, hop infusion, soapy, grassy, pinemango, high alpha juice feel. Raw backing with tree sap and grape skins.
 Appearance : 
Top: lighter white top, sparse lace.
Base: bright golden look.
Palate : soft bodied, mild carbonation, bit too flat.
Taste: Floral with plenty of pineapple elements. Low lazy carbonation cant carry all those hops. Felt muted even if with proper profile.

Bottle from DeLaurenti, SeattleHazy pale blond color. It has an impressive hop aroma: piney, hempy, musky and citrusy. Dry and lean mouthfeel, the malt flavor is light but present, strong bitterness with a resiny and citrusy character.Definitively a go-to sIPA.
Very refreshing and drinkable. Lacking the bite of a great IPA, but those are not as drinkable.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a medium white head. Aroma has mild notes of peach and mango. Flavor has more grapefruit, spice and citrus rind. Mouthfeel is light / medium and silky with a dry rindy/grassy bitter finish. Tasty but I wish the flavor followed the aroma more.
Sampled at Great Canadian Beer Festival. Pine and tangerine, some florals, lightly toasted malt. O.k. balance, medium-bodied, mildly bitter. Tasty if undistinguished IPA.

Ótima ipa para começar. Frutada e com gosto sem todo o amargor do lúpulo. Fresca e suave.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a mildly-hazed straw into the glass, with a wispy head that leaves webbed lacing. The nose is of huge pine notes. Flavors contain lemony citrus, grapefruit, bold bitter hops and a great lingering peppering pine finish. All of the attributes of a much larger IPA in a session brew. The body is indeed a bit lighter than traditional American IPAs, but allows a super complex palate that goes down super well in the heat. A complex thirst quenching IPA with lots of flavor??? Say it isnt so! Well... it is! Super!
12 oz bottle bought on a recent trip to Rochester. Pours a golden colour with thin white head. Aroma is hops, citrus. Taste is grapefruit, some hops. Very good!
Bottle. Not bad for an IPA. Amber in color. Aroma has the traditional citrus, spruce aroma. Taste is grapefruit and a touch of cedar.
Floral and pine notes with some sweet on the nose. Nice balance of bitterness and malts. Nice finish. Very solid session. Not as good as All Day but definitely a good beer.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Hazy medium golden amber with a 1" frothy white head, bubbly bands of lace. Aroma of pine and malt. Taste is malt that cant hold on against moderate pine hops. The bittering pushes right on through a lingering finish. Lots of taste for 4.5%, especially good with food.

From 12 oz bottle in tulip glass. Pours a clear yellow with a thin head. Nose is full of floral hops with lots of tropical fruits. Some celery and freshly mown grass notes too. Same flavours in the mouth. Very floral. It has a weird, but pleasant, veggie character. There is a good amount of pine bitterness. The body is rather light with its 4.5% ABV. Probably one of the hoppiest beers I had below 5% ABV. Good beer!

Bottle while in Seattle. Pours a hazy pale orange with a white head. Big pissy, piney, tangerine, lemon, light trop fruit aroma.Light body, medium carbonation. Its a little watery. Lots of pine, woody resin, grass, lemon, tangerine, grapefruit. Dry, bitter, refreshing. Pretty tasty.

12 oz. Clear orange-amber with a quarter inch of meringue on top. Huge nose of green herb, mango, grapefruit zest, toasted grain, resin and a touch of honey. Tastes of the same great mix with a bit of pineapple, white pepper and melon. Light-medium body has a definite dry bias, but enough fruity hop and malt to keep me chuggin. Medium-high carbonation is the only drawback to this otherwise perfectly sessionable and tasty brew.

Pours a clear light golden with a head that fades fast and settles into a small white rim that leaves some lacing. Nose is of onion and garlic, not the best Stone IPA aroma-moment ever but still true to whats advertised. Fruits and slight pine also. Taste is better with some fruits and pine, light caramel. It is not an ounce sweet and even pushes toward bitter in balance. Body is light, carbonation moderately high and mouthfeel a little weak to me but hey, its a session IPA. Overall an OK session, tasty and all, but I didnt feel like the flavors were up to standard...

Bottle at home. Rating #1600. This was a nice beer. Pours a golden amber with two fingers of white head. Aroma is citrus mainly grapefruit and some pine. Flavor follows with a mild bitterness. Very flavorful for the lower abv. Really nice beer bi could drink lots of this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I didnt take notice of the sell-by date when I drank it--that may have been an issue, because it had been in my refrigerator for a while--but still, this was decent. I was glad to see their testimony about how it is good to have a session IPA. As a beer, IPA usually doesnt get me excited. The aroma here is very good, and it promises, but the flavor doesnt deliver as much. The body was lighter, even watery at times. But still, good drinking. Bottle.
Bottle. Pours light orange with white head. Aroma is very piney and citrusy, very hop forward. Taste is bitter, extreme piney, easy, very hoppy with out being too heavy. Very good session IPA.

101st Stone beer. coincidence? i think not cause they just took every other session ipa to school. session ale 101. Every time I start to have even an inkling of a doubt that Stone is my favorite brewer, they release something else that makes me feel like an idiot for ever doubting. Most likely my new favorite session IPA, and easily the best one I can find fresh on the shelves here in Reno. Huge hop aroma and flavor and more than adequate bittering. The body is thinnish, but not nearly as watery as some, and better than some 6-7% IPAs. Fruit and pine galore, and even hints of sweetness to balance. Knocks of All Day & Alpha Session. Reminiscent of the SD Session Pale from a few years ago, but hoppier."

12 oz bottle. Light copper in color with a thin white head. Fantastic aroma of grapefruit. Great flavor for a session IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Lightly hazed blonde pour. Yellow pepper, dandelion glue, crushed herb aroma, flamboyant and pungent. The flavor seems elusively weird. New fangled weedy hops have overgrown the citrus, the needles, the fresh bright fruit. Garlic, crushed fennel seeds, celery seed and leaves, and bile-like green papaya. The starkness of these hops is too much for this style. The palate is lightly acidic, lacking the dry mineral content that frames the best examples. Finishes with a marjoram and nettle green bitterness. The weirdness of this satisfies curiosity; my experience of this tap version is decidedly more vegetable, weed and herb heavy than any prior version, and possibly an outlier.

Pours hazy orange with a thin beige head, good retention, very fine lacing. Aromas of pine resin, grass, biscuit, and grapefruit. Medium body, velvety smooth, dry. Mildly sweet, medium-strong bitter finish, with a nice lingering piney bitterness. An excellent session IPA.

Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow with a fluffy to frothy off white head. Aroma is huge citrus and pine hops, very fresh. Taste is strong fruit juicy hops, very subtle and not overly harsh, great summer refreshing beer.
love them hops nice floral aroma with a very strong lively abrupt bitter hop taste. A very good IPA

12oz bottle decanted into pint glass. Pours a very pale see-through golden color with a medium lasting sticky white head. Nose of earthy pine, apricot, and pineapple. Flavors of resin, grass, pine, bitter hops and cascade hops. Very thin on the mouth. Big flavor from a low abv.

On tap at Ellyns Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL., and dispensed to a shaker showing a hazed, gold color, with a presentable layer of frothy, white head foam, and a wavy display of lacing. The aroma was an expressive nose of pine, white grapefruit, and pineapple. The tastes intro was a subtle malty smoothness, before being struck by a very strong citrus, resin, & rind hop bitterness that possessed some dryness, and lingered well past the finish, overwhelming even my buffalo wings in intensity. Light to medium bodied, lively carbonation successfully projected these flavor notes. Hop bomb with low buzz, maybe just a bit abrasive, but love the concept!

Bottle.

A- Citrus, juicy, peaches, pine, tangerines.

A- Yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Citrus, juicy, piney, bitter.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, citrusy bitter finish.

O- Wow, talk about an amazing aroma. Big juicy citrus smells. Sadly, my bottle was a month past the nest by date. Had it been fresh, the taste might have equaled the nose, but it just didnt quite match up. None the less, the first Stone beer Ive ever really really liked. Well done.

Stone Go To IPA breaks new ground in two critical ways. The first is the most obvious; Go To IPA is the Escondido brewerys premier Session IPA. The second may just be a first for me, but its a welcome change regardless - this session ale has more fruit flavor and balance than some of Stones heavily-hopped classics (which are also delicious, by the way). The aggressive blast of bitter grapefruit and pine needles is swapped for a juicy aroma and flavor. The aroma is ridiculously good with notes of lemon, grapefruit, apricot, orange, and peach. While not as juicy as that phenomenal aroma, the taste shows off the sweeter side of grapefruit and malt. An excellent, spicy pine flavor does its job without adding too much bitterness. Mouthfeel is as diverse as it is satisying - moderate carbonation, sticky hop oils, and wet hop sensations. With 4.5% ABV, Go To IPA provides a hell of a lot of flavor without getting you too buzzed.

Bottle. Pours a pale golden, medium white head with okay retention and lacing. Nose is grapefruit, grassy meadow, light malts. Mouth is relatively light bodied, dry with medium bitterness, lots of grapefruit --- like it straight up tastes almost like watered down fresh grapefruit justice without the acidity and the sweetness, some lemongrass underlying, dry white toast. If this is the future trend in IPAs, Im down... even if I am still a fan of big-ass Imperial IPAs like Arctic Panzer Wolf and pretty much any of em that Pipeworks do. I could seriously drink several gallons of this stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 Wow! The grassy, heavily apricot aroma was amazing out of the bottle and I couldnt really help but to have my first taste right out of the neck. How amazingly redolent and I could imagine it will be a very memorable experience. Ill be thinking about this one again and again. There is something about a fresh hop nose slapping you in the face that will have you thinking about it the next day. This is one of those.
The bitter pine in the afterward is lasting, but not unpleasant, and the light, dry, body is only an invitation to another long swallow. Did I mention the very clear, light gold liquid and the sticky, thin, white head? Not the most important parts of this review, obviously.

Re-rated a few days later.  Not happy that I need to come back to this to make a different decision.  The second time around was less enjoyable, by far.  I found the apricot cloying, the pine missing altogether and although the aroma was still quite enjoyable, the long pulls were much more like a bitter and grainy aftertaste.  This time, I had not had any other brew previously, and so I could imagine this was my issue the first time.

I have to applaud Stone for accomplishing something special here. Their ability to generate a big IPA with a sub-5 ABV is amazing. The grapefruit is through and though here, while it doesnt come across as thin at alll. Very drinkable, great aroma. As a straight IPA itd probably score a bit lower but Im pumping up the rating just die to the accomplishment.
355 mL bottle. Aroma is big - all piney hops. Flavour is all piney hops as well, but its thin. I guess you can complain when its a session IPA. Pine isnt my favourite hop flavour, though.

Wonderful aroma of hops, pine resin, fruit, great looking, cloudy gold color, with low carbonation and a short lasting white head. Taste of pine resin and pineapple with a dry feel an a dry chalky finish.

Single from total wine. Pretty big for a sessionable ipa but still delicious. Love the hop profile with lots of citrus and grapefruit and a touch of pine. Finish is lots of bitter and grapefruit rind citrus.
Bottle pours a golden brew with a white top. Nice juicy hop nose with pine and grapefruit. Taste is pine and citrus. Nice

12 oz single from Lifesource Natural Grocer in Salem OR
$1.89
Pours a lighter burnt orange colour with a large thick and frothy white head.
Achhhh the aroma ..not my style of SIPA..lot of green onion and garlic, little pine..better..but not impressed.
The taste is a little better..but a bit on the resiny herbal side., bit of grapefruit rind...little malt.
Mouth feel is fine..that part is at least sessionable.
Greatly disappointed..i had changed my profile to put Session IPA as my fav style given the great session IPAs coming out of smaller breweries in Oregon.
THis is just average compared to those.
No idea why it has such rave ratings. Perhaps I got a bad bottle.

One of the best Session IPAs out there. Ample white head. In your face grapefruit aroma. Color is yellow / amber. Taste explodes with hops and malt, carrying the grapefruit taste all the way to a clean finish. Another plus is the 4.5% alcohol content. Normally youb have to drink an IPA with twice the alcohol to get the same hop flavor. Meaning you could enjoy a few before its time to punch out! Well done Stone!

Sampled March 2014
A steady pour into my New Belgium globe glass produces a two finger thick, pale, off-white colored head. The beer is a light amber / copper hue that shows a brilliantly clear, metallically sheening, rich golden hue when held up to the light. The aroma is just expressively hoppy with a mix of ripe tropical fruit / expressive citrus, and a dank, herbaceous character. Specific notes of guava, lychee, kumquat zest, super-ripe tangelo, juicy-fruit bubble gum, and sweet fruity floral nectar notes are balances by a bit of spicy woodiness, lots of dank, earthy, peppery herbal notes, a touch of mentholated rosemary type character, and just a huge hop character that is such a joyous expressing of humulus lupus.

The beer is light bodied, actually quite light, though not unexpectedly so, with a prickly, effervescent, light carbonation. The hop character is clearly the dominant note in the flavor, and there is also a significant bitterness to this beer. Due to the dryness of this beer the hop fruitiness is much reduced from the aroma, though it still manages to contribute a ton of flavors; guava, lychee, peppery tangelo zest, expressive kumquat zest are all quite noticeable. The herbal and woody side of the hop character is more dominant in the flavor for the same reason with notes of resinous pine, peppery woody notes, some turpene leaning rosemary like character, a bit of menthol, and a nicely earthy, dank herbal character that lightly forms a baseline note in the flavor.

This is a really nice beer; it definitely hits the mark for what it is trying to be, and it is nice that despite the hugely expressive hop character, it does not get overly harsh or unbalanced considering how light the body, malt character, and alcohol are. This is definitely a hop-lovers Pale Ale.

On tap at Salty Cowboy. A sour citrus aroma. A lot of tart hops bitterness that stays up front. The bitter lingers a bit on the tongue. Good, but for my taste I prefer an IPA with the hops bitterness balanced by something else. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A notch below Founders entry into this category in my opinion. Founders is in cans and cheaper too. Still a great flowery aroma SIPA.
pours a slightly cloudy golden color. big foamy head on this one. big burst of hops in the aroma. flavor is citrus and resinous. light to medium body and very delicious. great session
Pours a light cold color with a thick white head. Very light flavor, definitely something you can drink all day long.
Very nice citrus IPA. Recent bottle from Champane Cellars. Smooth and drinkable. One of the better of the class.
Tap. Golden colour. A nice session ipa with citrus and pine hop aroma/flavour.

12oz bottle picked up at The Grapevine 
Pours cloudy orange with a medium size white head, good lacing. When I popped the cap off you could smell dank hops. In the glass it smells great, hops, tropical fruit and citrus. Flavors are fruity, citrus, pine resin and herbal 
This would be my Go to IPA if I could get it regularly, very good.

With sessionable IPAs all-the-rage, Stones Go To IPA stands out as one of the leaders. Whats so admirable about this beer is Stones restraint & balance in its hop profile - a exceptionally drinkable IPA that doesnt feel like youre sacrificing.

12 oz bottle from Steve
Pours a light hazy yellow
lovely hop aroma much stronger then you would expect from a lighter ipa
A little thin on the palette but a really nice bitterness to the finish
A very good session IPA
Pours light yellow gold with a small white head. Aroma is mango, tangerine, grapefruit. Taste is tropical fruits and citrus with a lengthy bitterness that peaks in the finish. Nice.

[Bottle] Pours a clear light orange color with a fizzy and quickly receding white head. Nose is solidly hoppy, with citrus and lighter grassy notes. The taste is very similar. High acid hops add a lot of bitterness to this, but the underlying malt profile is light. Lingering bitterness is long lasting. I found the acrid bitterness and light body threw off the balance somewhat.

Fad: Taster på brewpub. Let kattepis men jeg fornemmer det ikke så tydelig. Pilsnergul klar med et lille skumhoved. Mundfylden er lidt tynd på denne ellers meget lækre og friske lille ipa. Lækker lille session.

12oz bottle, drank from bottle on Beer Train 2014. The aroma a sweet, juicy citrus with bread and a light candy/sugar note. Theres an abundant soapy head within the bottle that leaves a decent lacing, and I can tell the liquid is fairly clear, but cant tell too much else through the bottle, Stones reputation gets them at least the medium rating in terms of appearance. Its a medium high bitter with a medium sweetness to it. The body is surprisingly big for a session IPA - Id say medium full - with a waxy slick texture and active carbonation. It finishes dry and clean with notes of pine, citrus peel and caramel syrup. The aftertaste is bitter and dry citrus, but its mellow.

Appearance: Pours a vibrant clear yellow gold with a white sudsy head that quickly falls to a film.

Aroma: Bright citrus zest, skunky sativa strain medical marijuana. Those not familiar with that odor, I would say tropical fruit and a dash of cumin.


Taste: Quick punch of bitter Stone hops, some spicy Euro hop bitterness, some citrus rind, crisp pale malt. Mineral water. Finishes earthy and bitter. Lingers well past the sip.

Mouthfeel: Thin, juicy, average carbonation.

Overall: Since Enjoy Bys inception, I dreamt of an Enjoy By Junior for those evenings that I wanted to take it easy, or had to get up especially early the next day. This product completely met my expectations in that regard. It was refreshing, tasty, extraordinarily drinkable, almost too drinkable for someone so addicted to hops. As with all these new Session IPAs, please be very mindful of the bottle date code. There really isnt much to this beer once the hops leave, and I hope I never live to find out what this beer is like old.

12 oz bottle. Pours a bright yellow, large rocky white head, leaves medium soapy lacing on the glass. Huge grapefruit and orange aroma. Taste doesnt quite measure up to the aroma, slightly thin mouthfeel indicative of the style. One of the best session IPAs out there.

Bottle. Date printed right on the curve and smudged past the point of being able to read. Fizzy and yellow, wish i still had that stone bastard glass with the fuzzy yellow beer is for sissies. Anyway this thing packs a pretty nice hop punch for only 4.5%. Strong grapefruit and lots of bitterness. Has a nice lasting bitter aftertaste. Its bud light appearance is the only thing keeping it under a 4 for me, still Possibly a bit underrated on here. Not quite sure about the 11.99 price tag when the slightly better sidekick was right next to it for $2 cheaper. But at 4.5%, This one might be a better choice in a bar when you want to have a quick pint or two and then drive.

Pours cloudy golden with low white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, overripe mango, slight funk.Taste is medium bitter, slightly fruity, light lingering bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Bobar: Liquid appeared a golden elixir with a delicate foam cap head that reduced to an O-ring shape. Mild aroma of hops that does smell danky for a session beer but then again this is a session IPA and only a few companies have been making these over the past few years. The taste is bitter with a bite of citrus fruit peel such as orange and tangerine with sprinkles of lemon zest. A decent beer but not a realistic price of almost $12 for a freakin 6 pack.

What a wonderful Session IPA- I love this one and it is in stock in our fridge. Nice golden color, a bit of pine and hops nose and taste, a little bit citrus, not too hoppy, well balanced with a great refreshing aftertaste.
Bottle. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Citrusy hop aromas. Weak second hand citrusy hop notes. Really a bit on the bland side. Lifeless with a very average body and mouthfeel.

Was $2 for the 12 oz. single bottle purchased from an obscure little bottle shop found just at the end of an alleyway on right across from The Salt Cellar (Commercial Alley Beers). The shop had really been addressed on Market, but this is a minor detail. To long-stemmed tulip, it pours a skin-tinted citron orange with which a white ringed head barely even a fingernail in length stood. Aromas of green cardamom, lawn trimmings, pistachios, lemongrass, and sweat. Tastes the same with the addition of muskmelon, lima beans, Midwest hops, and breast yeast, Bitterer by its moderately minty finish. Splendidly refreshing.

2014-07-18. Hazy bright orange body, nice foamy off white head and some lace. 3++ aroma is fairly hoppy, melange of hop greenery, mango, tropical fruit, other fruit. Flavour is similar, green hop verge ration, undertones of fruit, mango like character. 7+ Moderate bitterness throughout grows as you go. Average bodied palate is fairly carbonated. Decent. Bottle from Beer Boutique, Brooklyn

[Growler] Pours a lightly hazy bubbly gold with an average size long-lasting frothy white head. Aroma is hoppy, herbal and fruity, piney as well, along with some wheat and bready malt in the back. Flavour follows, reminds me more of an easy drinking Pale, but its quite enjoyable. Citrusy and tropical fruit hops and with a moderate bitter finish. Average bodied. A joy to drink.

Pretty good session IPA. Slightly hazy golden. Very citrusy (grapefruit) and some pine. Almost no bitterness. Medium carbonation and fairly light body. Definitely could do a good session with this one.

Pours a beautiful orange color with a very small white head. The aroma on this is a bit skunky with lots of citrus, and some minimal pine. Taste is hops, citrus, kind of your typical IPA. This one doesnt wow me. But Im sensing some off flavors here. I feel this may not be as fresh, which is a tremendous shame.
Pours a copper color with a white head. Weaker pine aromas at the nose with some citrus. Lightly bitter for an IPA.
Bottle from wholefoods. Unclear golden body with a medium white head. Pineapple, grapefruit, hops, tropical fruit, lime, peach. Nice and smooth.

Spice, citus aromas, slightly cloudy, minimal head. Medium carbonation but sharp. Low bitters dry afters

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
Aroma is really good like lots of citrus. But the palate is so gross... Lingering gross bitterness that takes forever to fade. Total garbage.
Poured a cloudy goldish color with aromas of grapefruit, pine, light tropical fruits, and some light grain. Flavors match the aroma, very sesionable, and drinkable.

Stone has done a very nice job here with a session IPA which favors hop/bitterness over balance (by design). Very nice american aroma of pine and citrus. Taste is bitter bit with even more prominence of hop flavors. Hop burst worked! Beer is definitely malt-light with a dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle... Hazy golden ale with a small, frothy, white head. Huge grapefruit and pine in the bouquet  even some tropical passionfruit. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation - more body than expected. The flavor delivers citrusy, rindy bitterness  bordering between medium and heavy. Finishes acrid, bitter and dry.

Strong hop aroma followed by a bitter, acute, and distinct hoppy palate. A light beer color with slight cloudiness. I'm pretty sure it's an actual cloud bottled from hop heaven. 

Bottle.

On tap at alley katz. Pours light copper with white head. Nice hop aroma with a crisp light mouth feel with a nice bitter finish

Draft. Aroma is a funky hop. Appearance is a hazy golden with frothy, white head. Taste is a dank hop flavor. Palate is hoppy. Overall, a good session IPA. Reminds me of lagunitas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Phenomenal session IPA. Smells like you just ground hops in your hands. Very fresh and clean, best beer for a hot afternoon.

Good for what it is? Not use to a light offering from stone. Its sessionable w/ some decent hop flavor but not quite my cup of tea. Very thin gold pour w/out much of a head or lacing. Aroma is of light hops. Flavor is the same. Ok!
12 oz bottle. Deep copper pour with a medium off white head. Fantastic aroma of grapefruit, citrus and some yeast/bread. Nice sharp finish. Lovely session.

Nice! Leave it to Stone! Hair better than the Lagunitas session IPA. Fresh and prominent grapefruit notes. Beautiful.

Pours light gold with a small white head. Herbaceous nose with nice grapefruit notes on the tongue. Light body, refreshing, and highly drinkable. Nice session IPA.

Clear gold with a white head.
Hop aroma of citrus and pine.
The flavor is totally hops. But this is like all of the session IPAs - thin washed out lacking the support and body that a bit more malt adds to a beer. Hop water. Give me an IPA or a Pale Ale please.
Pours a light amber color. Nice hoppy aroma. Taste is bitter with some sweetness.

EL LOCAL, San... On tap. Pours like a bud, light in color. Great foamy head. Aroma is floral and piney...best part of this beer. First sip bubbly, quick fading hops. Clean palate. No aftertaste. This is the best session, hot weather microbrew I've had.

This golden beer has a strongly piney aroma. It has a really strong hop bite which although is powerful doesn't overpower the more subtle citrus notes. Very well crafted.

Hazy gold with tall white head. Strong floral aroma with some citrus. Nice hoppy flavor, medium body, with a not-too-bitter finish. Very good.

The nose is bright with bitter citrus and touch of sweet floral for great balance.
This beer is a misty golden color with a frothy white head.
Medium bitterness hit the tongue first with the sweetness which was promised on the nose just sneaks in.
The mouth-feel is light and crisp with plenty of bubbles. The finish is quick and slightly flat, contrasting the delights that the aroma suggested.
Overall this beer disappointed. Having enjoyed other offerings from Stone this one fell short of the mark. To be fair, it is brewed to be a sessionable IPA so removing the alcohol has taken away somewhat from the body. Compared to other session IPAs its a winner.
Bottle from Bobs. Light hazy pour, nose of grapefruit and weed. Some cracker but this one isnt about the malt. Plenty tasty in a Stone sort of way. Nice at 4.5%.
Its been a while since Ive tried an IPA that didnt try way too hard. This is very easy to drink, and delicious.

Pours slightly cloudy light amber with sizable white head. Good hop notes on the nose, but in taste and finish, just too much grapefruit for my tastes. If you like Founders All Day IPA, then this is very similar. Just not for me.

Hazy straw gold with an abundant foamy white head. Wild wet lacing. Aroma is sticky, citrus hop resin. Smells like a DIPA. Taste is a real reversal. Tastes incomplete and a bit thin. Some malt under girth and just an echo of citrus. Decent dry bitterness but low on the flavor. Earthy and moderate carbonation. Looks and smells better than it tastes. A valiant effort, but falls a bit short of other Stone beers.

At first I was all about session ipas. Now, I am like, I love drinking double ipas in the hot sun by the pool. That has never bothered me. That being said, this is certainly one of the best of the least. Citrus, pine and some tropical notes pour out of the nose and taste with the like malt backing. Easy drinking with boastful flavors.

A light, pale pour with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet, bitter, floral. The flavor is mild. An upfront hit of big bodied IPA which quickly mellows to a sweet finish. For me, this is the definition of a session beer.
Bottle, pours a hazy dingy light yellow beige. Huge white fluffy head. Nig fresh citrusy hop aroma, and plenty of bitterness as well. But sessionable. Very nice.

Light yellow hue with white head, smells of resin, floral with a tinge of onion, body is light but not thin but does feel likes its missing a that little extra zip which is why it is like an IPA Lite, up front bitterness, some citrus and pine, good to have a low % summer alternative
Whew - what a tasty below 5% IPA! Well done stone. Still feels somewhat Cascade heavy (something I taste in most of their beers). Maybe its just me.
Pours pale gold. Head is white and lingering. Nose is dank onion, tropical fruits, citrus, fruits, rinds and awesomeness. Flavor is similarly awesome. Killer.
This is almost the perfect summer beer, it tastes like sunshine. Nice Citrus nose.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours golden orange with a firm white head. Upfront grapefruit and citrus aromas with some caramel biscuit malt. Flavours are textbool US hops, plenty of grapefruit, citrus, touch of pine and a smooth caramel malt bill. Big rounding bitterness at the end, yeyuz.

Large frothy, white head. Sophisticated cloudy yellow color. Strong hops, tropical and pine aroma. Yeasty. Taste is not quite as strong as the aroma, but equally as awesome. Light, smooth, crisp, slight peppery-ness, but just enough.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 12 ounce bottle pours a light straw yellow color with a bit of haze. Nice bright white creamy head that lasts a few minutes with nice lacing. Huge citrus nose of lemon and grapefruit. Light bodied high in carbonation with a huge grapefruit hoppy flavor. Very drinkable session IPA with lots of flavor.

Unclear medium golden with a frothy white head. Big aroma. Fruity. Citrus. Tropical and pine. Light toastiness. Flavor follows. Big flavor too with tons of hop character. Light body but not thin at all. Dry with a firm but moderate resin and grapefruit bitterness. Very drinkable as expected. Damn good.
Does exactly what it was created to do. Full-bodied flavor of a traditional Stone IPA with the drinkable alcohol content of a medium bodied lager. Sessionable and enjoyable.

Pours a hazy yellow with a distinct fruity aroma with layers of woody pine and fresh citrus. Small white head dissipates quickly. Taste is surprisingly light and even fruitier than it smells, with that woody aftertaste coming across with the hops. Overall taste of mixed fruits, light woody pine and a woody funky taste at the end. A very light IPA that did what it set out to do.
Hazy gold lacy white head; aroma is woody funky body odorish; Flava is hoppy similar to aroma motel if wood mulch; feels light little foamy fizz; finishes dry bitter yet spicy herbal earhty
12 oz bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow gold with a medium white head. Aroma of pine, bitter hops and floral notes. Taste of pine, bitter hops, watery mixed fruit and pine resin. Excellent.

Bottle poured a golden color with a one finger white head. Aroma has tropical fruit, citrus, clean and hop centered. Mouth feel is medium and there is plenty of carbonation. Flavor picks up unexpected bit of bitterness, dry citrus, grapefruit, clean malt, and it dries out nicely into the finish.

12oz bottle 6/24/14 (Jewel-Osco)-44° in Shaker-Pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus and hops. Taste of the same with a bit more hops. This light bodied brew is well balanced and IMO has more hops character than most other session IPAs. Good brew.

Pours a golden yellow with a foamy white head. Has an aroma of citrus fruit and floral notes. Flavor is floral and pine with lots of hops. I would enjoy this more, but theres something in the finish that is a bit off. I cant quite put my finger on it. Otherwise a good session ale.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2014 absurdly fruity aroma with big depth-sweet like apricot jam/over ripe pineapple/almost butterscotch with funky fruity/vegetative/floral pollen-like scents and other things I cant quite describe- plus standard pine/dry citrus/fir tree as well-one of the best aromas ive had from a s-ipa-flavor a bit less pungeant but big deep and sweet with apricot and dried pineapple-just a tad bit more of the bitter pine coming forward rather than whats in the aroma but still way more dimension than most ipas - really crazy flavors here-excellent stuff

Lightly stamped on the neck "Enjoy by 07/30/14."
This was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance was decent semi-hazy golden light bronzed color with a one and a half finger white foamy head. There was a decent sticky foamy lacing.
The smell had some nice spicy connotations of a fruity/piney aroma trying to make a decent assault upon my nose. I will say, theres a decent grapefruit coming out lightly as well.
The taste was mainly spicy and allowing a somewhat gentle sweetness rolling underneath a sweet citrusy hoppiness and still allowing a gentle sweet malt base. The aftertaste and finish are dry and spicy.
On the palate, this one sat light on the body with a good sessionability about this. The carbonation was good and harsh for the style as it made a good pummeling on my tongue.
Overall, Stone performed exactly as they had said they would. Well executed and more than worthy of having again and with its respected food.

On tap at the house. Love this stuff. Before drinking understand the category of the beer, a session IPA. I'm a die hard IPA'er and have Chillwave and Shorts Huma on tap as well. Go To is just a good tasting IPA that doesn't kick your A-- after three beers. I have this around so I can have a few in the afternoon and not have to go to ice water to stabilize.

Bottle (12 oz). Hazy bright golden with a small diminishing white head and good lacing. Aroma is quite hoppy with floral and piney notes along light tropical notes and light buttery presence. Taste is quite floral too with piney notes, decent malt backbone, tropical fruits, light/moderate bitterness and hints of soap. Light/medium body. Medium carbonation. Slightly dry finish. A tad sticky. Its quite sessionnable so the goal is achieved, but its a basic Stone beer, they can do better with hops. And theres a little something off (butter + soap).
pours light amber, small off white head. catty, vegetative nose. taste has bittermess, very vegetative taste, like a tomato plant..... yes plant. light body.

A nice IPA with a great citrusy and piney aroma. Taste is bitter, piney and grapefruit in the beginning with a lemony aftertaste. Other than that an ok beer nothing great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Beer Revolution. Pours light amber with a modest white head and a citrus aroma. There is a fresh pale malt flavor with a fairly bitter finish.
Piney and grassy IPA that is pretty typical of a west coast ipa. Light and sessionable. Not amazing, but a good basic IPA.
amber color; great citrusy, grapefruit hop aroma; a very dry, bitter IPA; lots of piney, citrusy hop flavor on a pretty light malt background; an easy drinking session IPA

Aromas of lemon, parsimmon, and pine. Clear dark gold with a lasting white head. Dry and piney, with aromatic flavors of sharp fruit that linger in the nasal cavity. Light bodied, quite bitter but pretty refreshing.
