Clear dark gold pour with a nice bright white head that sticks around. Aroma is huge hops. Notes of stone fruit and big pine. Really light mouthfeel, but good for 4.5. Flavor is like pure hops. Great mike of pine, mango, and citrus. Nice beer

Wow... what a nice light IPA. The name says it all. Its an IPA that is light and crisp but still retains the fruity piney flavor form a much stronger IPA. Its an IPA that before you know it youve had to many. They sneak up on you buddy. Its a perfect starter IPA for anyone who is interested in giving a real beer a shot.
Tap at Parlor City. Light copper color with a small white head. Lots of apricots and grass. Mouthfeel and body are kind of thin.

12oz bottle. Hazy yellowy gold. Huge juicy orange and mango on the nose, so spruce too. Juicy fruits up front in the taste, waxy orange, grapefruit and some grassy spruce. Really clean. Lingering waxy bitterness, short finish. Crisp and super-refreshing. Lawnmower beer par excellence.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear golden yellow with a big fluffy white head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is lots of dank resiny piney hops. Some garlic comes out as it warms.

The flavor is a little bready malt and fruit with resiny, piney hops. The mouthfeel is medium bodied and slightly watery and metallic.

Overall, a solid session IPA. Lots of good piney resiny bitterness. Still has a slightly watery mouthfeel.

Pours yellow, mostly clear, half finger thin white head. Aroma big earthy pine and grapfruit, slightly flowery. Taste bitter grapefruit, pine, bitter floral finish. Mouthfeel thin, good carbonation, nice bitter hop astringency, dry finish. Overall a bit thin, but other than that and no malt presence is hard to belive it?s size, I couldn?t see how a beer under 5% could be made any better.
Pours a light copper color with a small lacy white head. Overwhelming notes of apricots, citrus rind, grass, and alcohol. Body is pretty thin.

On tap. served a golden color with a decent head and some lacing. Aroma of citrus, some pine, and fruity with grain. Taste of citrus, fruit sweetness and grain. Solid bitterness and a dry finish. Moderate body, crisp with a distinct feel. Nice beer but not a big fan of some over hopped IPAs.

The aroma in this is tremendous, you can tell that they used a LOT of late addition aroma hops. But it drinks and tastes like bitter seltzer. Theres no body to this beer like in Founders All Day and the aroma doesnt match the flavor. Nice try Stone, but Founders wins this battle.

Best by 29MAY14

Its a light gold ale with a solid sheet of whites. Smells like citra, some simcoe - hoppy. Flavor is citrus with orange peel, grapefruit and then some tangerine. There is a dry, crackery malt with a solid bitterness in there. Medium on light bodied with moderate carb and a dry finish. Nice beer - can it.

Pale very clear pour. Bubbles clinging to the side of the glass like seltzer. A little bit of thick looking foam head. Huge peach and grapefruit aroma. Body is seriously thin. Tastes like peach seltzer. Hops are fantastic, but the malt is just too thin and unsubstantial to make this work. There is actually a good bit of sweetness, but the lack of body is a problem. Carbonation is too much. Bitterness lingers too much when the sweetness disappears too soon. The peach, apricot, grapefruit hop flavors are nice when they're there. Again, I really don't think this session IPA style works quite right.

2014 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a bright, clear lemon yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma is dank with tropical fruits and pine. Taste is malt up front but then it's all hops. Big piney taste and bitterness with a little caramel. Bitterness is refreshing and clean, not overpowering. Thin-medium mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
It poured an amber color with a white head. The aroma was mostly of hops with citrus and pine hops dominating. The taste was of sweet malts and again with citrus and pine hops. Not bad.

Draft at the growler. NYc. Pours. Cloudy orange yellow color with no head. Taste is piney and grassy very much so which surprising for an iPa from stone with this low of an iPa. Decently good if you're into all the floralness 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pours pale gold with two finger white head. Citrus, pine, earth, floral. High bitterness. Crisp, light body. A little bit astringent. Very nice session beer.
Draft. Pours gold, white head, good retention/lace. Aroma of citrus, floral, grassy hop, cracker. Taste is bitter, citrus, a bit tropical, grassy, cracker. Palate is soft, slick, bitter finish.

Fun in the sun fruity beer. Bitterness is well rounded and a little heavy, but without the early boil bitterness to weigh it down. Might be too fruity and full on to drink more than a few glasses, but nice beer all the same.

Pours a pale golden color with a white head. Hop, citrus, pine and floral aroma. Hop, pine, lemon, mango, floral and malt flavors. Light body and average carbonation. Mild bitterness and a lemon and hop finish.

Pours a clear golden with lacing white head. Abundant aromas of citrus and pine. Very crisp. Taste is surprisingly easy drinking but heavy on flavor. Lemon citrus with floral notes. Hard to believe its such a lite beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours light yellow with a white head. Grapefruit and pine nose. Musty bitter hop flavor finishes with a deep bitterness. Musty. Resinous.

12oz bottle from Tanakaya Liquor Store, Tokyo. Yellow amber, not much head. strong pine hop aroma and flavour. very dry grapefruit hoppy aftertaste. This is a classic example of a new style of beer - the low abv big tasting IPA. Hope others follow this example.

Session IPAs could easily become my favorite go to beer, and Stone has captured that with this floral hop nose beer, slightly more malt than I like, but if they could hit a 6pack of cans at a reasonable price point, Id give up rating and just drink that all day every day. hmm all day ipa sounds like a good name too.... lol
Yellow color with a medium head. Strong aroma of mango, fruit, grassy hops. Quite pungeant. A bit of lemon flavor. Abrasively bitter. Somewhat grainy and vegetal.

Bottle at Ibis Tokyo Shinjuku - shared with Mette. Clear yellow/golden - white head. Hashish aroma, fresh hoppy aroma, citrus, light malty, light knækbrød, flowery notes, cereal notes, lovely.....Fresh fresh fresh.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Bottle via SL... I had this beer after coming off a cold/flu so not sure my palate was ready for such a beer. I though it was really danky, bitter and cat pee. But I gave it a second chance... Put me on the front of the bandwagon for this beer... Wow, what a nose... soon as you pop the cap hops come smacking you in the face... Over whelming in a good way. Doesnt look like much... average at best but it makes up for that. Taste is a bitter, grass, light citrus and some more bitterness. But not the bitter that I was expecting... (no bitter beer face) almost fresh hop bitterness. Dank as well. Tons of flavor for such a low alcohol content brew. Grapefruit just lingers on your taste buds... I will put this above 3F ZD and LG daytime BLVD pop up, and Founders all day IPA. Body is light, refreshing, easy to drink. Overall. Great session IPA, definitely the hoppiest I have had. I had this along with Stone enjoy by 4-20-14 and their grapefruit DIPA and I though it was better than both those two beers.... I hope this is available all year long. The more I have this the more I like it!
(bottle) clear bright orange amber colour with a small tan head; aroma of tropical fruit, citrus; lightly bitter flavour with a long medium bitter finish; very nice

Draft in a flight at Ground Control. Pours a bright, clear gold color with a finger of eggshell-colored head that leaves heavy lace in the glass. Aroma of herbs, pepper, weed (cat piss), pale malts, sweat, and lemon citrus. The flavor is the same slate of notes, but not quite as dank overall. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a clean mouthfeel that gets bitter in the middle. Really nice. Lives up to its billing and name.

Bottle. Nose gorgeous grapefruit peel and rind with some orange and resin, lighter lychee and pine. Pours clear straw with a frothy beige head. Light-medium body with lightly astringent, rind-heavy bitterness, more pith than resin, and very dry and stripping. The hop flavor is less impressive than the nose, both dialed back and of a lesser quality. Clean and relatively pleasant, has some lager character.

Growler pours with a deep gold body that supports a white head. The aroma is nice and juicy with orange and tangerine mixed with lesser amounts of spicy hop onion like dankness and a sliver of lime. Nice indeed. The taste begins with a pleasing mix of hop flavor and hop bitterness coming from juicy and bitter tangerine, clementine and orange citrus hoppiness. Behind all of the citrus notes are thin layers of malts and spicy slightly onion like dank hoppiness. Solid brew where the body  has plenty of heft to hold it together. Yum.
Bottle. Clear light orange pour with a white head. Awesome citrus hop aroma and taste, with a hint of pine. Huge aroma on this - awesome!
30 mar 2014, tap. Yellow, clear, some steady bubbles. Nose is serious grapefruit rind hops. Thin body and fizzy. Bitter, Oily grapefruit rind, faintly sweet, bitter finish. Pretty good!
UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 Valiant effort. Tasty easy drinking with a citrus hop bite. Mango, pineapple, passionfruit, lemon zest. Approve and say its better than founders version.

Clear light golden with a thin foamy white head. The nose has a huge tone of acidic alpha hop resins, pine, and pure grapefruit juice. The flavor has a huge tone of floral whole cone hop earthiness, alpha acid lupulin-iness, grapefruit rind, and a mild underlying pale malt sweetness on a medium, crisp body. Its fine, but a bit light and a bit too much on the earthy whole cone hop flavors.

Light golden color. Small white head that is quick to fall. No lacing. Big danky aroma of hops with some resinous piney notes. Some citrus. Hoppy water flavor. With a bit of a burnt roasted note. Finishes danky and slightly bitter.

12oz bottle from Antioch. Pours a clear, pale yellow color with a white head and some lacing. Aroma is very hoppy, pine, grass, grapefruit. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bready, some bitter, grass hops, with a stiff, bitter finish. Very nice.

Bottle from beer fridge in WI via Antioch Liquors. thanks Sherm1016. Pours a bright yellow with thin head and strong piney / hoppy nose. This is one fine session beer....low BAV combined with an excellent hop nose and taste. Excellent!

Bottle. Slightly hazed amber with a short white head. STRONG floral and citrus hops, tropical fruit, citrus fruit, pine and caramel in the aroma. Taste is more herbal and floral with the fruit notes and soft malt coming through in the background. Body is medium with a light bubbly carbonation and a pleasant lingering hop bitterness. Ends with more floral and herbal hops, citrus notes, light malt and a touch of caramel.

Bottle pours clear yellow with brief white head. Piney hop aroma. Taste slight malts but mainly pine and citrus hops. Finish mainly bitter pine with a touch of grapefruit.. A little too piney for me, but a pretty easy drinking IPA.

Well done session IPA, pours a light golden color with a short head. Not huge on taste, but crisp, clean, and smooth with a good pine and grapefruit flavor. Nice finish with a bit of bitter/piney aftertaste. They should can this up so it can go on your next adventure.
Very fruity and tropical. Effervescent. Light bodied, could use a little more malt. One of the better light ipas and certainly sessionable.

3/27/14. Draft. Pours a slightly hazy golden. Wonderful nose. Very piney aromatics. One of the more drinkable session IPAs. Verges on being a palette wrecker but keeps it in bounds. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful grapefruit citrus hop aroma and flavor. There is a nice malt balance. Beer is on the lighter side but full flavored and a great ipa. In the realm of all day ipa, but I think even a step better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at Proof. Clear light straw pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma of citrus rind, grass, whizzy hops and onion. Flavor is similar, light body and and lingering bitter finish. Not bad at all.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a bright yellow gold color with a small white head. The aroma is bursting with grapefruit, florals, mild spicy pine and some background cookie malt sweetness. The flavor is more floral and grapefruit hops with some hints of caramel and cookie-like malts. The finish has an aggressive spicy, floral and piney bitterness. The body is not too thin considering the low gravity. Pretty tasty stuff. I could session this easily.

Really nice session-style IPA. This is definitely one that you could drink several of over the course of an evening and really enjoy, without the effects of the alcohol. Go To IPA pours a bright and clear light golden color with a very generous white head. The nose is very spicy, with an abrasive hop presence. The flavors are a little on the sour-hoppy side. I also sense a nice profile of floral and dry hops. Theres also plenty of pine and grassy notes. The beer finishes well, with more sourness and prickly hops.

Nice golden color. Nice frothy white head. Nice big grapefruit and citrus nose. Light body. Tons of hops big bitterness, but enough backbone to give it balance. Sooo smooth and easy drinking. Highly enjoyable.

The at the first impression of this beer comes off fruity and tropical, with flavors predominately of melon, candied peach and resin.  Although, upon first sip the fruitier notes quickly fade away, leaving the resin as well as a slightly vegetal and bitter finish.

This is just it. Go to IPA is the real deal. So hoppy, so floral, citrus bomb, hop bomb just amazing. This beer is such a low ABV but has so much flavor and so much punch its straight filthy. All IPAs need to just pay homage to this beer. Stone is so consistent and represents what beer should beer. Say what you will but stone is keeping beer alive and in a beer world with stone, I feel pretty damn safe. Thank christ for stone and for beer.
On tap. Clear dark golden color. Grapefruit aroma. Light taste of grapefruit and bitterness. Nice beer to drink.

Cantaloupe, pine sap, pineapple juice hop aroma with an herbal / grassy shallot and green leaf vegetable note. Medium body with syrupy malt thinning across the back. Malt is quiet, takes a few minutes to coax a toasted grain note from the aroma. Fruity esters, malt sugar and juicy hop oils give it candy sweetness and flavor to go with a silty chew-able vitamin aftertaste. An improvement for Stone, much more oily and juicy than I remember their other IPAs, and not as astringent and chalky as the Pale Ale and Levitation. Alas it stinks of melon and resin and garlic.

Hazy, light yellow pour with a white head. The aroma has some floral hops and a lot of citrus. It has a light, watery texture with lively carbonation. The taste is bitter with a grapefruit rind sourness in the dry finish. Not for me.

Pours a clear gold with a sticky off white foam head that dissipates. The aroma was not overbearing with very pleasant notes of pine, citrus fruit, earthy hops and it had a good malty backbone. As for flavor it had a mild but lingering bitterness with a defined taste of crisp and dry malts. This was an intriguing beer, it reminded me of a pale ale in flavor that had been invaded by the bitterness and aroma of a hoppy ipa. Overall a fine brew here and worth having.

Bottle. Clear gold with a big white head. Aroma is huge citrus, specifically orange, tangerine and grapefruit with a hint of caramel malt. Taste is dank bitterness followed by the citrus and sweet malt. Medium mouthfeel and strong carbonation. Definitely a flavorful session brew.
Piney aroma, small citrus notes, malt. Easy drinking, not overwhelming bitterness normally from Stone. Reminds me of All Day IPA by Founders-Lower alcohol.

Bottling date was smudged, but super fresh anyway.
Appearance: Clear sparkling light golden body with a short and dense white head. Good retention, solid looking beer.
Aroma: Big hop aroma, dank with some pine, citrus, mango and peach. I get that unique Simcoe aroma in this, Id imagine they use it here.
Taste: The flavor doesnt quite live up to the huge juicy aroma. Dry and floral with hints of toasted malts. The bitterness is mild to medium for a beer of this ABV. Definitely something highly drinkable, but I feel like the hop flavor has been sucked out. I get some apricot and mango by the finish with a splash of honey, but overall this is just a dry floral and toasty flavor profile.
Palate: Light bodied, highly carbonated. Perfect for guzzling down.
Overall: This is another session IPA that has a huge aroma, but lacking in flavor, similar to how I feel about All Day IPA. The price really hurts as well, especially when compared to similar beers. A session IPA for $12 a 6 pack? No thanks. Nice to drink though.

bottle pour...light golden color with ample amounts of carbonation..left a 1 finger white head..nose is citrus forward with orange..apricot.mango notes..mouthfeel is quite light bodied and does have a good amount of bitter twang with a lemon presence..pretty enjoyable and flavorful session ipa that could easily pass for a higher octane abv..

Open the bottle and take a whiff. Amazing hop aroma which makes your mouth water. No glass in this hotel to pour into, so unable to really rate appearance. But since its stone Im sure its pretty! Taste is fantastic, subtle hops at first and then an amazing finish with wonderful hoppy aftertaste. Overall a wonderful brew and at only 4.5 abv you can enjoy a lot!
Smells hoppier that it tastes. Very smooth and I very much enjoy this particular Stone IPA.
Bottle. Clear light yellow with off white head. Strong grapefruit citrus aroma. Bitter.-- rated with beerbasher

From a bottle. Pours hazy gold with a thin, fizzy white head. Tastes like light very light hops, nice bitterness with some creamy, sweet orange citrus. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like funky, musky hops and stale bread.

Bottle. Pours clear golden amber with fizzy white head. Aroma is dank hops, cracker malt, citrus and tropical fruit, and faint grassiness. Flavor is fresh hops, dry malts, grapefruit and pineapple esters, and light pine; dry finish with some lingering bitterness. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

12oz bottle shared. Pours bright yellow with minimal white head. The aroma is a big citrus nose and lots of grapefruit. The flavor is decadent. Light to medium body hoppy grapefruit and bits a grass engulf the taste buds. You wouldnt know this to be a session beer. Fresh and delicious.
Pours a clear and light gold. Has a grainy and citrus hop aroma. Taste is full of citrus hops, pine, and grains. A very bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Bottle with Pat and Sean. Pours a light golden body with nice white head and lacing. Aroma is light, soft citrus on the nose and some faint bready malt sweetness. Mouthfeel is super light and sessionable - notes of light grapefruit, honey and sweet malt. Super easy going - would definitely like to try this again on draft.

Again on draft at pony bar HK with Brendan. Pours a hazy golden body with frothy white lacing. Aroma is super fresh hop, grapefruit and pine fill the nose. Mouthfeel is literally like water - super sessionable. I wish there was a bit more flavor and a bit richer on the palate but still a solid session.

12 oz. bottle from SoHo Organic Market, Elizabeth City, NC. Yellowish-orange pour with a frothy white head. Aroma of wet grass, pine, and grapefruit rind. Bitter hop flavor of pine needles, grapefruit, and tangerine. Lingering bitterness on the palate. Impressive as hell at only 4.5%. A great sessionable IPA.

Ar: Bright resiny mango, onion - orange pith.
Ap: Orange and clear - medium-small off-white head with moderate retention - thing ring of foam and covering.
T: Lightly toasted crackers - lime and mango, some pine - medium-high bitterness, very clean - finish is lemon and more pine.
P: Light body with high carbonation - finish is very dry.
O: Bright and quaffable IPA - pretty straightforward, some nice fruit and resin notes.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a pale yellow color with a large foamy white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was perfume, pine, a bit of catbox and was fairly dry. The flavor was dry and tart perfume, catbox and lemon. Medium dry perfume finish. Light to medium body. Meh.

Location/Date:Bottle on 3/16/2014.
Appearance: Pours yellow. 
Aroma: Aroma of citrus and pine.
Taste: Medium light bitterness, pine.
Palate:Light body.
Summary: Ive had 4-5 of these since the initial one. Good enjoyable session brew.
Draft. Clear gold pour, thin head. Nose is citrus, fruit, floral. Flavor is biscuit malt and some citrus. Finishes bitter. Not my cup of tea.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Clear golden. Good carbonation holds a big white head. Stinky citrus aroma. Super danky floral taste like eating a hop bouquet. The body thins considerably when poured into a glass so drink it from the bottle like it was meant to be or better yet on tap, or better still from a growler. The highest flavor, lowest alcohol beer to date

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 This has to be my highest rated session beer. The downside is that it costs nearly the same as the classic IPA. Still, I sampled the Stone IPA immediately afterwards, and I think this one has more flavor.  Aroma is a good kind of funky with BO, fruit, and lots of pine.  It loses the depth and taste longevity, but the flavor is pretty good, and more of it up front than their original IPA.  Fades quick leaving a hollow bitterness with some of the funk lingering.  Quick aftertaste makes it feel light, and would make for a great summer beer on a hot day in the backyard.

Oh sweet goodness this was a surprise! Maybe the strongest, heaviest aroma Ive ever experience in a beer. A wave of sweet orange blossoms right out of the bottle. Clear straw pour with a blast of floral. Wow. Beautifully bitter, over the toppy hoppy, yet pleasingly balanced with an orangey/tropical finish. Wonderfully balanced, crisp, dry, with an explosion of hops that threatens, but never goes over the top. Very impressive, I will be drinking a lot of this beer. Would I drink again? YES. Would I order again? already did.

Exactly like you expect. Big hop bitterness and flavor. Not a lot of alcohol. Smells fantastically fruity hoppy. Honestly, I think id rather just be drinking a pale ale. But I like that a bunch of breweries are starting to make these. And this one is pretty good for what it is.

Pours a clear gold with a white head and lacing. It has a great tropical fruit and pine resin aroma with a flavor that is bitter throughout, with fruit notes up front and a resin backbone over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The taste is a little disappointing after the great aroma, but definitely a good beer. Gorgeous color, big hoppy notes in the smell, and obviously very sessionable.

Purchased at Binnys in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a chilly early spring Sunday after binge watching House of Cards. I never knew "Session IPA" was a new style, and it may be my new favorite one. This is a fantastic brew. Appearance a lightly cloudy gold with a moderate white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is abundant in floral and citrus hops, smells very hoppy but not potent. Taste is just the same, really great hop profile but doesnt finish bitter with a light crisp finish. It gives all the great qualities of an IPA without making my stomach hurt from the hops, which Ive experienced over the years. Great brew and a nice style.
12oz bottle to pint, translucent rich golden appearance. Fresh juicy hops in the aroma, taste is also very fresh and hoppy. Insanely tasty for 4.5%.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 Bottle: Bright gold with slight amber-orange tints, great clarity & topped with a chunky white head that sinks to a foamy collar leaving sticky lacing behind. Aroma is surprisingly powerful & very nice! Lots of dripping wet, pungent grapefruit-y & citric notes, wet hops, pine, mild dankness, grass, & some gushing passion fruit. Taste is a touch watery, but still has plenty of flavor... Grass, citrus flesh, mild green onion, cracker malts, pine, a hint of bitterness, a touch of tropical fruit, leading to a relatively dry finish. Crisp mouth feel, very light. I was quite surprised by this, but I shouldnt be, as Stone usually makes solid hoppy beers. Very tasty session IPA... the only thing keeping this from actually being a "go-to" for me is the price.

Pours a light amber color with a white head. Aroma is mostly hops with citrus and pine hops dominating. Flavor is light at first with the sweet malts and finishes with the citrus and pine hops. Plenty of bitterness on the finish that lingers.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 Draft. Hazy gold. Big grapefruit and pineapple juice notes. A very good session ipa that has a flavorful punch at first but, very little aftertaste. Quick finish that highlights the session aspects of this ipa. Good job Stone. Very drinkable and light. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Louisville bottle after Papa Johns 10 miler. Really its a good IPA that I would never really guess was a session ale. Leans to the resinous side of hops with nice bitterness. Nice.
Draught with dinner. Pours copper with a thin white head. Smells of resiny hops. Tastes dry and bitter with a spicy, brilliant finish.
Bottle pours a golden clear color with a thin head. Aroma and taste of citrus, orange and pineapple. As usual with stone, this is a very good session beer.
3/21/2014. on tap. Pours light amber with a white head. Floral aromas with tropical fruit and fresh hops.Piney and bitter flavors. Very refreshing and very enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 On tap at Harrys Hofbrau. Massive grapefruit and sweet malt aroma. Clear gold with white head that collars. Flavor is citrus with strong bitterness. Sweet finish of residual sugar is surprising for the low Abv. Second review and this beer is really overly bitter. Had scored very high before but need to average it out.

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a fluffy white head that leaves plenty of lacing. Massive hop aroma! Pine and grapefruit mostly. Somewhat tropical, very earthy, and pretty skunky, but in a good way. Taste is very odd and definitely different from any other IPA Ive ever tasted. Huge earthy, tropical, citrusy taste. Pine, grapefruit, mango, several other tropical fruits that I cant quite put my finger on. Lots of hop oils. Very bitter and dry. Long finish of bready malt, pine and citrus. Taste is really too big for its own good. Too many flavors that are amped up make this actually a bit hard to drink. Medium-light body, slick texture, medium-high carbonation. Good, but not something I could see myself drinking several of in a sitting. Taste is just too overwhelming.

Pours a macro gold color. The thinnest of white heads with no lacing. Grainy hop aroma. Nothing but hops and bitterness. The bitterness lingers a long time and if you really focus it reminds you exactly of grapefruit. If I wanted a low alcohol beer from Stone I would pick Levitation every time over this.

Bottles from Capones and Whole Foods. Pours clear gold with splotchy off-white head. Nose is intense honeydew, pineapple, resiny malt. Tastes of pineapple, honewdew, pale malt, with a crisp, black peppery finish. This one is stellar.

Bottle at craft ale house. Pours clear yellow with a medium sized white head. The aroma is quite piney, resinous, semi floral, a bit of citrus. The taste has a dry bitterness, big fruity citrus notes, long bitter duration.

Bottle. One of the most seductive-looking beers Ive seen. Pure gold, just active enough, thin head. The aroma is amazing ... look up "smell of hops" in the dictionary, this is what you get ... fresh, oily, earthen, floral. All that carries to the drink. For those that dig those big, fresh-and-wet hop flavors, this is indeed your "go to" IPA. (#5474, 3/21/2014)

Pours a very light yellow, with minimal head. Aroma is marked by strong floral and citrus elements. Flavor is strongly floral, with marked pine-hop bitterness and some citrusy/grapefruit flavors. Pretty good, sort of a light IPA, if thats possible.

Bottle that seems very fresh. Pours very light golden, clear, fleeting head. Aroma is way bigger hops than you would expect out of a normal session beer, classic Stone. Tropical, pine, spicy resin. Flavor is strong and cleanly bitter, perhaps a bit metallic, light grains. Feel is watery with a bit more of the metal and a mouthwatering long finish. Very nice to have so much great hops with something with this little alcohol. Digging it.

Hay yellow with a thick white head. Light bodied citrusy. Grassy and very light and clean. Great hop flavor balance to the hops

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear gold pour with a thin white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and grassy. Taste is a lightly bitter citrus, pine, and grass. Light body. Really easy to drink. This is exactly what it says it is. I like this a beer a lot.

Pours a clear golden color, small white head. Aroma is one of grassy, hay, earthiness, along with faint citrus hops. A nice, bright IPA, but nothing earth-shattering. Good for what it is, a session IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2014 Half liter at lord hobo.  Best stone beer Ive had in quite some time. Reminds me of founders all day IPA. A bit of Shaq diesel hops. Floral hibiscus. Some resin herbal bitterness. Touch of orange tangerine sweetness. But definitely on the bitter end. Drinks fine, if a but too much resin. Would prefer less bitterness. But still relatively enjoyable.
Delicious hop forward session IPA. Aroma is citrus and sweet pine. Light golden color. Tasty hops are the star of this beer. Will become a great summer session!

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Pour a medium orange with a one finger white head with some lacIng. Aroma is of citrus, dank hops, tropical fruits, pine, and some light biscuit malts. Taste is similar to the aroma win some nice citrus and tropical fruit notes. Has a medium-light body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderate-semi bitter, medium long finish. Overall, a very tasty session IPA that has a ton of flavor for a sub 5 ABV beer.
On tap at Winking Lizard Grandview on 3/19/14. Clear gold pour with a thick off-white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, malt and earthy hops. Oniony flavor with malt accents before a grapefruit finish.
Draft in Virginia. Poured clear gold white head. Hops nose, strong hops bite that dissipated into slight cream finish. Pretty good.

12oz bottle to glass. Pours a light, clear golden color. Little head present. Aroma is solid. Piney hops, hop resin. Taste is surprising, pine and pine resin. Solid hop bitterness. You can definitely tell that it is reduced ABV, as there is not as much of a burn / tingle with the bitterness. Lots of flavor for a small ABV beer. Palate is thin, moderately to highly carbonated. Overall a good beer, did not sacrifice flavor with the reduced ABV.
Clear golden body w/ white head & beautiful lacing. Bright citrus grapefruit floral aromas. Intensely hoppy, piney & fruity. Acidic & crisp.

From 12oz bottle. Pours a clean, apricot gold. Small head of large bubble. Big grapefruit nose. Taste is bitter upfront, creamy in the middle, and bitter afterwards. Some pine, but mostly an explosion of bitter grapefruit hops. This is a straight forward beer. Those large bubbles from the head make for effervescent mouthfeel. Compared to other newly released session IPAs (Cartons Boat Beer, Founders Everyday) this comes up short.

A very bright, clear, pale yellow with a ton of carbonation and a little bit of suds. The aroma has lemon zest notes, a little bit of pine. The flavor hits up front with a lot of hop character, grapefruit and pine notes, and it isnt bad. But that fades very quickly to a bright but watery and insubstantial finish. It is hard to settle for less from the brewery that makes Enjoy By and Ruination. I wont have this again.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 The appearance is a super clear amber color with a medium white head, and the aroma blends citrus, pine, and resin hops. The taste is quite bitter and slightly sweet, and the palate fuses a sticky texture, medium body, average carbonation, and a bitter finish.

12 oz bottle purchased at Royal Liquors in Kansas City, Missouri. Enjoy by 05/21/14 stamped on the bottleneck. The pour is clear yellow golden with a smallish off-white head. Despite small head, pretty lacing left on the glass. The aroma is bright grapefruit hop, sort of a sweaty melon and soft floral notes. The taste is bitter grapefruit peel, citrus fruit, a bit of resin and finishes with some mineral. The palate is light bodied, high carbonation level, bitter citrus mineral finish. Tasty and easy to drink.

Gold pour thin head.
Huge citrus and tropical fruit. Biscuity malt aroma.
Flavour is pineapple, lime and orange citrus.
Light cracker and biscuity malt body. Strong lingering bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a transparent golden color. Medium lacy finishing head. Aromas is citrus fruit and piney hops. Taste is citrus hops. Very light and smooth IPA. True to its session style. Good ale.
Light cloudy golden color. the beer has a nice whit head. With a stong citrus and almost a lemon aroma. With a nice hop citrus refreshing taste.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Un nez franc dagrumes et de sapin qui est cependant un peu gâché par le siège du diacétyl comme rarement jai vu dans ce genre de bière, surtout par Stone. Reste à voir si cest une question de ligne de fût.

Pours transparent golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of floral, citrusy, and slightly piney hops, plus some light pale malts and light dough. Flavor the same with a nice hoppiness. Average to light texture. A solid session IPA.

Beautifully crafted @ only 4.5%. Bitter grapefruit, orange peel, and evergreen are all there. More fragrant that traditional and even some double IPAs. Flavor also shows a solid amount of pine along with floral and citrusy hops. Not a lot of caramel or malt, which is fantastic! Cant believe this is sessionable...so good on a hot AZ summer day!

Pours a light golden with a medium white head. Smells beautifully fruity and hoppy maybe a bit grassy. Light and body and lightly bubbly, easily drinkable. Has some fruity and hoppy notes but what mostly stands out most is the bubbly water part; not much for complexity at all. While not terrible, it should be pretty plain and tasteless to the regular IPA drinker lacking Any stand out traits, eventually becoming outright boring. For a more exciting sessionable hoppy beer, why not go back to Stone Pale Ale?

Tap at bgc in dc march 20214
Pours lite orange with a small soapy white head and sparse lacing. Huge hop forward nose lots of citrus. Flavors of sharp hops very lite in terms of bitterness butvery sessionable. I like it quite a bit! I think founders edges it out by a slim margin. Short finish of lite citrus. Solid session brew! Its crazy how expensive this beer is!
Nice citrusy dank aroma, crystal clear appearance, thin crisp finish. Little light on the body but hard to do with this size IPA.

Aroma is signature Stone dank/grassy hops and pine/citrus. The flavor is dank hops, fruit, citrus, malts, grapefruit/light tropical fruit and a long and bitter finish. Not as thin in body as other session IPAs, among the best in the style.

12oz bottle thanks to Bob F. Pours a crystal clear golden color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of melon, pineapple, citrus, and bready malts. Taste of bready malts, pine, grapefruit skins, and light citrus. Good stuff!

UPDATED: APR 3, 2015 Medium sized, white head with fair retention and decent lacing. Clear, pale gold colored brew. Nose of oranges, some dankyness, earth. Body is light with a nice carbonation, lightly juicy with a bit much of an aspirin,y feel. Dry, pale malts dropped under a brisk citrus haze, lil toast and fruit, citrus and light berries. Dry finish, crisp and biting. Decent. 

rerate 4.3.15 This has been my Go To beer fro a while now. The hop aromas and flavors are amazing! You would think yer drinkin a much bigger brew than you really are. The aroma and flavors are amazing! I,m lovin this brew. Not many SIPA,s compete.

Draft at Capones. Clear pale yellow with nice small bubble head that leaves heavy lacing. aroma of sweet pale malt, citrus peal and tropical fruits. first sip is similar with a nice mild lingering bitterness in the finish. great for the style.

Dark golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, tropical fruits and some toasted malts. Taste of citrus, light pine, tropical fruits, and grapefruit bitter finish.

Another solid session ipa. I might like this more than the lagunitas, boulevard, and founders ones but that might only be cuz i had it fresh. Seems like it has more body than the others, but that might just be cuz its fresher as I mentioned in the last sentence.

Pint at Blue Monkey, pours clearish olden with medium large bubbled off white head. Nose is huge on the tangy and tropical zested hops. I get mango, kiwi, grapefruit resin, and buttery melon. Flavor has a ton of that melon also, along with some grass, pine, and light onion. Finishes like water, its not thin, just incredibly juicy and sessionable. I would put this one above founders all day, now lets see how fresh we can continue to get it.

Pours a clear golden yellow from the bottle with dissipating white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma is huge on the hops, lots of new world zestiness with a hint of citrus. Taste follows, hints of garlic and lots of grass with citrus overtones. Very clean and easy to drink, medium carbonation; awesome beer.

Bright yellow color with a full white head - looks like a good German Pilsner. The nose turns that perception on its ear, as it is a wonderland of grapefruit, pine and resin aromas. The flavor is a bit more subdued, with strong echoes of the flavors listed above. A nice crisp mouthfeel, with a very dry finish. The only thing missing is the alcohol - otherwise, a perfect west coast IPA. Perfect for day drinking - on an aside, my pilsner-loving, craft-hating wife thought this was really good - high praise...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: pours clear straw with frothy white head. Nose is super pungent, citrus hoppy greenness with a little bit of fresh pine. Really appetizing. Lighter bodied though still reasonable. Resinous green hop freshness with plenty of bitterness and drying finish. Could make this my all day go to

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

3/18/14. 12oz bottle from 5 Points. Very clear golden pour. Abundant hop aroma, lots of dank aspects, dry, leafy, green, hoppy. Diggin it. Nice flavor, not too bitter, basically no malt, tons of fresh hoppiness, dank, citrus, pine. Just a bit too thin, honestly. Moreso digging the lighter type uber fresh hoppy pale ales with more body and character, but this is still pretty tasty and drinks good.

#sessioncity, pours clear golden yellow, engulfing white head. Big citrus, melon, pine in the nose.. Taste is pine, lemon, mostly bitter fruits, big taste for the style obviously.. So a success. Aftertaste is almost sour, leaves you wanting to crush another one. Could this please replace bud light in bars across the country?

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Pours clear straw with a white head and nice lacing. Aroma is pleasant spring hops, a bit of subtle citrus. Body is a bit lighter and dry for sure, with citrus flavors as well. Grapefruit is present and juicy, but not overbearing.

12 oz bottle. Poured clear straw yellow with a thin white top. Taste of grass, spruce, citrus, and slight tropical fruits. medium-high carbonation, thin body. Light and refreshing. Im not a hop head, so take this rating with a grain of salt.
Pours golden thin white head. Aroma is big hop. Flavor is piney hops, some grapefruit, biscuity malt and a good bit of bitterness.

Incredible stuff!!. One of the nicest ipas Ive had. Go and buy some now! 
And see if theyve ever worn anything red. According to Dr. Alvin Hotchkins, author of Your Neighbor Wants to 
Desecrate Your Corpse, "The color red indicates an unhealthy obsession with blood and flesh. If you 
see someone wearing red, odds are that theyre plotting your doom. Stay out of their way and call the police." 
Believe the expert. Take his advice. Dont let your neighbor desecrate your corpse.  Truly a fantastic beer!

[ Tap ][ Salted Pig Riverside ][ 4oz ][ $2-3 ][ Mini Imperial Pint ][ 3/16/14 ]
>> Pours a bright blonde. Medium white foam with great lacing. Juicy tropical nose- bright pineapple and papaya. Taste is clean, low body, kumquat, mango, tangerine juice, orange marmalade, mild soap, slight butter biscuit. Very nice.
Drought. Rich yellow with small foamy whitish head, floral hops aroma, low carbonation, sweetish smooth hoppy taste, long finish. A very smooth IPA, very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Draft at Stone. Crystal clear golden orange pour, with a white head. Citrusy hops, tropical fruit, pine, grapefruit, crackery malt, very dry. Nice blend of fresh tasting hops, not much malt. Tasty hop juice.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 5/25/2014. Pours fairly crystal clear bright golden amber color with a 2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of huge peach, mango, passion fruit, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, floral, grass, light pine, light honey, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with big complexity of bright citrus/tropical hops with a fair amount of malt balance; with great strength. Taste of big peach, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, floral, grass, light pine, light honey, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fair amount of earthy floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of peach, mango, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, floral, grass, light pine, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice robustness and complexity of citrus/tropical hop flavors with a fair amount of malt sweetness; with a crisp malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth, crisp, and slightly sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is an awesome session IPA! All around great complexity of bright hop flavors with a fair amount of malt balance; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

12 oz bottle from Evergreen Discount into a pint glass. Pale, golden and clear with a sticky white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus zest, biscuits, toasted malts and pine. Similar flavor, hoppy and moderately bitter with a crisp, semi-dry feel. Body is light to medium with ample carbonation. Plenty of flavor, easy to drink. There is light butterscotch notes in the aroma and flavor, unfortunately.

Poured from a bottle. Crystal clear, pale gold. Very little head. Lots of citrus on the nose. Piney flavor with some grapefruit. Slightly bitter aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy butterscotch with a medium off-white head that dissipates slowly leaving nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, passionfruit, a bit of pine - very nice actually. Flavor follows, very light sweetness, light bitterness. Surprisingly full flavored given ABV. Light body, perhaps a bit watery, but this is the best session IPA I have yet tried, I think.
12 oz bottle. Gold in color with a decent sized off-white head. Aroma is of grapefruit, pine, mango, and papaya. Taste is of pine, grass, lots of grapefruit, light onion and tropical fruits.

12oz bottle - nose is cat urine with a hint of hay. Lots of flavor for the ABV. Refreshing. Its the new style. Wilbekin got nothing but the top of the backboard LOL! Gators walk!!!! Lets go cats!!!!!

Lots of aroma. Not like the description at all. Theres some kind of nelson galaxy type tropicality, late harvest sulfur touch of dank. Tiny bits of pine and wee citrus melded into the touch of bitterness. Also absent is the heavy caramelization, light Maillard of Levitation and the associated bitterness. This is not very bitter. Just lots of hops burning bright. I like this beer a ton. I also love that I can drink it by the quart.

Very nice for a light session IPA. Has a great bite of grapefruit hops aroma. Pours golden with good head and lacing. Finishes with light to medium bitterness and some sourness with a little legging. Slick on palate. Tap at Churchkey.

This is amazing!! Hop bursting. I was skeptical. 4.5 abv is just bad ass for the shit this brings. It's pure hops bursting in your mouth. This beer is a session legend already. It's your grade A IPA. Flowing through in session. Hops don't hit you immediately like stone ipa. Yet, a great beer quenching middle that is surrounded by a hop burst that echoes into your ears and into you taste bud brain area. My review is phenomenal. 1st of this beer 6r from total wine az. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a mostly clear light amber color with a smallish white head on it. Nose is extremely hoppy, with a lot of resin elements to it. Taste is quite a bit bitter, yet remains very light, fresh and refreshing. Good brew.

My favorite session IPA to date. Huge floral and pine notes with a citrus backbone. Amber pour with just over a finger of white. Thin, easy drinking, bitter finish with a touch of grapefruit. Touch of juiciness at the end.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 Bottle into pint glass, clear golden color (very slight amber hue) with off-white head. Aroma of citrus hops and some malt sweetness backing. Taste is where this shines, strong citrus/grapefruity hop bitterness with some herbal notes. Light body, low carbonation, dry with lingering bitter finish. Much stronger then its light beer look, great session IPA.

Light up front with good hoppy aroma. Beer is a bit thin on mouth feel, interesting turn in the middle with the raw hops coming through. Ending is continued thinness with hop notes an some malty dryness. Some bitterness, but not much. Not a dazzler, but I get what they are doing...allowing hopheads something to pound a bit faster and in greater volume.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft- Bright gold color with almost no head or lacing. Aroma is very faint with light citrus and nit much else. Flavor is good, strong citrus and grapefruit with nice bitterness. Strong flavored for the low abv, clean and easy to drink. Okay overall but there are better session ipas

Tap. Lightly hazed but mostly clear orange gold. Loads of citrus and grapefruit happiness in the aroma, dry, some light fruit sweetness. Flavor is jam packed and comes across much more like a regular IPA, but still nice lots of citrus hops and slight crackery maltiness. Lighter bodied but has more heft than say Daytime.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Herbal, floral and citrus hop aromas. Flavor is a bit of a let down with grassy and some herbal tones.

Tasted from draft. Pours a clear gold with white head. Huge aroma. Very impressed. Big time pine and citrus notes with some floral notes as well. Aroma remains strong until glass is empty. Not sure what this hop bursting is but apparently it works. Taste is also is very hop prominent with pine and citrus bitter flavors. Way more flavor than other session IPAs I've had. Not quite as malt balanced as stones other IPAs but still very good. Quite impressive for the low ABV. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a beautiful transparent gold with a layer of off white head. Aroma of citrus and floral hops. Taste of upfront bitterness that pleasantly fades to oranges with a citrus balance.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2014 Brilliant clear,light gold, thin head with good lace. Has some stone fruit aromas with citrus particularly lemon, with some strongish resiny pine most noticeable when it warms,floral, body is smooth and light almost of a lager, light toast like malt character,slight caramel maybe.. Grapefruit/citrusy bitter finish, leaving some pine behind also.Floral. finishes clean and farily dry with some resiny/citrus hops. Really good for style.Might even like this better than founders- All day session ipa.

Draught at Publick House, 3/13/14Light golden, clear, with a nice white head that shows decent retention.Lovely fresh hop nose shows floral and light tropical notes. No heavy yeastiness or resin, though there is certainly a fair amount of acidity for its size. Wouldnt expect anything less from stone. Malts are nicely attenuated a la stone ipa. Its really just stone IPA with less malt, though importantly it dosent taste astringent or washed out. The texture is still full and round and soft from the malts. Fruity hops, bitter citric hops and a lush, green fullness on the finish. As good as any of the American session ipas that have come out thus far.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear orange-amber color with a small sticky white head. Aroma of grapefruit hops. Lots of grapefruit hops. Some pine notes as well. Flavor is mostly citrus, quite bitter, with a light and zippy mouthfeel. Extremely dry, almost no detectable malt in the flavor. Its kind of like grapefruit soda. If they made a hop soda it would probably taste like this. This is a fine example of my favorite style, but I probably wont buy it again. Ergo, "Go to IPA" is a misnomer.
On tap pours clear golden yellow with a small head and thin lacing. Nice hope, pine nose. Huge hope attack for a lower abv beer. Bitter finish. Surprisingly good beer.

Bottle and served in a nonic pint glass glass: Pours a clean straw hue with a fizzy fading head and minimal lace. The aroma is high alpha dank hops with some tropical fruit esters, biscuity malt background, minerally and slightly spicy. The taste is more of the same, oniony dank bitterness with little to no malt character. Resinous and minerally with a lot to keep me interested. Dry and somewhat chalky keeping it from being all that clean nor crisp as well. I do like this slightly more than the Boat but really these two brews are nothing more the hop water, give me a Founders All Day over either.

Draft at ChurchKey poured into a tasting snifter. Pours a clear straw yellow color with around a finger of off-white head. Decent lacing. Aromas of wheat, floral notes, citrus. Tasting notes of wheat, lemon/lime citrus, piney hops. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Really just more of a hopped up pale ale.
Pours golden yellow with nice white head. Strong notes of dank pine and citrus. Taste is similar, very clean and easy to drink. A very enjoyable session IPA.

Bottle. Pours a clear light golden-orange with a small head that fades to a thin ring. Fresh, perfumy hop aroma of oranges, pine, kiwi, melon, and flowers. Tastes like pine needles mixed with tropical and citrus fruit. Moderate bitter, floral bite in the finish. It lacks any malt character at all but its a session IPA so I guess its sorta supposed to be that way. Mouthfeel comes off thin and watery. Overall, great aroma and easy to drink but its not up there with my favorite session IPAs.

This one starts out great but lets you down in the end. It pours a bright golden color w/ a foamy head and good wall of lace. Its nose is wonderful w/ deep tangerine aromas and tropical fruit about but then it tastes watery w/ no malt backbone at all. The upside of this is its quite dry and therefor quite drinkable but there are ways to make a beer w/ malt flavor thats not overly sweet. It finishes w/ a nice firm bitterness but it is not nearly enough to make up for the lack of flavor in the middle. Close but no cigar as they used to say back in the day when people other than total douchebags smoked cigars.

12 ounce bottle, stamp says enjoy by 05/14/14. Served in a DFH IPA glass, the beer pours a slightly hazy gold color with about an inch white head. Head retention and lacing are both good. The brew smells like citrusy (grapefruit) hops, melon, and some bready malt. It tastes like citrusy (grapefruit, lemon peel) hops, bready malt, melon, mango, piney hops, and it also finishes bitter. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its crisp, smooth and easy to drink. I thought this was a good overall brew, Id buy this again.
Light crispy aroma. Sharp bitterness with not much other flavor. Was really expecting it to be better. Still not bad. Just not as drinkable for me as I would have thought.

On tap at Ashley's. Really nice hoppy and citrusy aroma. Pours a light clear amber. Pretty good taste if a little weak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fine session IPA with tons of hop aroma and taste. A bit too thin, and filtered, to be an prime IPA substitute.

Bright lemony pepper aroma worth a light white head. Bright golden color. Crisp citrus and hop start with a smooth light malt and slightly dry finish. F-ing great session beer. Cant wait to disc golf with it.

Bottle @ home. Clear golden pour with a white head. Big floral hops, slight soap, and lots of orange peel. Slight grass, plenty of pine, and a touch of toasted bread. Flavor has some popcorn and toasted. Fairly bitter taste. Pine and resinous hops are dominant with some floral hops. Mild grass. Nice bitter orange peel. A touch too bitter, but otherwise quite nice.

Draft. Poured clear copper color with an average white frothy head that mostly lasted with good to excellent lacing. Moderate citrus hop and small malt aroma. Medium to abundant body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Good drinkable brew that exceeded my expectations.

Bottle to glass. Pours a very clear pale yellow color with a thin white head. Aroma is magnificent, with tons of tropical fruits, citrus, fleshy fruit goodness. Flavor is much more mild, with a mild bitter, a touch of citrus and tropical fruits. Very light in body and quite drinkable. A fantastic session ipa for sure.

Smells of a terrific IPA! A great seasonal IPA for the porch on a hot day! Probably didnt help that I followed up a Hopslam with this IPA, but either way, this is a solid IPA that all should enjoy no matter what you are doing!

Pours gold into a shaker. Bright white head with little retention recedes to soap surface. Resin, tropical fruit and citrus aromas. Dry with sour tropical fruit upfront turning to grapefruit in the lasting finish.
Great session IPA. Nice dank grapefruit aromas and flavors. Great bitterness on the back end. All sessions should strive to be like this.

On tap at Dutchs. Clear golden color. Thin white head, with good retention. Leaves good dots and bits of lace. Very nice, big grassy hop nose. Pine, some light grapefruit citrus. Some light resin in the finish. Definitely a satisfying, big amount of hops, if thats what youre craving. I had high hopes for this, and I think it hit the mark. I was looking for a light but intensely hoppy session IPA, this delivers on that premise, where Great Divides Lasso fell a little short for me. For those turned off by the assertive bitterness and light hop bite of this beer, Id direct those to try Lasso. This Go To holds no stops in the hop department, but it also has a very satisfying malt bill that I enjoy just as much. A good clean but noticeable bready backbone to it, lightly peppery. Moderate to bigger bitterness, very little sweetness -- more of a dry finish. Light to medium body. Very smooth and easy-drinking, and even more so once its had a chance to sit and warm up for 20 minutes --- a great characteristic for a session beer to have. Great stuff, super easy-drinking, and very satisfyingly hoppy. The bigger bitter hop bite may be the only knock some may have on it (not of me). I could drink a lot of this. In fact I originally sat down with 10oz to rate it, I had to get back up to get 10oz more... Points for that. Cool job Stone. Itll be interesting to see how this sells at $11 a 6pack though, especially with cheaper competitors. Once Lagunitas Daytime hits Ohio, that could be a game changer (depending on how good it is -- I havent tried it just yet).

Wow I love this beer, finally a session IPA I can fully get behind. This pours a pretty clear straw color with about a finger of white head. The aroma shines with tropical fruity hops, pineapple, mango, papaya, grapefruit, lemon, watermelon, grass. Taste has a nice bitterness up front and the fruity hops take over in the middle and leaves with a bit of the grassiness and bitterness. The body is great for such a low ABV, it doesnt feel too thin or "light" for me. This really could become my number one "session" beer.

On tap at Hops and Pie poured a clear gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of straw, earthiness, grapefruit zest, pine and light dank bud. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, grapefruit, earthiness and pine with a crisp dry lingering bitter finish.
Very clear yellow pour thin white head. Citrus and fruit bowl aroma. Thin body, lots of fruit and grapefruit flavors. Refreshing. Really like this.
Bottle. Clear yellow/gold with a beige head. Strong floral and grapefruit hops. Thin malt and grapefruit pith.
Super hops aroma and finish. This is a tasty IPA and being a session near awesomeness as you can get. I loved this beer.

Tap at Maxs. Pours clear pale gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is pine, citrus, and herbal hops with light cracker malt. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness with light malt and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a pale gold with a thick off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of citrus, pine and mango. Crisp, bitter finish.

HUGE hop aroma from this very pale and clear beer. A little bit of yeast character in the aroma too. This is hop soda, which I actually do want sometimes. Tongue-scrapingly bitter and quite grassy. Not sure Id order this all the time necessarily, but I am certain that Stone achieved what they were going for. Side note: the "Session IPA" moniker is already tired and overused. Its an unbalanced American pale ale, and thats ok.

This tastes almost more like a grapefruit and pine soda than a beer. Its very light bodied and fizzy, kind of like some other light beers which shall not be used to compare this magnificent beast to. So so hoppy, bordering on insane, its got a great fruit backbone. This is a great beer, a good go to for anyone looking to drink all day with a passion for hops.

P: Golden yellow, almost in that fizzy yellow stage but a little darker then that with a two finger white head. S: Pine first hits with some grapefruit tagging along. Some herbal hops and a dose of malt in the back. T: Pine and floral hops coat the tounge, there is some caramel in the middle and it ends with some pine and caramel. M: Light but not crispy, has more of a watery mouthfeel, with a little bit of a pine bitterness in the back . O: While its good all the flavors are very light and this just feels like a water down ipa.
Bottle from Trader Joes. Medium golden in color. Strong pungent hoppy nose. Well hopped with a pungent sort of vegetal hop quality. Almost peppery. Not much sweetness. Tasty IPA.

Draft at the DC Craft Beer Festival. Poured a clear golden yellow color with a small white head. Aroma was a nice blast of hops, orange with some crisp light malts. Flavor was nice malt notes, crisp light citrus. Sweet malts. Drinkable.

12 ounce bottle purchased from Corti Brothers. The aroma on this is very pungent. I get citrus fruits, like melon and some onion character, too. Perhaps some earthiness. Curious as to what hop they used to dry hop this with. Transparent yellow body with a small, white head present. Starts with more hop flavors...earthy, mushroom like flavors. Malts are restrained and subdued. A little bland in the middle, before a moderate hoppy bitterness comes through in the finish. Herbal finish with more earthy and a little oniony flavor. This is a well-crafted brew, but I am not a huge fan of the hop bill that was used in this.

On draught at Winking Lizard. Pours a clear pale straw color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of grassy hops, fruit and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal hops, toasted malt and citrus. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering grapefruit and hops aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

Pours a goldisg color with a small bubbly white head. Aroma is definitely very hop forward, mostly good with heavy tropical fruits, but there is this odd lingering almost onion aroma Im picking up that throws me off a little bit.. Taste is nice, fruity, pine, bitter, mouthfeel is nice and refreshing. Not too bad, i will try again soon and see if that onion funk is there still or not.

Pours pale yellow with a fading off white head. Immediate aroma of soft pine. Immediate smash of pine that softens but lingers long. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy

Pours a lightly hazy golden with a medium bubbly white head that laced. Aroma of pine needles, a ton of citrusy American hops and mango. Flavor of dank hops, pine, grapefruit and tropical fruits. Very dry and pushing thin. Not sure if they did but I would have added some oats to a beer like this. Still love it though.

Pours a clear pale yellow with little to no head, a simple white ring of bubbles is all. Aroma is awesome! Smell is sweet of oranges, peach, and bubble gum, yet distinctly hoppy, Taste is grapefruit juice and pineapple with loads of evergreen thrown in. Mouthfeel is a bit thin but then again I suppose with a lighter-grain bill then a typical IPA this is to be expected. Not incredibly well balanced (and Stone is upfront about not trying to be) but yet the beer does sort of tie together cleanly towards the end of the sip with a slight sweetness and then lingering bitterness to finish. Crisp. Love the low ABV%. A winner from Stone I will drink this more often if I can find more.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Manzanita pint glass
From: Cherokee Market Beer & Wine in Normal Heights (San Diego), Calif. 
Price: $10.49 for a 6-pack
Purchased: March 9, 2014
Consumed: March 9, 2014
Misc.: N/A

Poured a golden clear color with two fingers of frothy white head. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom. Average layered lacing along the sides of the glass. Very good retention on the top all the way down.

Smelled a potent whiff of citrus hops and floral hops. Got grapefruit, grapefruit rind, tangerine, orange, piney, caramel and light honey. Pretty bitter overall.

Tasted not quite as good as the smell, but still good nonetheless. Got floral hops, citrus hops, grapefruit, grapefruit juice, grapefruit rind, piney notes, orange pulp and caramel notes.

Light body. Creamy-to-oily texture. Average-to-lively carbonation. Abrupt, bitter finish. Fairly refreshing.

Just a very good session IPA. So light and drinkable, Ill be trying more for sure.

Another great ipa from stone. Citrus and hoppy but a little thin on body. Smells fruity and is crushable. Had this in a bottle at home 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at hops and pie. Clear yeyllow gold with a frothy off white head that lasts abd laces. Aromas of citrus, lemon, pine resin and earthy grain. Flavor is sweet citrus, bitter pine and spice with some underlying earthy grain notes. Light bodied.

Another session IPA (lame). Pours a hazy "Stone IPA" golden with a creamy off-white head that settles to a ring and film and leaves a nice delicate lacing. Nose involves some green hops, pine, tropical fruit, grapefruit, green onion, and toasted malt. Slightly sweet, very bitter. Light bodied, watery, oily, with a drying tannic bitter hop finish. Nice brew, tastes good, but makes me want a bigger IPA. But thats just me. Session IPAs are awesome (no theyre not).

Clear yellow gold in color... Aroma of light pine and citrus hops... Flavor is slightly thin and watery, with fair amount of pine and floral hops throughout... Solid, sessionable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle,from the Beer Dispensary, Apex. Real good aroma, a lot going on. Pine and lemon zest are what Im getting right now, though kind of the full spectrum of usual IPA scents going on. Pale orangey gold color, small head that faded quick, little to no lace. bittersweet flavor. Light body, creamy mouthfeel,bitter finish. Very nice session IPA
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle @ The BeerMongers... Poured very clear pale, straw color with an ok forming head. Bright piney, earthy hops and super light mouthfeel. Hoppy IPA depth with the bitterness well balanced for its lower abv.

Vintage: 2014
Appearance: Transparent Golden Straw; White, bubbly head; Zero Lace
Smell: Dank; Pine; Nectarine; Resinous 
Taste: Dank; Pine; Peach; Orange Rind; Lingering bitterness
Mouth-feel: Low to medium carbonation; light body; Hollow middle ground; resinous finish
Overall: Really good SIPA; The hop-bursting is apparent in the aroma and flavour complexi

A powerful aroma of grapefruit with other citrus flavors. It pours light golden with a fluffy white head. It has a strong taste of grapefruit. There is also the taste of grapefruit peel. It has has floral flavors and a bitter finish.
12 ounce bottle. Huge nose, Tons of hops (Mosaic?). Tons of flavor. Light malt profile. Well balanced. Totally sessionable.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2015 Bottle poured into pint glass. Aroma is so much bigger than every session IPA I?ve ever had... huge tropical and citrus fruit hops with just a hint of pine resin and hay malt. Flavor is also much bigger and fuller than every session IPA, with the same profile as the aroma, but much bigger on the tropical fruit end with almost no hint of balancing from the malt.
(4 Hands Lupulin Festival - tap) citrus hops aroma. Flavor is citrus hops, body is a tad thin. But for a session IPA very flavorful.

Pours golden orange with a nice hop punch. Strong grapefruit and citrus flavors with little to no carbonation. Good session beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours transparent golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of floral, citrusy, and slightly piney hops, plus some light pale malts and light dough. Flavor the same with a nice hoppiness. Average to light texture. A solid session IPA.
12oz bottle pours a pale golden color without much head. Mild hop flavors though very prominent without the alcohol to balance.

12oz bottle pours out a light golden topped with a sand head. Nose is great citrus tropical fruit sweetness pine and malts. Taste is as the nose with a great hop bite. Easy drinking a very tasty brew.

Bottle from Save On. Beatiful gold with lasting flat head and lace. Nice grapefruit perfumy aroma. Mild toasted honey pineapple lemony fruity sweetness with some attempt at a malt backbone. Medium assertive grapefruit rind lingering finish with some lingering toasted sweetness. Light body with a little wateriness. Good enough but tastes almost fake in some way, overrefined. Good but not as enjoyable as others Ive had in the style.

Tap @ Stone OSide. Clear golden pour with a slick of white foam. Ultra dry bitter hop aroma with a thin bready malt backbone. Taste signature stone bitterness (albeit dialed back some) with light pine and a dry, clean malt backbone. Dry mouthfeel. Sharply bitter. Decent low ABV hop-centric beer.

Fresh bottle. Pours a darker yellow with a 1 finger white head that leaves nice lacing. Super intense aroma of oniony hops. Taste matches aroma. Aftertaste lingers forever. Mouthfeel is light. Great "light" IPA that will probably sell out constantly in the summer time. One of the most intense smelling and flavorful IPAs I have ever had. A must try....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle into pint glass. Pours a clear golden color. Head dissipates quickly leaving a thin lacing on glass. Aroma is Big time Hops. Taste is citrus, piney with light fruit. Was very amazed with the low alcohol content but has the huge hop presence of a higher octane IPA. Very Drinkable. Way to go Stone Brewing.

light gold with a white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit aroma with some pine tar. Flavor is overly bitter, but not crazy. Some citrus and pine notes, nothing crazy. Thin almost fleeting mouthfeel on this one. Bitterness is up front harsh but doesnt linger.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 Pours crystal clear golden color with white head. Big fruity aroma of citrus, pineapple, and mango. Smooth mouthfeel. Light sweet watery mango flavor up front and finishing with a piney, earthy, peppery hop finish. Some bitterness in finish but Not overly bitter.

Crystal clear straw yellow with a bright white head and minimal lace. Intense intense grapefruit hop aroma, accompanied by merely intense pine. Extreme hop bitterness with just a touch of offsetting graham cracker-like malt sweetness. Light body, lively carbonation, watery mouthfeel and a crisp finish. Hops are overpowering.
A clear golden beer with a small white head. The aroma and flavor are intensely piney with some citrus and tropical fruit.

Super resiny and piney smell. Great piney and lemon taste and well balanced 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy citrus, light-moderate tropical fruits, light mango, and grapefruit. It pours a transparent gold with a large white head that eventually fades to a soapy film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. There is a good amount of soapy webbing on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with a quick dose of citrus and tropical fruits. The finish has moderate pine, light grapefruit, and a hint of lemon peel. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, a tasty and super easy drinking Session IPA.
Gold with a white head. Nose is bursting with hops, bitter, light resin, and grapefruit. Easy palate, grapefruit, bitter, crisp, great finish.

Draught @ Brouwers Café: &nbsp Great color, vibrant and fiery, good carbonation and lacing. &nbsp This one smells and tastes very hoppy, yet its not all that biting. &nbsp Very flavorful and clean &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp If you want hops but not a lot of bitterness, this would be one to turn to. &nbsp Very easy drinking, however just about bordering on a stronger Pale Ale. &nbsp Still pretty damn tasty tho, easy, and clean!
Do yourself a favor........blind taste this against any competing IPA from another Brewery!!! I am a "Funnel Face" when it comes to this brew!!! Way too tasty and easy to drink!

12oz bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head. Citrus, pine, very bitter, light body, super drinkable. Very refreshing. I hope it becomes part of their regular lineup. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Straw yellow with a white head. Aromas of orange, grapefruit and pine. Less flavor than aroma. More pine. Bitter. Dry on the palate. Nice and light.
Super hoppy aroma, very piney and resinous. Pours clear straw with a white lacy head. Very very bitter flavor for such a light beer, very light finish.

12 ounce bottles poured into a snifter. Pours a clear, light copper with a small white head of foam. Aroma is grassy and herbal with just a little bit of tropical fruit sweetness coming through. It really dries out at the end and finishes much more bitter. Theres some lingering sweetness on the tongue after the swallow, but it stays fairly bitter throughout the taste. Light bodied with a medium to high level of carbonation.

Pours a transparent pale gold with a thick white head. Aroma is a ton of hops (citrus, tropical, pine, peach) atop a bit of grainy malt. Flavor follows - a lot of hop flavors, with a slightly sweet malt foundation. While a bit thin, this is surprisingly full bodied for a 4.5% IPA. The jurys still out, but this could possibly overtake Founders All Day as my favorite low ABV IPA.

12oz bottle. Enjoy by 5-25-14 on bottle. Stone has definitely accomplished what they intended. One of the best low alcohol hop bombs I've had thus far. Great aromatics.. Tons of dank, onion, pine, tropical fruit and mango aromas. Light, refreshing mouthfeel, with lower carbonation and mild bitterness in the finish. Super easy to drink! Similar flavors of pine resin, dank and mango linger softly on the the palate. I will definitely be drinking more of this on a warm day outside. Highly recommended for a session IPA. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Bottle sampled at Beer Run. Pours a clear pale golden color with a thin white head. Fair head retention. Aroma of intense dank hops with some herbal, floral and grapefruit hops. The taste is herbal, dank, melon, citrus hops and pale malts. Medium bodied.
Nice fruity hop aroma. Starts off well, with big juicy hop presence which gives way to a sweetness that drops off abruptly to an unpleasant, harsh bitterness. Drain pour.

Bottle. Pours with a clear golden hued body and a white head that lasts. Insanely fruity hop aroma with a lot of mosaic, citrus, tropical, peach, melon, jammy. Mild malt character. Flavors are bitter and dry. Mildly thin, light crackery malt. Citrusy, floral, tropical, stonefruit hop character. Dry with a bitter balance. Easy to drink. A touch watery. Lively carb. Gets a bit grassy in the finish. Quite tasty fresh.

Draft to pint at Dutchs. Looks good; a transparent light golden orange with foamy white head. Smells solid; all floral hops, all the way. Tastes Iike it smells, but much milder, with a touch of minerals. Average on the palate. Alright, but smells significantly better than it tastes.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours a clear yellow color with a large fluffy white head. Thearoma and flavor have citrus, resiny and dank hops (especially on the nose), pale malts, toasted bread, some earthy notes, and a mineral character to the flavor. Finish has mild to moderate bitterness, but is more than I would expect from a session IPA. The nose pops and is better than it tastes.

The beer pours crystal clear light gold with a small white head. The aroma has lots of tropical fruit, orange, citrus, floral notes, light pine and a bit of light caramel malt in the back. The body is between medium and thin with a bit of crispness and semi-sharp carbonation. The flavor starts out with a dry saltine cracker aspect along with hops that are more on the earthy / piney / grapefruit zest side with just a bit of the tropical fruit brightness from the aroma. The finish is clean and crisp and has a mineral taste that seems to be with most of the session ipa beers. Pretty enjoyable.

Bottle, released yesterday so assuming pretty dang fresh. Popped it open and the aroma jumped out. Big time fresh hop smell. Pours beautifully, pretty much what youd hope for. Flavor was good but pretty typical for the "session IPA" style. Its as you might expect, hop bitterness without quite the malt backbone to balance it. I love hops as much as the next hop freak but these session IPAs just kinda bore me. 

I understand the difficulty of brewing a delicious, hoppy, low ABV beer. Im just never knocked out by this style. Im gonna enjoy this, Ill probably buy it again. I appreciate what Stone does and what they did here but truth be told Im not the biggest fan, so I cant so Im underwhelmed. Better than a lot of sub-5% beers out there, just not a personal favorite.

Pours a crystal clear light gold with a small head. Lacing is minimal. Aroma is of citrus, floral, and light pine. Flavor is strong floral with pine and citrus notes and finishes light without a bitter bite. Nice session IPA!
